Title: Fraud Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You’ll Do & Who You Are

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Fraud Data Analyst to join our Content & Safety team. The Fraud Data Analyst will play a critical role in protecting our users and platform by identifying, analysing, and mitigating fraudulent activities. This position requires a strong analytical mindset, proficiency in data analysis tools, and a passion for problem-solving.

Key Responsibilities

  • Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to identify patterns and trends indicative of fraudulent behaviour;
  • Fraud Detection: Help develop and implement fraud detection models and rules to proactively identify and prevent fraudulent activities and non-compliant behaviours in general;
  • Reporting: Prepare and present regular reports on fraud trends, detection rates, and mitigation efforts to management and stakeholders;
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Product, and Customer Support, to investigate and resolve fraud cases;
  • Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date on the latest fraud trends and techniques, and continuously improve fraud detection and prevention strategies.

Key Skills And Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or Master's Degree;
  • Experience: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in fraud detection, risk management or Trust & Safety area;
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills;
  • Knowledge of SQL and Python;
  • Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau) would be a plus;
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills;
  • English proficiency (written and verbal)

Your Identikit

  • Detail-oriented: Ability to identify subtle patterns and anomalies in data;
  • Proactive: Takes initiative to identify and address potential fraud risks;
  • Collaborative: Works effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals;
  • Adaptable: Thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic environment;
  • Ethical: Maintains high standards of integrity and confidentiality.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Choreograph is the global data and technology business unit in GroupM. It unifies the data, analytics, technology consulting, and technology expertise across the GroupM network in a dedicated unit that enhances data and analytics services and deploy best-in-class media planning, activation, and measurement tool and methodologies.

We are looking for a Data Ananlyst to join our Measurement team, composed by 22 Consultants. The team is young, talented, and dynamic.

The candidate will work closely with both internal WPP/GroupM Agencies and external clients on business with the aim to provide strategic and tactical insight in order to optimize marketing investments and maximize ROI.

Responsibilities


Measure and analyze impact of marketing activities on client business goals
Analyze different type of metrics like business data, macro-economic dynamics, web analytics, media and marketing investments, promotion, call center data and other relevant factors
Develop Marketing Mix Models, Regression Based Attribution Models, Multi-touch Attribution and other analytical solutions to provide data driven recommendation supporting media investment allocation and planning
Evaluate different Marketing and Media Scenarios, forecasting business results and supporting marketing strategy
Manage the relationships with internal and external stakeholders, to lead the whole analysis process, from data collection up to final presentation and discussion with the client
Design and develop performance reports, defining the Key metrics & actionable insight


About You


A curious and data-oriented mindset, with economic-mathematic-statistic background
Strong analytical skills set and problem solving
Excellent communication and presentation skills, combined with the ability to collaborate across teams
Strong interest for the interpretation of business data
Excel and PowerPoint proficient
Knowledge of the English language
Have a strong orientation toward team working, collaboration and support of colleagues, while always maintaining a positive approach
3+ years of working experience


The knowledge of the following will be considered as a plus:


Previous experience with Marketing Mix Modeling/Econometric Modeling
BI tools like PowerBI, Data Studio, Tableau, QlikView
Python/R/Sql/Google Cloud Platform/Scripting Skills
Previous experience in a Consulting/Analytic Roles


LOCATION

WPP Campus in Milan (plus the option for hybrid working).

We are proud to have a team made up of individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that this diversity is a strength. This position is also open to individuals belonging to Categorie Protette under Law 68/99.

requisitionid:18548

Responsibilities

  • Measure and analyze impact of marketing activities on client business goals
  • Analyze different type of metrics like business data, macro-economic dynamics, web analytics, media and marketing investments, promotion, call center data and other relevant factors
  • Develop Marketing Mix Models, Regression Based Attribution Models, Multi-touch Attribution and other analytical solutions to provide data driven recommendation supporting media investment allocation and planning
  • Evaluate different Marketing and Media Scenarios, forecasting business results and supporting marketing strategy
  • Manage the relationships with internal and external stakeholders, to lead the whole analysis process, from data collection up to final presentation and discussion with the client
  • Design and develop performance reports, defining the Key metrics & actionable insight

About You

  • A curious and data-oriented mindset, with economic-mathematic-statistic background
  • Strong analytical skills set and problem solving
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, combined with the ability to collaborate across teams
  • Strong interest for the interpretation of business data
  • Excel and PowerPoint proficient
  • Knowledge of the English language
  • Have a strong orientation toward team working, collaboration and support of colleagues, while always maintaining a positive approach
  • 3+ years of working experience

The knowledge of the following will be considered as a plus:

  • Previous experience with Marketing Mix Modeling/Econometric Modeling
  • BI tools like PowerBI, Data Studio, Tableau, QlikView
  • Python/R/Sql/Google Cloud Platform/Scripting Skills
  • Previous experience in a Consulting/Analytic Roles

LOCATION

WPP Campus in Milan (plus the option for hybrid working).

We are proud to have a team made up of individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that this diversity is a strength. This position is also open to individuals belonging to Categorie Protette under Law 68/99.

Title: Stage Fraud Data Analyst
HTML:
🌟CHI SIAMO

Leroy Merlin è parte del gruppo internazionale Adeo. La nostra missione è aiutare gli abitanti a dare forma ai loro progetti di casa e di vita, con soluzioni utili ad impatto positivo. Vogliamo offrire al cliente la migliore esperienza di acquisto omnicanale.

Per noi le persone sono al centro. Tutti insieme ci impegniamo a creare un ambiente di lavoro positivo ed inclusivo. Viviamo relazioni autentiche, basate sulla fiducia reciproca, verso il miglioramento continuo delle nostre competenze e performance.


🎁COSA OFFRIAMO

Uno stage della durata di 6 mesi, attivabile sia in forma curricolare che extracurricolare, in cui sarai stimolato verso una crescita professionale e una formazione continua: sarai accolto, in un contesto dinamico e multinazionale, dove potrai accrescere le tue competenze in ambito Fraud Data Analytics.

Collaborando con il team Audit, Risk & Internal Control, e le diverse direzioni aziendali di riferimento, ti occuperai della creazione di dashboard/reportistica (data visualization) ed esplorazione e analisi del dato digitale (data analysis).

Smart Working e work life balance: Leroy Merlin riconosce l’importanza di un corretto equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale.

Dotazioni aziendali: forniamo uno smartphone aziendale ed un notebook aziendale con caratteristiche tecniche all’avanguardia.

Mensa aziendale: potrai usufruire del nostro servizio mensa quando trascorrerai la giornata di lavoro in ufficio.

Ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e positivo: favoriamo costantemente un clima di lavoro favorevole, dove ognuno si possa sentire valorizzato.


🚀 RESPONSABILITÀ

Siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire in stage che ricoprirà il ruolo di Fraud Data Analyst, avrai l'opportunità di contribuire attivamente all'analisi dei dati per identificare e prevenire le frodi. Lavorerai a stretto contatto con data scientist e analisti esperti, acquisendo competenze pratiche in un ambiente dinamico e stimolante.

In affiancamento al Tutor e ai membri del team, avrai possibilità di focalizzarti su:

  • Creazione di reportistica e dashboard automatizzati con tool di data visualization per il monitoraggio del dato [tool di riferimento PowerBI e Looker];
  • Supporto all’analisi dei dati per identificare schemi e possibili frodi;
  • Supporto allo sviluppo e implementazione di modelli di rilevamento frodi, e monitoring continuo delle anomalie;
  • Collaborazione con altri dipartimenti per migliorare i processi di prevenzione;
  • Opportunità di interazione con le altre Business Units italiane del gruppo ADEO: Bricocenter e Tecnomat.


✅ QUALIFICHE E COMPETENZE

  • Laurea triennale/magistrale in discipline quantitative (es. Statistica, Matematica, Informatica, Ingegneria Gestionale);
  • Conoscenza avanzata di Excel/Gsheet (funzioni principali e tabelle pivot) e PPT/Gslide;
  • Conoscenza e/o interesse per linguaggi di programmazione (SQL);
  • Conoscenza e/o interesse per Power BI/Looker;
  • Conoscenza e/o interesse nell’utilizzo di tecnologie AI;
  • Fluente in Inglese e/o francese;
  • Perseveranza e problem solving;
  • Curiosità e proattività.


Leroy Merlin è un datore di lavoro che rispetta le pari opportunità. Accogliamo con favore le candidature di tutti i membri della società e crediamo che l'impiego di una forza lavoro diversificata sia fondamentale per il nostro successo.

Vuoi raggiungere la squadra Leroy Merlin? Inoltra la tua candidatura!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
Pardgroup S.p.A, società leader operante nei settori del Marketing Operativo sulla GDO/GDS, dei Servizi Retail e delle vendite, in ottica di potenziamento del proprio organico, ricerca una figura di Business Intelligence Analyst da inserire in organico.


La risorsa, inserita all’interno della divisione Business Intelligence, dovrà svolgere le seguenti attività:

  • Analisi dati provenienti dal field e dal cliente;
  • Aggregazione dati, individuando le metodologie di analisi più idonee;
  • Progettazione Dashboard in Tableau e costruzione di Dataset;
  • Interpretazione del dato e analisi critica dello stesso;
  • Predisposizione di presentazioni relative alle analisi eseguite.


Il/la candidato/a ideale possiede i seguenti requisiti:

  • Precedente esperienza almeno di 1/2 anni in ruolo analogo;
  • Laurea ad indirizzo tecnico/scientifico;
  • Eccellente conoscenza di Excel;.
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • Buona conoscenza di almeno un tool di ETL (in particolar modo Prep);
  • Ottime capacità analitiche e di problem solving


Nice to have: conoscenza di Tableau e del linguaggio SQL


Completano il profilo attitudine nella gestione del cliente e spiccate capacità relazionali e comunicative.


"Pardgroup Spa informa che la ricerca è rivolta ai candidati di ambo i sessi (L. 903/77 e L. 125/91). Ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento 679/2016 (GDPR) i dati sensibili e particolari comunicati dal candidato tramite l'invio del CV sono raccolti e trattati secondo quanto indicato nella normativa privacy accessibile al seguente link (https://www.pardgroup.com/privacy-policy) e per quanto occorrer possa, con l'invio dello stesso CV, il candidato ne autorizza il trattamento"

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern


Quantitative modelling of business processes
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients –
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive


What You Need To Know


Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
Fluent English


We Are Looking For Someone Who


is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Choreograph is the global data and technology business unit in GroupM. It unifies the data, analytics, technology consulting, and technology expertise across the GroupM network in a dedicated unit that enhances data and analytics services and deploy best-in-class media planning, activation, and measurement tool and methodologies.

We are looking for a Data Ananlyst to join our Measurement team, composed by 22 Consultants. The team is young, talented, and dynamic.

The candidate will work closely with both internal WPP/GroupM Agencies and external clients on business with the aim to provide strategic and tactical insight in order to optimize marketing investments and maximize ROI.

Responsibilities


Measure and analyze impact of marketing activities on client business goals
Analyze different type of metrics like business data, macro-economic dynamics, web analytics, media and marketing investments, promotion, call center data and other relevant factors
Develop Marketing Mix Models, Regression Based Attribution Models, Multi-touch Attribution and other analytical solutions to provide data driven recommendation supporting media investment allocation and planning
Evaluate different Marketing and Media Scenarios, forecasting business results and supporting marketing strategy
Manage the relationships with internal and external stakeholders, to lead the whole analysis process, from data collection up to final presentation and discussion with the client
Design and develop performance reports, defining the Key metrics & actionable insight


About You


A curious and data-oriented mindset, with economic-mathematic-statistic background
Strong analytical skills set and problem solving
Excellent communication and presentation skills, combined with the ability to collaborate across teams
Strong interest for the interpretation of business data
Excel and PowerPoint proficient
Knowledge of the English language
Have a strong orientation toward team working, collaboration and support of colleagues, while always maintaining a positive approach
3+ years of working experience


The knowledge of the following will be considered as a plus:


Previous experience with Marketing Mix Modeling/Econometric Modeling
BI tools like PowerBI, Data Studio, Tableau, QlikView
Python/R/Sql/Google Cloud Platform/Scripting Skills
Previous experience in a Consulting/Analytic Roles


LOCATION

WPP Campus in Milan (plus the option for hybrid working).

We are proud to have a team made up of individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that this diversity is a strength. This position is also open to individuals belonging to Categorie Protette under Law 68/99.

Title: Junior Digital Analyst
HTML:
A proposito di fifty-five: 

fifty-five è una data-company di un nuovo genere che aiuta i brand a sfruttare i dati per migliorare il marketing, i media e l'esperienza del cliente grazie a una combinazione di servizi di consulenza e tecnologia specializzata, pilastro del Brandtech Group nel settore data e marketing, propone un'ampia gamma di servizi che fondono consulenza strategica, services cloud, expertise media e miglioramento della customer experience.

fifty-five conta più di 400 esperti digitali. Consulenti digitali, specialisti di tracking e media, ingegneri e data scientist lavorano in sinergia per fornire consulenze di marketing di alto livello e assistenza tecnica ai brand in tutti i settori, in tutto il mondo.

Come partner fidato degli inserzionisti nella gestione dei dati per la loro raccolta, attivazione e valorizzazione,  supportiamo le organizzazioni nel divenire realtà omnicanale efficaci attraverso la gestione dell'ecosistema digitale e l'integrazione con il mondo fisico.

Con sede a Parigi, operiamo su 3 fusi orari dai nostri 10 uffici situati a Parigi, Londra, Ginevra, Milano, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore e New York. Fifty-five attribuisce particolare importanza al benessere dei suoi collaboratori.

Contesto: 

Dopo una fase di onboarding approfondito nel nostro ufficio di Milano, utilizzerete la vostra expertise delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag management systems (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.

Mansioni: 

In qualità di Junior Digital Analyst, farete leva sulla vostra padronanza tecnica delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag manager (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.

Il vostro ruolo sarà di: 

  • Implementazione tecnica delle soluzioni tracking dei siti web/mobile o app del cliente, dalla raccolta delle esigenze alla raccolta effettiva dei dati di cui garantirete qualità e affidabilità; 
  • Gestire i progetti a contatto con il cliente (garantendo l'avanzamento delle missioni, pianificazione, strategia di test, consegne) sulle problematiche di raccolta dati Analytics e Media; 
  • Condividere le vostre conoscenze e competenze con i clienti e internamente; 
  • Mantenere un collegamento permanente con i diversi attori lato cliente/integratore;
  • Sviluppare un know-how operativo dettagliato (TMS & Analytics); 
  • Sviluppare nuove opportunità di business in collaborazione con i consulenti responsabili del conto; 
  • Partecipare alla definizione dei prodotti e degli strumenti interni dell'azienda; 
  • Partecipare alla concezione e al posizionamento dell'offerta tecnologica di fifty-five.


Profilo ricercato: 

Laureato/a in discipline STEM o economia , con 1 o 2 anni di esperienza nella gestione di progetti di Tracking / Misurazione / Web Analytics.

Competenze: 

  • Esperienza nella gestione progetti interfacciandosi con team digitali ed IT;
  • Conoscenza dei principali strumenti di web analytics  (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, AT Internet...); Tag Management System (GTM, Launch, Tealium, Commanders Act, ...)
  • Conoscenze di JavaScript (comprensione e sviluppo di logiche semplici) e Web in generale; 
  • Forte spirito analitico; 
  • Eccellente comunicazione orale e scritta; 
  • Grande passione per le tecnologie e il settore di internet; 
  • Competenze in ambiente mobile sono un plus; 
  • Conoscenze del funzionamento dei CMP sono un plus; 
  • Buona capacità di proporre soluzioni perfettamente in linea con le esigenze; 
  • Buon livello sia di italiano che di inglese.

I vantaggi di lavorare in fifty-five: 

  • Politica di smart working;
  • Particolare attenzione all'equilibrio vita privata / vita professionale nel rispetto del diritto alla disconnessione; 
  • Un ambiente multiculturale con collaboratori di oltre 20 nazionalità diverse; 
  • Valori interni incentrati sull'eccellenza, la benevolenza e la condivisione;
  • Formazione continua (e riconosciuta) sull'ecosistema, le tecnologie digitali e sulle soft skills (es: public speaking, gestione del team ecc.);
  • Possibilità di partecipare a progetti interni come Data Hive (un progetto "tech for good" promosso dai dipendenti di fifty-five, il cui scopo è mettere le loro conoscenze e competenze a disposizione di organizzazioni benefiche), DEI@55 (un gruppo di lavoro sui temi della diversità e dell'inclusione all'interno di fifty-five e della tecnologia più in generale), Sustainability@55 (un team che aiuta a implementare pratiche sostenibili internamente e presso i nostri clienti).

In fifty-five, siamo convinti che la diversità e l'inclusione siano vere forze. Ci impegniamo a garantire parità di trattamento di tutte le candidature ricevute, senza distinzione di genere, età, origine, orientamento sessuale, stato di salute o opinione politica o religiosa. Incontra il team di fifty-five!

Localizzazione: Corso Giacomo Matteotti 1, CAP 20121 Milano

Tipo di contratto: Contratto di lavoro a tempo pieno e indeterminato

Salario: in base all'esperienza

Title: Data Analyst & Engineer - Analytics Engineer - BI developer Intern
Description:
Descrizione dell'azienda

Enpal persegue il sogno di costruire la più grande community di energia rinnovabile al mondo.

Vendiamo impianti fotovoltaici, accumulatori di energia e wallbox con una tariffa all-inclusive, combinando una tariffa elettrica ecologica a basso costo con una soluzione integrata completa.

Fedele al motto "digitale, decentralizzato e 100% rinnovabile", il nostro cuore batte sia per il rapido sviluppo dell'azienda che per combattere il cambiamento climatico.

Descrizione del lavoro

Stiamo cercando un/a stagista motivato/a per il ruolo di Data Analyst & Engineer - Analytics Engineer - BI developer all'interno del team di Sales Operations di Enpal Italia. In questo ruolo, lavorerai a stretto contatto con il nostro Head of Sales Operations per analizzare e ottimizzare il funnel di vendita, migliorando l'efficienza attraverso un’analisi dettagliata dei dati e dei processi aziendali. Se sei una persona curiosa, dinamica e pronta a contribuire con idee fresche in un ambiente startup non strutturato, questa è la tua opportunità!

Ruolo e responsabilità


Analizzare dati provenienti da fonti diverse e trasformarli in insight fruibili.
Sviluppare e gestire pipeline di dati utilizzando Python (preferibile conoscenza di Airflow per l’orchestrazione).
Creare dashboard e report in Power BI, sfruttando Power Query, DAX e una solida comprensione dei tipi di relazione e del modello semantico.
Utilizzare SQL per l’estrazione, la manipolazione e la gestione dei dati, specialmente in ambiente PostgreSQL e Snowflake.
Collaborare con diversi team interni per comprendere le esigenze di business e tradurle in soluzioni analitiche.
Essere curioso e disponibile ad apprendere nuove competenze tecniche in modo continuo.



Qualifiche


Conoscenze di base/intermedie di Python.
Padronanza di Power BI: Power Query, DAX, comprensione delle relazioni tra tabelle e progettazione di modelli semantici.
Familiarità con Excel.
Buona conoscenza di SQL e database relazionali.
Mentalità analitica, spirito di iniziativa e attitudine al problem solving.



Formazione


Laurea STEM, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science o discipline affini, preferibilmente accompagnati da basi di programmazione e database.



Soft Skill


Curiosità e voglia di sperimentare nuove tecnologie.
Capacità di lavoro in team e buona comunicazione con i diversi stakeholder.



Informazioni aggiuntive


Crescita professionale: Enpal è il posto ideale per crescere, imparare e svilupparsi in un settore in rapida evoluzione.
Ambiente stimolante: Siamo una startup internazionale, giovane e dinamica, con la possibilità di lavorare su progetti sfidanti e innovativi.
Impatto positivo: Contribuirai attivamente alla missione di portare l'energia solare e le soluzioni sostenibili a milioni di persone in tutto il mondo.



La Nostra Offerta


Lavoro in sede zona Centrale/Repubblica
Tipologia di lavoro: Stage di 6 mesi con possibilità di stabilizzazione
Indennità di partecipazione: 750€ lordi
Orario di lavoro 09:00 - 18:00 dal lunedì al venerdì
Show more

Title: Data Platform Specialist – Stage
HTML:
Società

Banca Mediolanum

Data Platform Specialist – Stage

Banca Mediolanum è un'organizzazione che ridefinisce il panorama finanziario con oltre tre decenni di innovazione. Attraverso le società che ne fanno parte, si dedica a fornire servizi finanziari, bancari e assicurativi su misura che rispondano alle esigenze uniche di ogni cliente.

La Banca si impegna a costruire relazioni durature basate sulla fiducia, trasparenza e sull'attenzione ai dettagli.

La nostra è una realtà dinamica, fondata su relazioni, responsabilità e libertà. La nostra cultura promuove la positività, la responsabilità e l’innovazione sostenibile.

Siamo convinti che il successo di un'azienda sia il risultato del successo individuale dei suoi membri. In Gruppo Mediolanum ti offriamo più di un lavoro: l'opportunità di contribuire a un cambiamento positivo e di crescere insieme a noi.

Per la Direzione ICT stiamo cercando una figura di Data Platform Specialist – Stage.

Nel team Data Platform e Business Intelligence la risorsa entrerà in stage e sarà responsabile delle seguenti attività:


  • Contribuire al team di sviluppo tecnologico e funzionale della Data Platform aziendale, in linea con i principi di Data Governance e Data Quality richiesti dalle normative del settore;
  • Collaborare all’analisi e alla documentazione dei requisiti funzionali per l’evoluzione delle soluzioni applicative del mondo dati, dalla raccolta (Data Injestion) alla presentazione (reporting, dashboarding e data-services);
  • Contribuire alle attività progettuali, dalla raccolta requisiti, all’analisi tecnico/funzionale, al supporto alla progettazione, sviluppo e roll out in produzione;
  • Interagire con gli utenti di business, con le altre funzioni interne alla Divisione ICT e con i fornitori esterni, coinvolti nelle attività;


Requisiti:


  • Laure in Ingegneria, Informatica, Statistica o equivalente;
  • Conoscenza di base ed interesse per il settore bancario e assicurativo;
  • Familiarità con i requisiti normativi relativi ai temi di Data Governance (BCBS 239, Bankit 285, GDPR, ecc…);
  • Forte interesse per l’analisi dei dati e familiarità con le tematiche di Data Management (Glossario Business, Dizionario dei Dati, Data Lineage, Data Quality) e Data Analytics;
  • Buone capacità di problem solving, team working, comunicazione, proattività, attitudine analitica e attenzione e cura dei dettagli;
  • Conoscenza avanzata Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project), conoscenza di base di SQL e strumenti di BI;
  • Esperienza accademica o personale con linguaggi di programmazione per la gestione dei dati (Python, Spark, SQL);
  • Conoscenza di strumenti cloud (Azure è un plus);


Cosa offriamo:


  • Servizio navetta da/per Milano Famagosta (M2) / San Donato Milanese (M3);
  • Hybrid-work;
  • Formazione continua su tecnologie e metodologie avanzate nel campo della Data Platform e dell’Intelligenza Artificiale;
  • Possibilità di crescita professionale in un team innovativo e dinamico;
  • Coinvolgimento in progetti sfidanti, con impatto strategico per l'azienda;


Sede di lavoro:


  • Basiglio – Milano 3 City;


I dati richiesti verranno trattati nell’assoluto rispetto delle disposizioni contenute nel Regolamento Europeo 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR” o “Normativa Privacy”) e sue successive modificazioni ed integrazioni.

E’ possibile visionare l’informativa di Banca Mediolanum SPA, accedendo al seguente link: https://www.bancamediolanum.it/privacy/candidature.

Il Gruppo Mediolanum si impegna a garantire la parità di trattamento a tutti i candidati secondo i principi di Diversity and Inclusion.

Verranno presi in considerazione solo i curricula in linea con i requisiti minimi richiesti.

Title: STAGISTA DATA ANALYST
Description:
Azienda specializzata nei servizi informativi per le vendite e il marketing delle aziende che operano nel largo consumo e leader dell'attività di in-store marketing, ricerca, per la propria sede di Milano, una figura di Analista Dati.

Posizione:

LA RISORSA SARA' AFFIANCATA E FORMATA RISPETTO LE SEGUENTI MANSIONI E ATTIVITA':


data processing (dal dato grezzo al report di sintesi)
gestione basi dati: data quality analysis e validazione dei dati ricevuti
analisi dei KPIs delle varie attività
redazione reportistica (rispetto delle deadline e dei tempi di consegna del dato)


Requisiti:

COMPETENZE TECNICHE gradite:


Microsoft Office (in particolare Excel)
Power BI, Qlik o altri sistemi di Business Intelligence
Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di Programmazione (preferibile python / php)


La ricerca è rivolta ad ambo-sessi, laureati e neo-laureati in materie statistico/economiche che abbiano interesse per l’analisi dei dati, con le seguenti SOFT SKILLS:


Buone capacità di analisi dati
Predisposizione all'analisi numerica
Precisione
Buona capacità di relazione e team working
Buone capacità organizzative e gestione priorità


Altre informazioni:

Contratto: stage di 6 mesi con finalità di assunzione

Contratto di lavoro: full time dal lunedì al venerdì dalle 9.00 alle 18.00

Sede di lavoro: zona stazione Centrale - Milano

Modalità di lavoro: ibrida

Lo stage si intende retribuito.

Title: Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT WEROAD: CONNECTING PEOPLE, CULTURES, AND STORIES

Founded in 2017, WeRoad is a fast-growing startup that is disrupting the travel industry in Italy, Spain, UK, Germany, France and Switzerland!

With 200 team members and 3K Travel Coordinators, we’re a community of travelers who turn every trip into a life-changing experience. We connect like-minded millennials and send them on adventures to 900+ destinations worldwide.

Our mission is to become the greatest community passionate about discovering the world and making new friends.

Sounds exciting? Before you apply, please read through our Cultural Manifesto 👥


ABOUT THE ROLE

JOB TITLE: Portfolio Analyst

LOCATION: Milan - our HQ (Hybrid)

TYPE OF CONTRACT: Permanent

SALARY RANGE: 26K to 36K depending on seniority

We are seeking a Portfolio Analyst to join our Tour Operator team and support our efforts in managing and optimizing the portfolio of travel products and services. This role is reporting to the Head of the Tour Operator and will be critical in ensuring that our offerings are aligned with market trends, customer preferences, and financial objectives, while driving strategic insights that contribute to the overall success of our tour operator operations.

The Portfolio Analyst will be responsible for evaluating the performance of various tour products, analyzing customer data, and identifying opportunities for portfolio diversification and improvement. This role will also involve collaborating with cross-functional teams to assess current market conditions, competitor offerings, and industry developments, helping to inform strategic decisions and enhance the competitiveness of our travel packages.

What you'll do:

Supply Analysis: analyze the performance of the tour operator portfolio, including product offerings, pricing, and market demand, to identify areas for improvement and growth.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams: work closely with the Product Development, Supply, Commercial and Data team to ensure portfolio strategies are aligned with business goals and customer needs. Make sure insights are effectively integrated into the overall business strategy

Trend identification and optimization: monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer feedback to provide actionable insights that help shape product offerings and drive competitive advantage.

Data reporting: develop and maintain performance metrics and dashboards to track the success of portfolio initiatives, ensuring key performance indicators (KPIs) are met.

Data-Driven Insights: respond to ad-hoc data requests by building high-quality datasets and conducting in-depth analysis to provide actionable insights.

What we’re looking for:

Experience: 1-2 years of experience in data analysis, or portfolio analysis, product management, or a related field.

Strong technical and analytical mindset with a love for digging into data to uncover insights: you're naturally curious and enjoy using data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. You're not afraid to get your hands dirty and dive deep into datasets to find answers.

Experience with SQL (BigQuery, PostgreSQL, MySQL) and the ability to extract and manipulate data efficiently. You're comfortable writing SQL queries to retrieve data from relational databases. You understand how to join tables, filter data, and aggregate results to get the information you need.

Good knowledge of Data Visualization tools like Tableau or equivalent. You can create clear and compelling visualizations that communicate data insights effectively. You know how to choose the right chart type for the data and how to format it for maximum impact.

Ability to develop and track performance KPIs and create compelling reports. You can identify the key metrics that drive business success and track them over time. You can also create reports that summarize data insights and make recommendations for action.

Problem-Solving: Ability to identify opportunities for optimization and growth within the product portfolio and develop data-driven strategies to address them.

Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights in a clear and compelling manner to stakeholders at all levels.

Adaptability: Comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with the ability to adapt to changing market conditions and business priorities.




You will love working at WeRoad if:

You dream big, aim higher, and push yourself beyond limits you didn’t think possible. Challenges excite you, and you’re hungry for the next win.

You want to be part of a young, smart, and fun team that shares your passion for travel. You thrive in a community of bold thinkers and doers who challenge and inspire each other.

You’re an entrepreneur at heart, take responsibility from day one, and move fast to make things happen.

You prefer adventure over routine and embrace the fast-paced, ever-changing ride of a scaleup. You make decisions quickly, test, learn, and adapt—because growth comes from action.

You believe in the power of people. Our WeRoaders and Travel Coordinators are at the core of everything we do, and you’re eager to be part of something bigger.




What we can offer

A free WeRoad trip every year – Choose your dream destination… or travel even more as a Travel Coordinator.

A buzzing workspace – Join our vibrant co-working space and community.

Opportunities to learn – We invest in your growth with training and learning opportunities.

Best-in-class benefits – Generous parental leave, wedding & baby bonus

Unlimited holiday – You are a master of your own time. And your birthday? Take a half-day off, always.

Fun – Team events, Travel Coordinator meet-ups, and unforgettable moments.

Hybrid working - Flexible working, and we support you to work from your destination of choice up to 1 month per year.




Ready to apply?

The selection process will consist of:

introductory call with P&C

technical and background-based interview with Hiring Manager

business case

business case review with key stakeholders

WeRoad is an equal opportunity employer: we consider for employment all applicants, regardless of their race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, family status, political affiliation, disability, and any other legally protected characteristic.

Statistically speaking, women are less likely to apply for roles where they don't fit the job description perfectly. DON'T TRY AND BE PERFECT but just go for it and send us your application regardless.

  • You’re an entrepreneur at heart, take responsibility from day one, and move fast to make things happen.

  • You prefer adventure over routine and embrace the fast-paced, ever-changing ride of a scaleup. You make decisions quickly, test, learn, and adapt—because growth comes from action.

  • You believe in the power of people. Our WeRoaders and Travel Coordinators are at the core of everything we do, and you’re eager to be part of something bigger.


What we can offer

  • A free WeRoad trip every year – Choose your dream destination… or travel even more as a Travel Coordinator.

  • A buzzing workspace – Join our vibrant co-working space and community.

  • Opportunities to learn – We invest in your growth with training and learning opportunities.

  • Best-in-class benefits – Generous parental leave, wedding & baby bonus

  • Unlimited holiday – You are a master of your own time. And your birthday? Take a half-day off, always.

  • Fun – Team events, Travel Coordinator meet-ups, and unforgettable moments.

  • Hybrid working - Flexible working, and we support you to work from your destination of choice up to 1 month per year.


Ready to apply?

The selection process will consist of:

  1. introductory call with P&C

  2. technical and background-based interview with Hiring Manager

  3. business case

  4. business case review with key stakeholders

WeRoad is an equal opportunity employer: we consider for employment all applicants, regardless of their race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, family status, political affiliation, disability, and any other legally protected characteristic.

Statistically speaking, women are less likely to apply for roles where they don't fit the job description perfectly. DON'T TRY AND BE PERFECT but just go for it and send us your application regardless.

Title: BOTTEGA VENETA Business Intelligence Assistant
HTML:
Summary

Inspiring individuality with innovative craftmanship since 1966, creativity lies at the heart of Bottega Veneta. Born in Vicenza, the house is rooted in Italian culture yet maintains a truly global outlook. An inclusive brand with exclusive products, Bottega Veneta is as much of a feeling as it is an aesthetic.

Job Description

We are currently seeking a Business Intelligence Assistant as part of our dynamic team in Milan.

How you will contribute:

  • Be a partner for the business users for every BI activity, to respond in the most effective and efficient way to the business needs of the Finance and Merchandising areas;
  • Support users in the day-by-day activities and collect the internal requests, translating them into technical specifications and provide assistance;
  • Foster a data culture by keeping documentation up to date and provide the right education to end-users;
  • Cooperate with Kering group for specific projects rollout.

Who you are:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Statistics or a related field;
  • Excellent knowledge of the Office suite, especially Excel;
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools such as MicroStrategy, PowerBI and QlikSense;
  • Experience in a similar position within international environment will be considered as a plus;
  • PowerBI dashboard development will be considered a plus;
  • Good knowledge of English both written and spoken;
  • Attitude to problem solving combined with strong professional relational skills to be able to translate business needs into technical terms;
  • Be a team player;
  • Curious, open-minded and focus on team success, high attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Why work with us?

This is a fabulous opportunity to join the Kering adventure and to actively contribute to the development of the business by becoming part of a global Luxury Group that offers endless possibilities to learn and grow. Talent development is a managerial principle at Kering and we are committed to fostering internal mobility. Our common vision promotes leadership skills and helps every employee to reach their full potential in a stimulating and fulfilling workplace environment.

Kering is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms – gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation – enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background. 

Job Type

Agency

Start Date

2025-04-14

Schedule

Full time

Organization

Bottega Veneta S.R.L

Title: Digital Analytics Consultant
Description:
Scopri un Mondo di Innovazione con Noi! 🚀




Nel 2018, un gruppo di professionisti nel campo dell’Information Technology si unì per creare Setting, una realtà volta all’innovazione e alla trasformazione digitale. La nostra missione? Rispondere alla crescente richiesta di soluzioni informatiche innovative in ogni ambito. Ma siamo molto più di un’azienda di tecnologia. Siamo costruttori di relazioni, crediamo nella fiducia, nella cooperazione e nella creazione di vere partnership con i nostri Clienti.




Per un importante cliente del settore Retail Consumer, siamo alla ricerca urgente di un Digital Analytics Consultant con competenze avanzate in Google Analytics 4 (GA4) e Google Looker.




🔹 Cosa farai:

Analisi approfondita dei percorsi utente, funnel di conversione e segmentazione del traffico su più piattaforme, definendo tracking requirements su GA4.
Progettazione e gestione di dashboard su Google Looker, per fornire agli stakeholder insight in tempo reale su KPI, comportamento utenti e prestazioni delle campagne.
Collaborazione con team interfunzionali per definire le fonti di dati, sviluppare i framework di misurazione e ottimizzare i processi di reporting.
Partecipazione a progetti di alto profilo nell'ecosistema Google, supportando clienti di primo livello.
Creazione di presentazioni e storytelling dei dati, rendendo comprensibili informazioni complesse.




🔎 Chi cerchiamo:

Esperienza consolidata in GA4 e Google Looker.
Capacità di analizzare dati e tradurli in azioni strategiche.
Attitudine al lavoro di squadra e collaborazione interfunzionale.
Ottima capacità di storytelling con i dati.




RAL massima offerta 36.000€




Il Nostro Processo di Selezione

Quando riceveremo il tuo CV, lo valuteremo attentamente. Se vedremo una corrispondenza con questa o altre posizioni aperte, ti contatteremo. Il nostro processo di selezione comprende:

✔ Colloquio conoscitivo

✔ Colloquio tecnico con il Delivery Manager

✔ Colloquio finale con un Partner

L’ordine e il numero di interviste possono variare in base alle esigenze di recruiting.

Siamo ansiosi di conoscere persone appassionate, innovative e pronte a costruire il futuro digitale insieme a noi. Invia il tuo CV e unisciti alla nostra squadra di innovatori! 🚀

Title: Oliver Wyman - Data&Analytics - Associate Team Leader/Team Leader- Milan
Description:
Who We Are

Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.




What You Will Do

As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company

Why Join Us?

Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!




Who Can Apply?

We are recruiting for a talented Associate Team leader/Team Leader.




These positions offers excellent career and growth opportunities for talented, highly motivated professionals with relevant prior experience in quantitatively intense areas, particularly though not exclusively within financial services.




The role will focus on managing projects:

Associate Team Leaders and Team Leaders would typically work on one project at a time.
Project work typically involves developing hypotheses; managing data collection, model creation and analyses; conducting primary and secondary research; creatively tackling information limitations; and surfacing insights, overseeing the work of analysts
Using Partners and the internal network effectively to provide technical and senior-level steer to projects
Working in a team together with clients to complete project deliverables to high standard
Maintaining energy and positive work life balance of team
Coaching Oliver Wyman and client team members to develop their skills

____

YOUR ATTRIBUTES AND EXPERIENCE

Associate Team Leader - At least 3 years of previous working experience
Team Leader- At least 5 years of previous working experience
Desirable previous experience in specialised consulting firms or banking and financial institutions, with content in data&analytics, financial modelling, machine learning techniques.
Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline. Ideally Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Informatics, Data Science or, Engineering
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Strong analysis, documentation, and communication skills
Experience in using advanced analytics and data manipulation software - R, Python, SAS, SQL.
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Be independent and work under limited supervision respecting defined timelines.
Present results effectively, highlighting potential issues and implications.
Excellent command of Italian and English language (verbal and written)
Ability to manage a demanding work volume and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to maintain and respect confidentiality
Willingness to travel regularly

_

How to Apply?

Please submit your CV, cover letter and transcripts. If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website .




Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. ​ Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.

____

Show more
HTML:
Who We Are

Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.


What You Will Do

As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

  • Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
  • Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
  • Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
  • Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
  • Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
  • Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
  • Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company

Why Join Us?

Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!


Who Can Apply?

We are recruiting for a talented Associate Team leader/Team Leader.


These positions offers excellent career and growth opportunities for talented, highly motivated professionals with relevant prior experience in quantitatively intense areas, particularly though not exclusively within financial services.


The role will focus on managing projects:

  • Associate Team Leaders and Team Leaders would typically work on one project at a time.
  • Project work typically involves developing hypotheses; managing data collection, model creation and analyses; conducting primary and secondary research; creatively tackling information limitations; and surfacing insights, overseeing the work of analysts
  • Using Partners and the internal network effectively to provide technical and senior-level steer to projects
  • Working in a team together with clients to complete project deliverables to high standard
  • Maintaining energy and positive work life balance of team
  • Coaching Oliver Wyman and client team members to develop their skills

____

YOUR ATTRIBUTES AND EXPERIENCE

  • Associate Team Leader - At least 3 years of previous working experience
  • Team Leader- At least 5 years of previous working experience
  • Desirable previous experience in specialised consulting firms or banking and financial institutions, with content in data&analytics, financial modelling, machine learning techniques.
  • Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline. Ideally Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Informatics, Data Science or, Engineering
  • Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
  • Strong analysis, documentation, and communication skills
  • Experience in using advanced analytics and data manipulation software - R, Python, SAS, SQL.
  • Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
  • Be independent and work under limited supervision respecting defined timelines.
  • Present results effectively, highlighting potential issues and implications.
  • Excellent command of Italian and English language (verbal and written)
  • Ability to manage a demanding work volume and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to maintain and respect confidentiality
  • Willingness to travel regularly

_

How to Apply?

Please submit your CV, cover letter and transcripts. If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website .


Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. ​ Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.

____

Title: Data Analyst - Credito | Settore energetico
Description:
Descrizione azienda

Il nostro cliente è uno dei principali operatori del mercato libero dell'energia elettrica e del gas naturale, con circa 800.000 clienti su tutto il territorio nazionale. Dispongono, con controllo diretto e indiretto, di impianti di generazione elettrica per circa 4.800 MW di potenza installata e siamo uno dei maggiori operatori italiani nella commercializzazione di elettricità e gas naturale. La strategia si fonda su un modello flessibile di produzione e gestione dell’energia, per accelerare la transizione energetica del nostro Paese. Ogni giorno si impegna per portare ai clienti energia sostenibile e servizi, resi semplici, personali e condivisibili tramite tecnologie digitali. Per i loro clienti rendono disponibili elettricità, gas, fibra ultra veloce, soluzioni fotovoltaiche e servizi per l’efficienza energetica.

Anno di nascita: 1999

Dipendenti totali: 646

L'azienda pone forte attenzione al cliente e il focus client oriented passa prima da una visione people oriented: lavorare in questa realtà significa non solo crescita professionale, ma anche poter lavorare in un ambiente dove la scala valoriale è alta in termini di contenuti e avvalorata dalla struttura.

Posizione

Nel tuo nuovo ruolo, entrerai a far parte della Direzione ICT C Customer Service nell’Area “Customer Value, Analytics and Platform”.

Su cosa lavorerai Ti occuperai delle principali attività di reporting e analisi relative all’area Credito.

Nello specifico: Supporto analitico nella gestione dei processi relativi al rischio credito, alla morosità e al recupero dei crediti. Definizione, implementazione, manutenzione e monitoraggio dei KPI e della reportistica operativa e direzionale per l’area Credito; Gestione, in autonomia e con il supporto di fornitori esterni, delle attività inerenti le consegne normative e indagini dell’Autorità di settore relativamente ai dati di fatturato, credito e incasso; Analisi della customer base e generazione insights al fine di orientare le decisioni dell’area per minimizzare il tasso di unpaid. Presentazione dei dati periodici in occasione dei meeting operativi e direzionali; Gestione autonoma del deploy delle soluzioni applicative Qlik-sense

Requisiti

Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di QlikSense
Conoscenza dei concetti e delle tecniche di Data warehousing (Back-End) e di Business Intelligence (Front-End)
Buona conoscenza lingua inglese
Ottime capacità di analisi e attitudine al problem solving;
Ottima capacità di lavorare per obiettivi e in team, anche interfacciandosi con interlocutori sia interni che esterni

Altre informazioni

Sede di Lavoro: Milano

Smart working: 2gg a settimana post onboarding (3 mesi)

Show more

Title: Operations Data Analyst
Description:
Carglass è parte di un gruppo internazionale, il gruppo Belron®, presente in oltre 35 Countries e leader mondiale nella riparazione e sostituzione dei vetri auto. Attraverso la nostra rete di centri di assistenza, officine mobili e di un Contact Center specializzato, offriamo su tutto il territorio italiano il massimo delle tecnologie, dell’esperienza e della professionalità nel trattamento dei vetri auto e truck. Ciò che ci ha permesso di diventare leader a livello globale sono la cura nel lavoro e la presa in carico del cliente in tutte le sue necessità. I clienti sono il cuore del business ma le nostre persone sono coloro che fanno la differenza nel servizio che offriamo ogni giorno!




In questo momento siamo alla ricerca di un/a:




Operations Data Analyst

Il/la candidato/a sarà inserito/a all’interno della Direzione Operations, rispondendo al Central Operations Manager, e si occuperà di:

Analizzare i dati provenienti dai processi aziendali al fine di individuare eventuali correlazioni e trend.
Definire eventuali cause di variabilità e fornire, alla fine dell’analisi, linee guida ed indicazioni ai dipartimenti coinvolti, in un’ottica di ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali.
Collaborare con il team su progetti nazionali e internazionali




Caratteristiche del candidato:

Forte capacità analitica, curiosità nella comprensione dei processi, esperienza con strumenti di data analysis e una passione per il miglioramento continuo.




Requisiti:

Laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale, Economia, Matematica, Statistica
Esperienza pregressa nel ruolo di almeno 2 anni
Conoscenza approfondita del pacchetto office, in particolar modo di Excel
Ottima conoscenza dei principali tool per l’analisi dei dati
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.




Il lavoro si svolge in modalità ibrida (2 giorni in presenza e 3 in remoto).




Completano il profilo la capacità di lavorare in team e buone doti organizzative.




Oltre allo stipendio commisurato alla tua esperienza, potrai contare su:

Piano di incentivazione
Piattaforma di welfare
Piattaforma wellness, una vera e propria palestra online, per te e i tuoi familiari, per tenerti sempre in forma
Sportello di consulenza psicologica in caso di difficoltà e tante altre iniziative per il tuo benessere
Possibilità di prendere parte ad eventi internazionali, come il nostro Triathlon annuale a Londra, a scopo benefico




Ai sensi della normativa vigente l'offerta di lavoro si intende rivolta a entrambi i sessi (L. 903/77).

Show more

Title: Industry Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA)

Schedule

Full-time

Salary (Pay Basis)

1,286.09

Grade

INTERN

For more than 75 years, NATO’s mission has been to preserve peace and security in the Alliancefor nearly one billion citizens. The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA) is NATO’s technology and cyber hub. We are a team of 3000 civilian and military staff, working together to connect all corners of NATO and maintain its Edge from 30 locations across the Alliance.

We are a key partner in NATO's Digital Transformation, working hand in hand with industry to provide technical solutions and expertise, facilitating political consultations and decision-making, and enabling multi-domain operations.

Our experts provide secure static and deployable communications infrastructure, satellite communications and information technology services, connected the Alliance’s forces, and strengthening NATO’s defence and deterrence posture. Fulfilling NCIA’s missions is possible because of our greatest force, our people. In order to reinforce NATO’s edge, we aim to hire, train and retain the very best staff.

Our staff members represent both the diversity and unity of our Alliance. When you join NCIA, you will be part of an organization where you can contribute authentically to the mission and purpose of NATO and help us ensure seamless connectivity among Allied partner nations.

About The Program

The NCIA internship is a 6-month program based at one of our key hubs in The Netherlands, Belgium or Portugal. Our internship opportunities start from either 1 March or 1 September with the start date being dependent on the timeline to secure the required security clearance to work within the NATO community. During an internship, you will join and support a diverse international team and simultaneously learn from our experts via on-the-job training, working independently on purposeful projects or initiatives during your tenure.

About The Internship

Internship duration: 6 months

Location: Brussels, Belgium

The Office of the Chief of Acquisition (COA) provides the full range of acquisition expertise and activities that support the planning, implementation and maintenance of the required capability in support to the Agency’s strategic goals and missions. These functions include Contracting and Acquisition Lifecycle, which includes Integrated Product Support and Cost Estimating and Analysis. COA controls all NCI Agency procurement activities to ensure effective risk management and protects the legal and financial liabilities of the Agency by implementing the best practices to all acquisition activities, including Lifecycle Acquisition.

This internship position is with Industry Relations Team (IRT), under Acquisition Office.IRT is responsible for advising the Chief of Acquisition and the NCIA General Manager on all Industry Relations matters to include strengthening existing relationships with the private sector and not-for-profit organizations as well as building new ones, in direct support of the Agency’s Strategic Plan.

Internship Duties


Support the implementation of the Industry Strategic Engagement Plan (ISEP) through various tasks, primarily focusing on research, analysis and stakeholder engagement
Collect and analyse data from diverse sources (e.g., industry databases, surveys, open-source platforms) to support planning and reporting activities. Develop actionable, data-driven recommendations.
Present complex information in visually appealing formats tailored to different audiences and stakeholders.
Collaborate with internal cross-agency teams and external industry representatives to ensure alignment and effective communication.
Prepare reports, background documents, correspondence, and meeting minutes. Manage follow-ups on pending tasks to ensure timely execution.
Assist in planning and implementing industry engagement activities or visits in alignment with the ISEP.


About You

The valuable knowledge and experience that you bring to this role is:

Business Situation Analysis

Investigates straightforward business situations to identify and analyse problems and opportunities.Contributes to the recommendation of improvements.Follows agreed standards and techniques to investigate, analyse and document business situations.Engages with stakeholders under direction.

Knowledge Management

Maintains a knowledge management database.Leverages knowledge of a specialism to capture and classify content, taking expert advice when required.

Research

Within given research goals, assists in selection and review of credible and reliable resources.Searches for relevant material using specialised websites and sources, reads relevant articles to update knowledge of the relevant field.Reports on work carried out and may contribute sections of publication-quality material.Curates, under guidance, a personal collection of relevant material.

Eligibility Criteria

To be eligible to apply for our internship program, you will need to meet the following criteria:


You are a national of a NATO member country
You are currently studying towards a university-level degree or have recently graduated in the past 12 months
A thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable. Most of the work of the NCI Agency is conducted in the English language.


We also request that you please attach the following documents to your application form:


Copy of the university degree you have completed and/or
Proof of ongoing studies with the dates clearly mentioned if you are still studying


Application Process

The application process for an internship at NCIA is:

Ø Apply via the NCIA Careers site by 23:59 CET 16 th March 2025

Ø If selected to progress to the first stage evaluation this will consist of a logic, numeracy and behavioral gamification exercises in addition to on-demand video questions aligned to the requirements of the internship

Ø Virtual interviews will take place in the month of April

Ø Tentative offer to be presented to successful candidates in early May

Compensation

Belgium

You will be compensated at a fixed taxable rate of 1,286.09 EUR per month, based on 38 hours of work per week and for reasonable travel expenses to start on day 1 and to return to your home location once the internship is complete.

Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.To learn more about NCIA and our work, please visit our website .

NCIA prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment of mutual respect and value uniqueness and differences in gender, gender identity, race, ethnic or cultural origin, age, religion, sexual orientation and physical or neurocognitive ability.

Additional details on the conditions of application can be found via the NCIA career site.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our consulting client is looking for a Data Analyst to join the team in Brussels.




Experience in the Insurance industry is mandatory.




The candidate will analyse and interpret large volumes of data and evaluate results to provide insights that assist decision-making.




During system implementation projects, they conduct source-to-target data mapping activities by thoroughly examining entities, products, and processes to ensure coherent mapping.




Responsibilities:




Data Collection and Processing
Data Analysis
Data Visualization
Reporting and Presentation
Data-Driven Decision Making
Continuous Improvement and Learning




Your Skills:




We are looking for experience in SQL for data manipulation, strong technical and analytical skills, and programming knowledge (Python/R).
You must demonstrate clear and capable communication and presentation skills as a consultant.
Tableau/Power BI, matplotlib
BSc or an MSc in a relevant topic such as Maths, Computer Science or Statistics, etc..

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Drive Sustainability with Data (Immediate Consideration)




📍 Remote | Work from Anywhere (UK Time Zone)

💰 Salary: £40,000 - £55,000 (Up to £70,000 for Lead Role)

🛂 Visa Sponsorship Available

📈 Career Growth – Opportunities for Progression in a High-Impact Industry

🌍 Make a Difference – Use Data to Tackle Climate Challenges




Are you passionate about using data to solve real-world problems? Do you want to contribute to a greener future while working in a fast-paced, forward-thinking environment? We’re a mission-driven sustainability company using technology and data to create a cleaner, more sustainable world. Now, we’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and help shape the future of sustainability.




What You’ll Do

Analyse large and complex datasets to identify trends in carbon emissions, renewable energy, waste reduction, and sustainability initiatives.
Develop insightful dashboards and reports to help businesses and policymakers make data-driven environmental decisions.
Work closely with sustainability experts, engineers, and product teams to turn data into actionable insights.
Design and refine predictive models to assess environmental impact and forecast sustainability outcomes.
Ensure data accuracy, quality, and integrity, helping build reliable climate impact metrics.
Stay up to date with industry trends and contribute ideas to improve sustainability strategies.




What We’re Looking For

Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Python, R, or similar tools.
Proficiency in data visualisation platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Understanding of statistical methods and predictive modelling.
Passion for sustainability and an interest in climate data, energy systems, or ESG reporting.
Ability to translate complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Previous experience in data analysis, sustainability, or a related field (preferred but not required).




Why Join?

🌍 Mission-Driven Work – Contribute to real, measurable environmental change.

💼 100% Remote & Flexible – Work from anywhere while following UK time zones.

📈 Career Growth – Be part of a company at the cutting edge of sustainable innovation.

🎓 Learning & Development – Access training, certifications, and mentorship opportunities.

🛂 Visa Sponsorship Available – We welcome global talent to drive our mission forward.

🏝 Generous Holiday Allowance – Enjoy a proper work-life balance with up to 38 days of paid leave.

❤️ Wellness & Mental Health Support – We prioritise your well-being.




This isn’t just another data role—it’s a chance to make a real impact in the fight against climate change. If you're passionate about sustainability and thrive in a data-driven environment, we’d love to hear from you.




Apply now – Let’s build a greener future together! 🌱

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Freelance Data Analyst (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)




Overview

We are looking for a highly skilled Freelance Data Analyst to support our financial data operations in Brussels on a hybrid basis. This is a 12-month contract with the potential for extension. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial data analysis, business intelligence, and reporting, helping drive data-driven decision-making within our organization.




Key Responsibilities

Analyze large financial datasets to identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and KPIs using Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Work with SQL databases to extract, clean, and transform financial data.
Support risk analysis, forecasting, and financial modeling to guide strategic decisions.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with financial regulations (e.g., IFRS, Basel III, MiFID II).
Collaborate with finance, risk, and compliance teams to provide insights.
Automate reporting processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual work.
Communicate findings to stakeholders through clear visualizations and presentations.




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or Looker).
Proficiency in Excel (Pivot Tables, Macros, VBA is a plus).
Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis (preferred but not mandatory).
Understanding of financial metrics, risk analysis, and forecasting techniques.

Soft Skills

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills to present insights to financial and non-financial stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with a strong focus on data accuracy.
Ability to work independently while collaborating with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Experience

Previous experience in the financial sector (banking, investment, insurance, fintech).
Familiarity with financial regulations (IFRS, Basel III, MiFID II).
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for data management is a plus.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested in this position, feel free to apply with your CV or email it directly to adam@kodastaff.com
