Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our data strategy and ensuring the successful implementation of our data initiatives. You will be responsible for analysing complex datasets, providing actionable insights and reports, and contributing to the development of our data platform. Your technical aptitude, curiosity, and autonomy will be essential as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.

As we embark on an exciting journey to create a robust data service, establish comprehensive data governance, and develop an innovative data platform!




Key Responsibilities

Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends that support business objectives.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate data findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineers to design and implement data pipelines and ELT processes.
Participate in the creation and enhancement of our data platform, ensuring it meets the needs of various business units.
Provide technical expertise and support in data modelling, data integration, and data warehousing.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value.




About YOU

More than 3 years of significant experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a Startup or a software company.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, Power BI).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Curiosity and a passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Internship Data Analyst
Description:
Internship Data & Analytics

Looking for a challenging internship in the Data & Analytics team, starting in July, August or September 2025? It’s time to apply! 

Who are we?

 

At Unilever, we share one simple purpose: To make sustainable living commonplace. Through our powerhouse brands such as Dove, Axe and Lipton, we are creating a bright future for our business and our planet – and you can be part of it!

 

We believe that companies with purpose last, people with purpose thrive and brands with purpose grow.  We meet every day needs for nutrition, hygiene and personal care with brands that help people feel good, look good and get more out of life.

 

Main Purpose Of The Internship

 

When joining Unilever in Belgium, you will get the opportunity to have an impact on a leading-edge company and our outstanding brands. During this internship you will get real responsibilities that will provide you with a good insight into the organisation and support your personal development.

Our Data & Analytics team ensures that Unilever makes data-driven decisions to optimize product availability, supply chain efficiency, and consumer insights across global markets. During this internship, you will gain a deep understanding of how advanced analytics supports business operations, identify market trends through data, and learn how to transform raw information into actionable strategies that drive product success in a fast-paced consumer goods environment

 

Your Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities Could Be (amongst Others)

 


Market data analysis
Promotional follow-up and analysis
Collecting and cleaning up data to ensure quality is up to standard
Thinking collectively on how to present the analysis best towards our business colleagues and external stakeholders
Update & creation of new reports


 

 

What We Ask

 


You must be enrolled as a Bachelor or Master student from a University, Business School or equivalent during the entire internship. Your studies must have an analytic component. For example: courses on Statistics, Market Assessment, Marketing research or Marketing intelligence.
You are available for a minimum of 3 months and ideally for 6 months (37 hours a week).
You are fluent in English + Dutch or French.
You are a team player with a strong sense of responsibility.
You are a self-starter, able to work autonomously.
You are a pro-active and dynamic person, able to anticipate the needs of your team.
You are curious, eager to learn new things and to explore new ideas and approaches to solving challenges.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and feel comfortable with data analysis.
You are able to work with a diversity of people and teams.
You are familiar with MS office tools in particular Excel.
Experience with Power BI / Tableau is a big plus!
You can successfully identify all Unilever iced tea products while blindfolded in a taste test (we won't actually test this, but impressive if true!)


 

 

What We Offer

 


An outstanding chance to bring our unique purpose to life!
An opportunity to take a look behind the scenes at one of the biggest FMCG-corporations in the world.
An opportunity to learn from a variety of concrete projects.
A wealth of experience, where you will be at the heart of the business.
Lots of responsibility, but also good guidance during your internship.


 

 

EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE?

 

To apply, please send your CV and a motivation letter where your preferred internship topics, internship duration and ideal start date are highlighted.

 

We look forward to meeting you! 

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Permanent Data Analyst




Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

Languages: English & French

Seniority Level: 4+ years of experience

Reports to: Head of Analytics




About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities

Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.




Requirements

4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).




Nice-to-Have

Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.




Interview Process

First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.

We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.

Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU, and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.

Who We Are Supporting

The NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.

The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:


Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.
Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.
Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.
Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.
Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.


Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.

The program

Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)

The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.

To provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance-engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorise's: NATO International Civilians (NIC)'s, Military (Mil), and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)'s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.

Role Background

NCIA, as the main ICT service provider in NATO, is the main technical entity providing subject matter expertise to support Allied Command Transformation (ACT) Science and Technology (S&T), NATO Digital Staff (NDS) Innovation Programmes of Work (PoW) and relevant exercises in 2025. NCIA Chief Technology Office (CTO) Innovating Team is looking for a Contractor who will provide day-to-day technical support to the PoW projects with the two NATO bodies.

Role Duties And Responsibilities

Under the direction / guidance of the NCIA Point of Contact or delegated staff, they will perform the following activities:


Support NCI Agency in the NATO Programmes of Work with ACT and NDS in the area of Science & Technology and Innovation
Gather and analyze vast amounts of data from diverse sources, including scientific publications, news articles, social media, and market reports
Perform horizon scanning and trend-scouting activities in the area of emerging and disruptive technologies by detecting promising technologies as well as potential applications
Design and implement data models, repositories, and ETL pipelines to capture and record signals from diverse sources as a structured dataset to enable ad-hoc analysis and reporting
Develop clear, concise, and actionable reports to communicate your findings to stakeholders across the organization
Develop dashboards to enable monitoring of the analysis results
Utilize natural language processing (NLP) and other AI techniques to analyze vast amounts of data from diverse sources


Essential Skills And Experience


At least five years of experience in a mid-level data analytics role
Strong understanding of AI and its potential applications in data analysis – particularly Natural language processing (NLP) techniques, language models and multilingual technologies.
Strong programming, data modelling, and data visualization skills, including Python, SQL, PowerBI, R, TensorFlow and NoSQL DBs.
Experience with Extract, Transform, Load tools and techniques integrating with REST APIs and document management systems.
Proven experience with technology horizon scanning techniques and identification of technology trends and high potential use-cases.
Proven experience with media monitoring, media data analysis, threat analysis in text and text classification.
Proven experience with software/tool development in the area of strategic foresight analysis and horizon scanning.
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills particularly as applied to trend scouting and innovation management


Desirable Skills And Experience


Relevant experience with NATO and/or international organizations is highly desired.


Education


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (computer science, data science, software engineering, machine learning, etc.) or equivalent experience.


Working Location


Remote


Working Policy


Off-Site


Travel


Some travel to other NATO sites may be required


Security Clearance


Valid National or NATO Secret personal security clearance

HTML:
Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.

We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.

Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU, and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.

Who We Are Supporting

The NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.

The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:

  • Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.
  • Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.
  • Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.
  • Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.
  • Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.

Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.

The program

Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)

The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.

To provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance-engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorise's: NATO International Civilians (NIC)'s, Military (Mil), and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)'s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.

Role Background

NCIA, as the main ICT service provider in NATO, is the main technical entity providing subject matter expertise to support Allied Command Transformation (ACT) Science and Technology (S&T), NATO Digital Staff (NDS) Innovation Programmes of Work (PoW) and relevant exercises in 2025. NCIA Chief Technology Office (CTO) Innovating Team is looking for a Contractor who will provide day-to-day technical support to the PoW projects with the two NATO bodies.

Role Duties And Responsibilities

Under the direction / guidance of the NCIA Point of Contact or delegated staff, they will perform the following activities:

  • Support NCI Agency in the NATO Programmes of Work with ACT and NDS in the area of Science & Technology and Innovation
  • Gather and analyze vast amounts of data from diverse sources, including scientific publications, news articles, social media, and market reports
  • Perform horizon scanning and trend-scouting activities in the area of emerging and disruptive technologies by detecting promising technologies as well as potential applications
  • Design and implement data models, repositories, and ETL pipelines to capture and record signals from diverse sources as a structured dataset to enable ad-hoc analysis and reporting
  • Develop clear, concise, and actionable reports to communicate your findings to stakeholders across the organization
  • Develop dashboards to enable monitoring of the analysis results
  • Utilize natural language processing (NLP) and other AI techniques to analyze vast amounts of data from diverse sources

Essential Skills And Experience

  • At least five years of experience in a mid-level data analytics role
  • Strong understanding of AI and its potential applications in data analysis – particularly Natural language processing (NLP) techniques, language models and multilingual technologies.
  • Strong programming, data modelling, and data visualization skills, including Python, SQL, PowerBI, R, TensorFlow and NoSQL DBs.
  • Experience with Extract, Transform, Load tools and techniques integrating with REST APIs and document management systems.
  • Proven experience with technology horizon scanning techniques and identification of technology trends and high potential use-cases.
  • Proven experience with media monitoring, media data analysis, threat analysis in text and text classification.
  • Proven experience with software/tool development in the area of strategic foresight analysis and horizon scanning.
  • Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills particularly as applied to trend scouting and innovation management

Desirable Skills And Experience

  • Relevant experience with NATO and/or international organizations is highly desired.

Education

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (computer science, data science, software engineering, machine learning, etc.) or equivalent experience.

Working Location

  • Remote

Working Policy

  • Off-Site

Travel

  • Some travel to other NATO sites may be required

Security Clearance

  • Valid National or NATO Secret personal security clearance

We never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Department

The Corporate Planning division, located in Brussels, consists of several departments: The corporate planning department in charge of Group Controlling & Daikin Europe controlling, the Business Analytics department, and the Internal controls & J-Sox department.

The division is responsible for drilling down the strategy into annual budgets and realizing the group targets. This is done in cooperation with all sales and manufacturing entities, as well as with other departments in Daikin Europe. As a backbone for group-wide reporting, the department takes care of the management of the sales-, margin-, and pricing data, as well as collecting and reporting market intelligence. Our mission is to safeguard and manage profitability, via periodic reporting to top-management, close follow-up and by proposing countermeasure actions.

Furthermore, the division is responsible for the development and implementation of corporate governance and internal controls in the group (e.g. J-SOx and system access).

The vacancy is in the Business Analytics Department.

Function

The department is playing a leading role in the roll-out of actionable dashboards in sales, service and supply related departments and affiliates. You will write functional and business requirements to create the data models and develop PBI reports for these roll outs.
You are in close cooperation with business to understand their needs and requirements. You are able to look at these needs and requirements in the perspective of business and in the perspective of functional requirements.
You will be member of different project teams, who are involved in SAP/Azure projects at Headquarter and affiliates.
Together with our IT department you search what tools, functionalities and data the business needs to analyse and steer the business. At Daikin we aim to continuously improve and be at the forefront of new developments.
You'll be the driver behind the move towards more data driven business in EMEA.
You will promote the development of innovative new data and reporting platforms in collaboration with business and IT across all departments and Daikin Affiliates.




Your profile

You have a master degree in Business Economics, Finance, Accounting, Math or Data Science
You already have a 2-3 years of experience in a similar role as data analyst or business analyst, preferably in a complex and big organisation.
You have a strong understanding of ETL processes and can guide the IT department in structuring tables, relationships, and dimension mappings correctly. Basic knowledge of data warehousing (SAP BW, Microsoft Azure, Databricks) is a plus.
You are proficient in DAX, following best practices and handling complex statements such as calculation groups and parameter tables. Experience with Tabular Editor for centralized DAX management is preferred.
You develop Power BI dashboards and reports, transforming user input into proactive data visualizations that facilitate decision-making. You have experience optimizing report performance using tools like DAX Studio, Report Analyzer, DAX Optimizer, and ALM Toolkit (a plus).
You have a basic understanding of source systems such as SAP PR2 (S/4HANA), CRM, and CEC.
You have experience in building sales-related reports, including sales analysis, pipeline tracking, gross margin variation, SG&A tracking, and P&L analysis.
You are proactive and think outside the box to drive innovative solutions.
You have the ability to understand & challenge the needs of customers and to formalize the derived requirements
Outstanding collaboration, listening, written and verbal communication skills
You are result-driven with a strong focus on improvements




What we offer




At Daikin, you can count on a varied job with an international market leader that stimulates its people to grow and to work together. We offer you an open ended contract. You will be given extensive training and will be well supported from the start. The position carries a competitive salary and a package of extra-legal benefits. This function offers an excellent stepping stone to take on more responsibilities in a planning-oriented function or a detachment abroad at one of our EMEA affiliates.

Daikin Europe N.V.

Daikin Europe N.V. is the EMEA headquarters of the Japanese company, Daikin Industries Ltd. We design, manufacture and distribute air conditioning and heating systems for commercial, residential and industrial applications. Our headquarters are located in Brussels and Ostend, but through our sales networks we also have a presence throughout Europe, Africa and the Middle East.

We are the market leader in the field of air conditioning and also offer Total Comfort Solutions in the fields of cooling, heating, ventilation and related techniques.

In addition, as a company we are constantly expanding, with extensive international contacts, a pleasant, stimulating working environment, extensive training and coaching, ... Daikin Europe N.V. has many trump cards. However, our highly motivated employees are our greatest asset. That is why we are always looking for new talent.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions. 




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: CLIENT INSIGHTS DATA ANALYST
HTML:
About The Job

Within our Clienteling team, you will play a key role in transforming customer data into in-depth business analyses and strategic recommendations. Your main mission will be to detect opportunities for customer loyalty and engagement thanks to your mastery of data analysis and your sharp understanding of customer behavior.

Your Mission: Transform Data into Levers for Growth and Customer Loyalty

Job responsibilities

As a Client Insights Data Analyst, your mission will be to inform strategic decisions through your analytical expertise applied to customer data:

  • Conduct in-depth studies on the profile and behavior of our customers in both retail and e-retail.
  • Track customer trends and transform demographic, transactional, and engagement data into relevant insights and recommendations for business activations.
  • Measure commercial performance through precise KPIs and recommend areas for improvement.
  • Define and monitor precise KPIs to measure the performance of commercial actions and identify areas for improvement;
  • Contribute to the development of targeted Clienteling campaigns, monitor their implementation, and analyze their results;
  • Collaborate closely with business specialists from several departments to meet their needs for customer data analysis and optimize business opportunities;
  • Lead the network of regional correspondents in developing their customer knowledge: train them, provide them with simplified and automated reports, and support them in their ad hoc analyses;
  • Act as a proactive force for the Team Managers in developing the business and be a key contributor for sales, supporting teams on localized clienteling reporting and support with action plan, and regularly present your analyses and recommendations to the management teams;
  • Working together with Training team; leverage all the clienteling tools to engage and build long term Client relationships
  • Create and implement specific action plans to pro-actively drive the business
  • Reporting on client evolution and local clienteling KPIs on weekly/Monthly/quarterly basis for Front and DPCA teams;
  • Audience creation for EMEA wide and local activities for front and DPCA teams;
  • Clienteling Efficiency: collaborate with performance and experts' team to report accurate conversion for all clienteling campaigns
  • Managing Clienteling time with RTA based on the project and priorities;
  • Develop data visualizations that will allow monitoring performance;
  • Acting as Icons and Power BI project owner;
  • Coaching and training on tools-Icons device distribution and usage;
  • Streamlining internal requests processes and managing incoming Icons requests.

Profile

  • You have at least 3 years of similar experience;
  • Your analytical mind is your strength, combined with a sharp understanding of customer marketing;
  • Proven expertise in the daily use of SQL. Knowledge of Dataiku would be a plus;
  • Ability to present your analyses strategically orally and via PowerPoint;
  • You enjoy working in a team and being in direct contact with business teams. Interpersonal soft skills and ease in working daily with business contacts who are not data specialists;
  • Perfect command of English.

Reference LVM27257

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About Brussels Airlines

Brussels Airlines, part of the Lufthansa Group, is the national airline of Belgium with its home base at Brussels Airport.

Our mission is to be the most reliable airline, making everyone feel at home.

We are passionate about what we do, whether it’s on board, in an office, in the hangar or at an airport. Our people are recognized for always going above and beyond and for constantly challenging themselves.

Purpose of the position

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team, which is company-wide responsible to provide end-to-end data solutions, as well cooperate with Departmental Data Analysts on their Analytical roadmap. In your role you cooperate intensively with Data Engineers and Business Stakeholders from all areas (Commercial to Operations), and mainly focus on the original intake and analysis, as well final front-end part of the solution. The ability to think along with different stakeholders, together with being solution-oriented, are key assets within this role. You and the team aim to increase the level of Data Analytics in the different company areas to achieve a high impact on decision making, and therefore play a vital role in the future success of the company.

Your Tasks


Intake and Analysis: Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather, analyse, and document business requirements to translate them into final data solutions. Ensure that these requirements are aligned with business goals and technical capabilities.
Development of BI Reports: Design, develop, and maintain interactive reports and dashboards using Spotfire and Power BI. Customize reports to meet user needs and provide actionable insights.
Improvement and Innovation: Proactively evaluate current reports and processes, identifying opportunities for improvement. Recommend and implement new features, functionalities, and enhancements to make reports more actionable and user-friendly.
Provide Data Analytics & Insights: Leverage data analytics to generate meaningful insights for your business stakeholders. Transform raw data into actionable recommendations that help drive decision-making, identify trends, optimize business performance, and uncover new opportunities.
Data Validation: ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data used in reports and dashboards. Regularly perform data quality checks and resolve any discrepancies or errors identified.
Maintenance and Governance: Oversee the maintenance of Available reports and dashboards, ensuring data quality, consistency, and performance. Implement governance standards for data access, security, and reporting best practices.
Incident Management: Handle incidents related to BI reports and dashboards. Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve technical issues, ensuring minimal disruption to business users.
Documentation: Ensure that all BI solutions are well-documented for knowledge sharing and future reference.
BI Community Support: Provide ongoing support to the BI user community, including training, answering enquiries, and troubleshooting issues. Foster collaboration and knowledge sharing within and outside the team.
PMO Activities: Assist in project management activities for key business initiatives. Help track project progress, timelines, and deliverables, ensuring alignment with business priorities and goals.


Your profile


Master degree in Business, Computer or Data Science, or equivalent through experience in a data or analytical role.
3 years of relevant data experience, not in a user role, but in a supporting/development role.
Proficiency in BI tools, dashboard and report design (Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Programming skills (SQL, Python, Pyspark,...).
Datawarehouse understanding, in particular being able to exploit it to develop data solutions. A basic understanding of Azure DevOps and Databricks is seen as a plus.
Analytical mindset and ability to understand complex issues, as well the ability to come forward with clear manageable solutions.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Strong project management and organizational skills: able to organize a bigger project, or work on a bigger scope.
Action oriented with a positive and solution oriented attitude. Eye for sustainable solutions is key.
Team player and positive influencer with motivational skills.
Curiosity for business and data, along with an interest in emerging data technologies.
Experience with Agile methodology is considered a plus.
Very good English verbal and written skills.


What We Offer


A flexible reward plan that allows you to optimize part of your salary
A flexible work environment focused on activity-based working and home office possibility
Travel benefits
Company car (or car allowance and/or public transport subscription)
Profit sharing
Group insurance
Company medical plan (optional)
Representation & homeworking allowance
Meal & eco vouchers
A spot in a very enthusiastic team & a great company to work for

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
💼Job Title: Data Scientist

👨‍💻Job Type: Freelance / Employee

📍Location: Brussels, Belgium

💼Work regime: Hybrid

🌐Language: English: Fluent spoken and written Dutch: Fluent/Good level OR French: Fluent/Good level

🔥Keywords: Predictive Analytics, AI Models, Data Science, Python, Marketing Campaigns

Sector:

Our client is a is a prominent telecommunications company known for its extensive network infrastructure and comprehensive range of services. It provides innovative solutions in internet, mobile, and television communications, catering to both residential and business customers.

Role Overview:

Mission Context:




The Predictive Analytics team within the Marketing and Communication department aims to provide predictive AI models to enable impactful and efficient campaigns by optimizing reach and relevance for customers and augmenting employees in the campaigning process.

Function Description:

We are looking for a medior/senior data scientist with a proven track record in building and deploying data science models to support marketing campaigns. You will be part of a data science team and will work on the following:
Tackle various business challenges by creating AI models to enhance client experiences, empower employees, and optimize internal processes.
Utilize a range of analytical methodologies within predictive AI, including large language models, classical statistical/machine learning techniques, and uplift modeling.
Capture business needs, perform data analyses, build models, and identify relevant target groups to achieve business objectives. Set up tests to measure model impact.
Inform, advise, and support Marketing & Communications Managers on the use of predictive models.
Present complex technical concepts as clear, actionable insights for Marketing & Communication Managers.
Follow up on production runs from data preparation, scoring, and validation of AI models. Maintain and monitor model performance to detect quality issues.
Support the creation of new variables (data engineering) and continuous improvement cycles of models.
Demonstrate extensive experience in programming with Python and contribute to deploying AI models in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
Apply guidelines and best practices for responsible AI.
Collaborate with a team of motivated data scientists eager to learn, share expertise, and work together.




Education:

At least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, or computer science. Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial experience in data science are also encouraged to apply.

Required Experience/Knowledge:

At least 3 years of relevant experience.

Technical Experience:

Mandatory: Strong expertise in Python and Python data science environment (e.g., deep learning), Git, bash, SQL.

Preferable: Experience with Domino Data Science Platform, SAS, recommender systems, language models, optimization under constraints, Django.

Business Experience:

Preferable: Experience in campaigning, direct marketing, A/B testing.










A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023

HTML:
💼Job Title: Data Scientist

👨‍💻Job Type: Freelance / Employee

📍Location: Brussels, Belgium

💼Work regime: Hybrid

🌐Language: English: Fluent spoken and written Dutch: Fluent/Good level OR French: Fluent/Good level

🔥Keywords: Predictive Analytics, AI Models, Data Science, Python, Marketing Campaigns

Sector:

Our client is a is a prominent telecommunications company known for its extensive network infrastructure and comprehensive range of services. It provides innovative solutions in internet, mobile, and television communications, catering to both residential and business customers.

Role Overview:

Mission Context:


  • The Predictive Analytics team within the Marketing and Communication department aims to provide predictive AI models to enable impactful and efficient campaigns by optimizing reach and relevance for customers and augmenting employees in the campaigning process.

Function Description:

  • We are looking for a medior/senior data scientist with a proven track record in building and deploying data science models to support marketing campaigns. You will be part of a data science team and will work on the following:
  • Tackle various business challenges by creating AI models to enhance client experiences, empower employees, and optimize internal processes.
  • Utilize a range of analytical methodologies within predictive AI, including large language models, classical statistical/machine learning techniques, and uplift modeling.
  • Capture business needs, perform data analyses, build models, and identify relevant target groups to achieve business objectives. Set up tests to measure model impact.
  • Inform, advise, and support Marketing & Communications Managers on the use of predictive models.
  • Present complex technical concepts as clear, actionable insights for Marketing & Communication Managers.
  • Follow up on production runs from data preparation, scoring, and validation of AI models. Maintain and monitor model performance to detect quality issues.
  • Support the creation of new variables (data engineering) and continuous improvement cycles of models.
  • Demonstrate extensive experience in programming with Python and contribute to deploying AI models in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
  • Apply guidelines and best practices for responsible AI.
  • Collaborate with a team of motivated data scientists eager to learn, share expertise, and work together.


Education:

  • At least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, or computer science. Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial experience in data science are also encouraged to apply.

Required Experience/Knowledge:

  • At least 3 years of relevant experience.

Technical Experience:

Mandatory: Strong expertise in Python and Python data science environment (e.g., deep learning), Git, bash, SQL.

Preferable: Experience with Domino Data Science Platform, SAS, recommender systems, language models, optimization under constraints, Django.

Business Experience:

  • Preferable: Experience in campaigning, direct marketing, A/B testing.




A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

  1. Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
  2. Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
  3. Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
  4. Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
  5. Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

  1. Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
  2. Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
  3. American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
  4. Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
  5. Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards

Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.  

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis


Qualifications:


You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.


We offer:


A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group


If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Role; BI Analyst

Salary; Up-to €75,000

Location; Remote in the EU, Europe or Switzerland with occasional travel to Berlin




Brio Digital is supporting a Tech4Good organisation who are looking at developing their internal Data and BI team. We are looking for a skilled BI Analystwho has product management experience to join their team and help turn data into insights that drive strategic decisions.




If SQL, Power BI & Python are all something you can work on in your sleep, apply now!




The Role

As a BI Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing business data, developing reports and dashboards, and providing actionable insights to key stakeholders. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions. If you have experience in product management, that’s a big plus!




Responsibilities

Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data models using Power BI.
Write efficient SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Use Python for advanced analytics, automation, or data processing tasks.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business objectives and deliver meaningful insights.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to improve business performance.
Leverage product management experience to shape data-driven product decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reporting tools.




Requirements

Proven experience as a BI Analyst or in a similar role.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Python.
Ability to interpret complex data and communicate insights effectively.
Experience working with large datasets and data visualization best practices.
Experience in product management or working closely with product teams.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us - Curewiki transforms the medical research landscape into a patient-centric ecosystem that fosters groundbreaking discoveries and empowers individuals to take control of their health. We aim to change patient participation in clinical research by providing information, opportunities, and support.







Why Join Curewiki? As a Data Analyst, you'll focus on three key areas, such as prospection: Gather market data to build outreach lists and identify hot prospects using internal data; Product Development: Analyze data from various databases and end-users to provide insights and create geographic heatmaps and competitive analysis and Internal Efficiency: Improve team collaboration by collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data to identify trends and solve problems




.




Job Responsibilities

Data Collection: Gather data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and external sources.
Data Cleaning: Ensure data accuracy by identifying and correcting errors, handling missing values, and preparing datasets for analysis.
Data Analysis: Use statistical techniques to analyze data and identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Reporting: Create reports and visualizations to present findings to stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.
Database Management: Develop and maintain databases and data systems, ensuring data is organized and accessible.
Performance Monitoring: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the effectiveness of business strategies.
Collaboration: Work with other departments to understand their data needs and provide analytical support
Predictive Modeling: Build models to forecast future trends and outcomes based on historical data







Required Qualifications

Educational Background and experience: Bachelor's or master's degree in a relevant field such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, data science, or a related discipline.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, and Excel.
Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyze and interpret complex data sets, and conduct statistical and regression analysis
Certifications: Professional certifications in data analytics or related fields, such as those offered by CompTIA, Coursera, or other recognized institutions.
Soft Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively present findings and collaborate with other teams. Ability to work autonomously and fully remote/asynchronously. Self-discipline and a self-starter mentality. High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data handling and analysis.




Pay range and compensation package - At Curewiki, we offer a competitive salary package with fringe benefits and a remote first environment

Equal Opportunity Statement - Every day, we have the chance to make a meaningful impact on society. Therefore we are proud to be an equal employer who welcomes and respects people from diverse backgrounds and cultures.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – 3-Month Contract (EU Remote, Extension Possible)




We are seeking a Data Analyst for a 3-month contract (with a strong possibility of extension) to support business decision-making through data-driven insights for a client in the automotive industry, specifically within dealerships. This is a fully remote role within the EU.




Key Responsibilities:

Identify and define business questions, uncovering underlying challenges and translating them into data-driven problems.
Create visualisations (charts, graphs) to communicate insights clearly to stakeholders.
Apply statistical analysis to quantify trends and patterns, ensuring data-backed decision-making.
Leverage deep industry knowledge to contextualise insights and drive strategic recommendations.
Prepare and deliver presentations to inform and influence management decisions.




Required Skills & Experience:

✔ Strong ability to translate business problems into data analysis.

✔ Expertise in data visualisation (Matplotlib, Pandas).

✔ Solid foundation in statistics to assess data patterns.

✔ Advanced industry knowledge in the automotive sector, specifically around dealership operations.

✔ Excellent presentation and communication skills.




Typical Technologies:

Jupyter Notebook
Pandas
Matplotlib




Preferred Background:

Degree in Business, Economics, Psychology, or any field that fosters analytical thinking.
Experience in automotive analytics or working with dealership data is a strong advantage.




This role offers the flexibility of remote work within the EU, with the potential for extension based on performance.




📩 Apply now to join a dynamic environment where data drives strategic decisions in the automotive dealership industry!

Title: HR DATA ANALYST
Description:
HR Data Analyst - CDI - Brussels

My client is building a new team in the insurance sector and is looking to develop further. You'll be an integral part of this new team.

We are looking for an HR Data Analyst with a profile that blends data analysis expertise and an interest or basic knowledge in AI.

The goal is to manage and maintain the "dictionary" of metrics at the group level and enhance aggregated data.




Responsibilities:

Data analysis and reporting
Collaborating with data engineers and data modelers
Creating and managing dashboards
Consolidation of processes
Developing use cases to improve reporting
Advanced analytics
Exploring use cases with AI
Stakeholder management
Managing end-to-end projects and teams




Skills:

Experience with Azure environment
Data modeling and dashboard creation
Power BI (best practices, etc.)
SQL, R
Excel
Jupyter notebook




Requirements:

Minimum 3 years of experience
Proficient in English
Brussels (Hybrid environment – 50% remote)




If you're passionate about data and eager to contribute to an innovative project in the insurance sector, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Ben jij geïnteresseerd in data en data-analyse? Heb jij een sterk analytisch vermogen en hou je ervan om zorgvuldig te werken? Wil jij jouw steentje bijdragen in het uitbouwen van infrastructuurprojecten? Dan ben jij misschien dé data analist die wij bij het Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare Werken nodig hebben! We zijn op zoek naar een werkkracht die graag de schouders onder dataprojecten over wegenis, bruggen, tunnels, tramsporen, sluizen en kaaimuren wil zetten.




Jouw takenpakket

Je verzamelt, schoont op, verrijkt en structureert technische en economische data.
Je combineert technische en economische data om kengetallen en modellen te creëren zodat infrastructuurprojecten sneller en accurater geraamd kunnen worden.
Je analyseert de data om opportuniteiten te zien en inzichten te verwerven vanuit het standpunt van de investeerder in openbare infrastructuur.
Je visualiseert de data door middel van rapporten en dashboards.
Je publiceert rapporten en dashboards.
Je beheert rapporten en dashboards, zoals het monitoren van hun correct functioneren en van de nauwkeurigheid.




Je werkt onder meer samen met de celcoördinator, de cost engineer, de Coördinator MEDIAAN, de business projectleiders van DMOW en de verschillende ICT-collega’s en -betrokkenen (ICT-chiefarchitect, informatici, ICT-projectleiders, DPO, dataspecialist, GIS-specialist). De focus zal hier voornamelijk op het verzamelen, verwerken, analyseren en visualiseren van economische en technische data liggen. Zo word je betrokken bij verschillende infrastructuurprojecten zoals het aanleggen of vernieuwen van wegenis, bruggen, tunnels, tramsporen, sluizen en kaaimuren.




Ben jij de data analist die we zoeken?

Je beschikt minstens over een bachelordiploma.
Je hebt minstens 5 jaar ervaring als data analyst, reporting analyst of data scientist. Je hebt praktische ervaring met gebruik van Microsoft-applicaties en -platformen, zoals Excel en Power BI, om data te bewerken, te analyseren en te visualiseren.
Je beschikt over uitstekende praktische ICT-vaardigheden.
Je gaat vlot om met digitale toepassingen (o.a. webapplicaties).
Je kan goed aan de slag met de applicaties van Microsoft Office 365.
Je hebt goede kritische analytische vaardigheden en je bent nieuwsgierig en toegewijd om problemen op te lossen en verbanden te leggen of oorzaken te zien.
Je hebt een sterke wiskundige basis (statistiek, modellering) en interesse in data-analyse en modellering.
Je hebt een zeer goede kennis van het Nederlands.

Pluspunten

Je hebt kennis van R en/of Python of basiskennis van Matlab, VB.NET of aanverwante software)




Werken via Vlaanderen Connect

Je wordt tewerkgesteld via Vlaanderen Connect, de ICT strategische dienstverlener van de Vlaamse overheid. Bij Vlaanderen Connect. wordt je voor onbepaalde duur ter beschikking gesteld aan het Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare werken, hierbij ontvang je een contract van onbepaalde duur.

Werken voor Vlaanderen Connect. betekent werken in een organisatie met boeiende en uitdagende IT functies én de mogelijkheid om mee je schouders te zetten in het uitbouwen van een digitaal en slagkrachtig Vlaanderen.




Verder biedt werken voor Vlaanderen Connect tal van voordelen. Je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je meewerken aan een digitale en slagkrachtige overheid, voor burgers en ondernemers. Daarnaast kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen Connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.




Aanbod

Vlaanderen connect biedt een contract van onbepaalde duur en een competitief salarispakket met:

een mobiliteitsbudget
maaltijdcheques van 8 euro/dag (eigen bijdrage 1,09 euro/dag)
een hospitalisatieverzekering (je kan gezinsleden aansluiten)
een groepsverzekering
mogelijkheid tot kinderopvang tijdens alle schoolvakanties aan een voordelig tarief.




Bij Vlaanderen connect is een gezonde balans tussen werk en privé belangrijk: een werkweek van 38 uur, 28 dagen verlof en extra wettelijke feestdagen (11/07, 02/11, 15/11 en 26/12). Verder zijn er flexibele werkuren en je kan thuiswerken.




Ten slotte krijg je bij Vlaanderen connect nog verschillende andere voordelen: je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.




Nieuwsgierig?

Bekijk de volledige vacature op https://www.vlaanderen.be/werken-voor-vlaanderen/vacatures/data-analist-dmow-via-vlaanderen-connect-d36980. Neem zeker eens een kijkje in het selectiereglement waarin een praktisch voorbeeld staat uitgeschreven en wat jouw rol als data analist kan zijn.




Overtuigd?!

Solliciteren kan via de sollicitatieknop!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre mission

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

Vos responsabilités

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily: 


You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.


Vos atouts

Your Profile As a Data Analyst


You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management. 
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus. 
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure. 
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).


Notre offre


A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Location : Brussels.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.
Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.


Vous voulez participer au succès de Partenamut ?

Click on "apply" to access our online application form.

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead
Description:
📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)




At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.




Your Mission:

Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.




What You Bring:

4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.




Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.




This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.




If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.




Full job description & application details here.




Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title
Business Data Analyst

Job Description

Job title: Business Data Analyst
In this role you will ensure data consistency, quality, and utility across key domains. Also, you will collaborate with stakeholders, technical teams, and cross-functional experts to enhance analytics, support system improvements, and align Master Data Management (MDM) across processes and IT applications.

Your role:

Perform advanced analytics, data mapping, and reporting to support initiatives and projects.
Work on data quality initiatives
Support system and process improvements.
Develop deep expertise in key data domains and maintain a strong expert network.
Gather and document business, technical, and compliance requirements for Master Data Management consistency.
Deploy standards and guidelines to ensure process and system alignment across teams (Markets, BUs, Sales, Order Management, others).
Work with experts to gain a full end-to-end view of data processes, ensuring alignment with Business Data Stewards.
Ensure timely delivery and high-quality analysis and reports.
Engage with business stakeholders to understand challenges and translate them into analytics solutions.
Bridge technical teams and business stakeholders to align Master Data behavior.
Validate data lineage and contribute to building a data catalog.


You're the right fit if:

You have bachelor’s or master’s degree in information management, computer/data science, or related field.
Experience with SAP or similar industry applications preferred.
Proficiency in one / two key data domain (Material, Customer, Installed Base, Pricing, others).
Knowledge of applications like Windchill, SFDC, SAP, Service Max, and similar.
Experience with analytics tools (Advanced Excel + Macros, Power BI, Qlik Sense, etc.).
3–5 years of experience in a similar-sized, complex, matrixed organization.
Experience in the medical or highly regulated industry is a plus.
Strong business acumen, including industry, sector, and process knowledge.
Strong business acumen and understanding of data flows and lineage.
Excellent communication and articulation skills to bridge technical and business perspectives.
Independent, structured, and well-planned work approach with strong documentation and guiding capabilities.
Problem-solving mindset with experience in root cause analysis and lean principles.
Curious, resilient, and collaborative, able to work across global teams and time zones.
Experience working with global, multidisciplinary, and virtual teams.


About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.


Learn more about our business.
Discover our rich and exciting history.
Learn more about our purpose.


If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?




Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‘Data analytics expertise centre’




WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?




The ‘Data analytics expertise centre’ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.




WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?




You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.




WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?




A Master’s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline); a doctorate is an asset.
Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.




WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?




A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Flexible working hours.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Opportunities for internal mobility.
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.




Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

  • You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.


WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?


  • A Master’s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline); a doctorate is an asset.
  • Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
  • Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
  • Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
  • An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
  • Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
  • Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
  • Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
  • Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
  • Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.


WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?


  • A full-time job with a permanent contract.
  • The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
  • A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
  • A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
  • Flexible working hours.
  • Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
  • Opportunities for internal mobility.
  • Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.


Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French
