Title: Data Analyst Senior (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez, Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN, Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions. Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 8 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en France ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !


Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Support Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Support Analyst (Data & Reporting Analyst)

Location: Brussels, Belgic

Security Clearance Requirement: NATO Secret




Duties & Responsibilities

Support the rollout and operations of continuous listening initiatives.
Assist with ad hoc survey activities, including the further development of leavers' feedback surveys.
Support data and reporting governance, including:
Monitoring data quality (DQ)
Assisting data stewards and power users
Engaging in Service Level Agreement (SLA) discussions
Assist with organizational taxonomy review and operations.
Contribute to reporting and data visualization projects, including:
OBIA, OTBI, OBIEE
Reporting for LFS and RPMO
Handle ad hoc reporting requests, including:
Core HR, TA, PM reporting inquiries
Sick leave analysis
Annual reports
Support the monthly reporting cycle.
Participate in process improvement initiatives.




Required Skills & Qualifications

Analytical mindset: Ability to work with data and derive actionable insights.
Pragmatic problem-solving: Efficiently finding solutions to challenges.
Data visualization expertise.
Strong communication skills, including the ability to:
Convince others and lead smaller change initiatives.
Present complex matters in an audience-adjusted manner.
Structured approach: Ability to clarify complex and ambiguous information.
Project management & organizational skills: Ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Independent & self-sufficient: Proactive in seeking information and working autonomously.




Technical Skills

Project Management (PM)
Data visualization tools – Oracle BI, Power BI
Advanced Excel skills
PowerPoint proficiency
Data science (asset)
Automation (asset)
HR experience (beneficial but not required)

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Function

Advisory - Advisor

Roles & Responsibilities

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Our team of consultants works alongside clients to help them transform raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic growth. As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, we combine deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative solutions.

Role Overview

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will play a key role in helping our clients unlock the potential of their data. You will work on a variety of projects across different industries, focusing on improving decision-making processes, enhancing reporting capabilities, and developing data-driven strategies. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and clients to ensure that data is collected, structured, and visualized in a way that drives value.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with clients to understand their data challenges and business objectives
Design and implement BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize data models
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights
Provide recommendations to improve data management and reporting processes
Stay updated with the latest BI tools and technologies
Contribute to project management by ensuring timely and quality delivery


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications


Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
Team player with a collaborative mindset
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
A good communication knowledge of Dutch & English


We offer


A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.


Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Reporting & Data Lead to join our dynamic team within the Insight-to-Impact department. In this role, you will focus on managing and streamlining data operations, reporting processes, and leading daily operations. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management, project management, and cross-functional collaboration to drive high-quality, data-driven decision-making across the organization. A solid understanding of in-market data and its complexities, as well as experience using activity data in the pharmaceutical industry to generate actionable insights, is essential.




Key Responsibilities:




Data Management:

Manage and oversee go-to-market datasets, including activity data, in-market data, patient data, and market research.

Collaborate with teams across Commercial, Medical, and Market Access to ensure alignment and effectiveness.

Monitor data quality control processes to maintain accuracy and integrity.

Develop and enforce data management policies and best practices to standardize processes and ensure compliance.




Reporting Operations:

Oversee reporting processes to deliver actionable insights to key stakeholders.

Ensure timely and accurate report generation and dashboard development for business units.

Coordinate with country OE-leads.

Work with analytics teams to standardize reporting frameworks and key performance indicators (KPIs).




Project Management:

Lead and manage day-to-day data and reporting operations.

Optimize workflow for issue resolution and demand management.

Coordinate with IT, analytics, and business teams to align resources and ensure success.




Data Governance:

Establish and maintain data governance frameworks for compliance with regulatory and organizational requirements.

Define roles, responsibilities, and processes for managing data assets.

Promote a culture of data accountability and ethical data usage throughout the organization.




Qualifications:




Experience: Minimum 8 years of experience in data management, reporting, or related roles, preferably in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry. Proven experience in managing data projects and delivering measurable results.
Strong proficiency in business intelligence and data analysis.
Familiarity with pharmaceutical data landscapes and CRM data models from a technical perspective.
Hands-on experience with data management tools, reporting software, and databases (e.g., SQL, Snowflake, Power BI).
Excellent project management skills.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills to facilitate cross-functional collaboration.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to lead high-priority, business-critical initiatives within a matrix organization.
Fluent English proficiency is mandatory.

Show more
HTML:
Job Description:

We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Reporting & Data Lead to join our dynamic team within the Insight-to-Impact department. In this role, you will focus on managing and streamlining data operations, reporting processes, and leading daily operations. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management, project management, and cross-functional collaboration to drive high-quality, data-driven decision-making across the organization. A solid understanding of in-market data and its complexities, as well as experience using activity data in the pharmaceutical industry to generate actionable insights, is essential.


Key Responsibilities:


Data Management:

Manage and oversee go-to-market datasets, including activity data, in-market data, patient data, and market research.

Collaborate with teams across Commercial, Medical, and Market Access to ensure alignment and effectiveness.

Monitor data quality control processes to maintain accuracy and integrity.

Develop and enforce data management policies and best practices to standardize processes and ensure compliance.


Reporting Operations:

Oversee reporting processes to deliver actionable insights to key stakeholders.

Ensure timely and accurate report generation and dashboard development for business units.

Coordinate with country OE-leads.

Work with analytics teams to standardize reporting frameworks and key performance indicators (KPIs).


Project Management:

Lead and manage day-to-day data and reporting operations.

Optimize workflow for issue resolution and demand management.

Coordinate with IT, analytics, and business teams to align resources and ensure success.


Data Governance:

Establish and maintain data governance frameworks for compliance with regulatory and organizational requirements.

Define roles, responsibilities, and processes for managing data assets.

Promote a culture of data accountability and ethical data usage throughout the organization.


Qualifications:


  • Experience: Minimum 8 years of experience in data management, reporting, or related roles, preferably in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry. Proven experience in managing data projects and delivering measurable results.
  • Strong proficiency in business intelligence and data analysis.
  • Familiarity with pharmaceutical data landscapes and CRM data models from a technical perspective.
  • Hands-on experience with data management tools, reporting software, and databases (e.g., SQL, Snowflake, Power BI).
  • Excellent project management skills.
  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills to facilitate cross-functional collaboration.
  • Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to lead high-priority, business-critical initiatives within a matrix organization.
  • Fluent English proficiency is mandatory.

Title: Data Analyst Senior (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: Senior Data Analyst (for our client)
Description:
Position: Data Analyst (Power BI & DAX Expert)

We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst with strong expertise in Power BI and DAX. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in transforming operational data into analytical models, enhancing the data literacy of team members, and contributing to the conceptualization of the data architecture.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide effective solutions.
Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to generate meaningful insights.
Design and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports to support data-driven decision-making.
Ensure high data quality and integrity through continuous verification and validation.
Advocate for data analytics within the department by initiating awareness programs.
Develop and implement analytical models using operational data.
Mentor and support one or two P&O colleagues in the field of data analytics.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the conceptual data architecture.
Leverage AI solutions to enhance Power BI dashboard sophistication and insights.




Job Details:

Start Date: ASAP
Duration: 6 months (possibility of extension depending on project progress)
Location: Brussels city center




Required Skills & Experience:

Senior-level expertise in data analysis and Power BI.
Strong understanding of data analytics and visualization methodologies.
Sharp analytical and critical thinking skills for interpreting complex information.




Preferred Experience:

Background in the insurance or financial industry.




Technical Requirements:

Mandatory:

Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365.
Expert-level knowledge of Power BI, including report creation, dashboard development, and advanced functionalities like Power Query and DAX.
Strong skills in data analysis, anomaly detection, and categorization.
Experience in data modeling for efficient structuring and establishing relationships between datasets.
Mastery of data visualization techniques for clear and impactful data representation.




Preferred:

Experience with Python.
Familiarity with Copilot M365.
Knowledge of time series modeling techniques such as ARIMA for predictive analytics in Power BI.
Exposure to Azure Cognitive Services.




If you are passionate about data analytics and eager to make a meaningful impact, we would love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Bij Telenet worden we gedreven door de ambitie om machine learning en AI te integreren in alle facetten van onze bedrijfsvoering, strategische besluitvorming en communicatiekanalen. In het kader van deze visie zijn we actief op zoek naar getalenteerde MLOps Engineers om de ML-modellen die door onze Data Scientists zijn ontwikkeld, om te zetten in blijvende bedrijfswaarde.

Met een team van meer dan 40 data-experts (Data Scientists, Data Strategists, CRM-experts en Insights Analysts), toegang tot een state-of-the-art AWS Cloud-omgeving en intensieve samenwerking met de business teams binnen de organisatie, levert het Telenet Analytics-team al aanzienlijke waarde voor het bedrijf. Het verbeteren van de klantbeleving door het voorspellen van defecte klantapparatuur, het optimaliseren van netwerkinvesteringen door de toekomstige vraag te voorspellen, en het ondersteunen van hypergepersonaliseerde communicatie via een reeks voorspellende modellen, zijn slechts enkele voorbeelden hiervan. De uitbreiding van ons MLOps-team vormt het laatste ingrediënt om dit naar een nog hoger niveau te tillen en echt een (inter)nationale koploper en een onmiskenbare pijler van het bedrijf te worden.

Als Junior MLOps Engineer combineer je je expertise in Data Engineering, DevOps-vaardigheden en affiniteit met machine learning om ML- / Data Science-systemen in productie te implementeren en onderhouden, terwijl je de maturiteit van de gerelateerde operationele processen en kaders verbetert. Je werkt ook nauw samen met onze Data Scientists, biedt technische begeleiding bij modelontwikkeling en ondersteunt hen met sjablonen en herbruikbare componenten.

Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden


Industrialisatie van ML-modellen en datafeatures ontwikkeld door Data Scientists
Ontwikkeling & onderhoud van het framework en templates voor de industrialisatie van modellen, ter ondersteuning van zowel batch scoring als live inference
Ontwikkeling & onderhoud van onze Analytics Feature Store, die fungeert als de belangrijkste bron van informatie voor ML-modellen en ad-hoc analyses
Modelleren en monitoren van de datakwaliteit - controleer de beschikbaarheid en kwaliteit van modelresultaten en feature-waarden, spot en analyseer problemen, communiceer met data scientists en zakelijke stakeholders en zorg ervoor dat problemen snel worden opgelost
Bouw en onderhoud een bibliotheek van herbruikbare componenten om modelontwikkeling te vergemakkelijken en te standaardiseren, en de efficiëntie van de Data Scientists te verhogen
Werk nauw samen met Data Scientists tijdens de modelontwikkeling om technische begeleiding te bieden


Over jou

MLOps Engineers vormen de brug tussen data science en data engineering en moeten daarom een goede mix van competenties uit beide werelden hebben. We verwachten echter niet dat kandidaten al aan alle vereisten voldoen. Dus, als je jezelf herkent in de meeste van de onderstaande eigenschappen, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren!


Masterdiploma met focus op informatica / machine learning (of gelijkwaardig)
Goede kennis van Machine Learning Engineering, Data Engineering of DevOps, en minimaal basiskennis van de andere domeinen. Werkervaring in een van deze domeinen is een plus
Goede kennis van programmeer- en querytalen (Python, PySpark, SQL), waarbij bekendheid met Python-bibliotheken die vaak worden gebruikt in wetenschappelijke computing en machine learning (pandas, scikit-learn, pytorch, enz.) een plus is
Bekendheid met de AWS Cloud-omgeving (en AWS Sagemaker in het bijzonder), Snowflake en/of dbt is niet strikt vereist, maar zeker een toegevoegde waarde
Praktische ervaring met Git
Een probleemoplossende mindset, sterke zelfdiscipline en bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor de operationele gezondheid en betrouwbaarheid van onze ML-modellen
Teamplayer met goede communicatieve vaardigheden om met data scientists te communiceren en het eerste aanspreekpunt te zijn voor zakelijke stakeholders in geval van problemen of vragen
Bereidheid om te leren en nieuwsgierigheid naar nieuwe technologieën en innovaties
Vloeiend Engels


Wat wij bieden


Begin een nieuw avontuur in een innovatieve, gezonde en ambitieuze organisatie die zich richt op het (inter)nationaal koploper worden in het benutten van AI en machine learning.
Geniet van flexibele werktijden en de vrijheid om vanuit huis te werken (3 dagen per week) of in onze open en trendy samenwerkingsplekken op kantoor
Werk in een state-of-the-art AWS Cloud-omgeving
We coachen je, trainen je en maken je deel van ons verhaal. Je hebt toegang tot een uitgebreid opleidingsaanbod en externe platforms zoals Datacamp en Linkedin Learning, en volop gelegenheid om on-the-job te leren
Een agile organisatie die persoonlijke groei, interne mobiliteit en de mogelijkheid om van rol te veranderen stimuleert
Word onderdeel van een jong, dynamisch, enthousiast en resultaatgericht data-team, met leuke teambuildings, padelwedstrijden op kantoor en de occasionele afterwork drinks
Geniet van een aantrekkelijk compensatie- en voordelenpakket, inclusief maaltijdcheques, groeps- en gezondheidsverzekering, een jaarlijkse bonus en kortingen op Telenet-producten.

Title: Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.




Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.




Heb jij de bovennatuurlijke gave om ruwe data om te zetten in goud? Ben je gepassioneerd door data en overtuigd dat datakwaliteit dé sleutel is om organisaties waarde uit hun data te laten halen? Dan heeft LACO een data-gedreven avontuur op maat voor jou!

Als onze Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert ben jij de Sherlock Holmes van cijfers: je ontrafelt bedrijfsvereisten alsof het aanwijzingen in een mysterie zijn. Je bouwt niet alleen inzichten op, maar vormt ook strategische data-oplossingen die bedrijven naar succes leiden.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Verzamelen en analyseren van data uit verschillende bronnen om inconsistenties en trends te identificeren
Signaleren van datakwaliteitsproblemen en de impact ervan op de business
Schoonmaken van data en het achterhalen van de oorzaken van kwaliteitsproblemen
Ontwikkelen en implementeren van datakwaliteitscontroles
Opzetten van Power BI dashboards om datakwaliteit te monitoren
Samenwerken met stakeholders en verschillende teams rond data kwaliteit en dataplatformen
Ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI rapporten en dashboards volgens de behoeften van de business
Identificeren van oorzaken van datakwaliteitsproblemen en implementeren van oplossingen.
Op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste technologieën en best practices binnen data-analyse en datakwaliteit




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding
Je bent communicatief sterk en gewend om met business stakeholders samen te werken
Je hebt een analytische mindset en kan business vereisten vertalen naar data-oplossingen
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met datakwaliteit projecten
Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage en Reporting Governance
Je hebt een sterke kennis van SQL
Je hebt ervaring met Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en Star Schemas (Kimball)




Bonuspunten als je …

Ervaring hebt met Master Data Management.
Bekend bent met datakwaliteitstools zoals Azure Purview, Collibra, Informatica of Soda.
Kennis hebt van Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL.
Ervaring met security protocollen zoals Column Level Security (CLS) en Object Level Security.




Ons aanbod

We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …




Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met onze recruiters en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Show more

Wij zoeken een Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!


Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.

Title: Data Analytics and Business Intelligence
Description:
Job Description

Role: External Service Provider (Data Analytics and Reporting)




Description of Tasks:




The external service provider will perform the following tasks:




Requirements Gathering & Collaboration:
Collect and analyze business requirements.
Participate in meetings with project teams.
Data Analysis & Pipeline Development:
Identify relevant data sources linked to business needs.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to validate and understand the available data.
Establish technical procedures to retrieve and link relevant data through structured and efficient data pipelines.
Model Development & Maintenance:
Create and maintain technical components to support the full lifecycle of statistical and Machine Learning models at scale.
Develop solutions to handle and exploit large volumes of unstructured data.
Business Intelligence & Reporting:
Design and develop Business Intelligence (BI) reports, dashboards, and other data products.
Validate results and ensure proper documentation.
Documentation & Interaction:
Write technical documentation.
Interact with business analysts, users, project leaders, and developers to ensure alignment.




Knowledge & Skills Required:




Core Skills:




Proficiency in SQL and Python programming language.
Understanding of statistical and Machine Learning models, particularly for forecasting purposes.
Experience with business intelligence tools like SAP BI and Qlik.
Ability to adapt to rapidly changing Data Analytics technologies.




Specific Expertise Required:




At least 2 years of experience with Python programming
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Role: External Service Provider (Data Analytics and Reporting)


Description of Tasks:


The external service provider will perform the following tasks:


  1. Requirements Gathering & Collaboration:
  • Collect and analyze business requirements.
  • Participate in meetings with project teams.
  1. Data Analysis & Pipeline Development:
  • Identify relevant data sources linked to business needs.
  • Conduct exploratory data analysis to validate and understand the available data.
  • Establish technical procedures to retrieve and link relevant data through structured and efficient data pipelines.
  1. Model Development & Maintenance:
  • Create and maintain technical components to support the full lifecycle of statistical and Machine Learning models at scale.
  • Develop solutions to handle and exploit large volumes of unstructured data.
  1. Business Intelligence & Reporting:
  • Design and develop Business Intelligence (BI) reports, dashboards, and other data products.
  • Validate results and ensure proper documentation.
  1. Documentation & Interaction:
  • Write technical documentation.
  • Interact with business analysts, users, project leaders, and developers to ensure alignment.


Knowledge & Skills Required:


Core Skills:


  • Proficiency in SQL and Python programming language.
  • Understanding of statistical and Machine Learning models, particularly for forecasting purposes.
  • Experience with business intelligence tools like SAP BI and Qlik.
  • Ability to adapt to rapidly changing Data Analytics technologies.


Specific Expertise Required:


  • At least 2 years of experience with Python programming

Title: Data Analyst Confirmé (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: Power BI Expert
Description:
A rapidly growing company is seeking an experienced Data Analyst / Power BI Expert to join the Business Intelligence team. In this role, you'll transform complex datasets into valuable insights and develop advanced Power BI solutions that empower data-driven decision-making. The position is based in Brussels.

Responsibilities

Power BI Development:

Create and manage advanced Power BI reports and dashboards, utilizing sophisticated DAX functions, calculations, and data models.
Optimize report performance for large datasets to ensure efficient data processing and visualization.
Implement security measures like row-level security to maintain data confidentiality.
Develop and maintain custom visuals and extensions to enhance reporting capabilities.

Data Analysis and Visualization:

Analyze diverse, large datasets to identify key trends and insights.
Design clear, impactful data visualizations that effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure accuracy and reliability.

Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing:

Work closely with data engineers for seamless data processing and preparation.
Mentor junior analysts on Power BI best practices and advanced techniques.
Contribute to team knowledge-sharing initiatives and support collective growth.

Your Profile

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science or Statistics.
At least 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong focus on Power BI.
Experience working with complex data environments, such as data warehousing and big data.
Extensive knowledge of data modeling techniques, including star schema and dimensional modeling.

Technical Skills:

Expert in Power BI (both Desktop and Service), including advanced DAX, Power Query (M), and data modeling.
Strong SQL skills and experience with various database systems.
Familiar with optimization techniques for Power BI reports and dashboards.
Knowledgeable in data security best practices within Power BI.

Personal Skills:

Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills for conveying data insights clearly.
Independent worker, but also a collaborative team player.
Passionate about continuous learning and data.

Bonus Points:

Experience with other data visualization tools (such as Tableau or Qlik Sense).
Familiarity with programming languages like Python or R.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure or AWS).
Microsoft Power BI certification.

What We Offer

Permanent, full-time contract
Dynamic work environment within an innovative and fast-growing organization
Autonomy and entrepreneurship within your role
Results-oriented management with room for personal input
Competitive salary based on experience and responsibilities
Opportunities for professional and personal development

Are you ready for a new challenge in an inspiring environment? We look forward to your application!

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
📢 We’re Hiring: Digital Analytics Specialist

Are you passionate about digital business and data-driven insights? We’re looking for a Digital Analytics Specialist to join our team and help us analyze customer behavior while optimizing our websites and apps.

Your Responsibilities

✅ Manage and maintain web analytics implementations for websites and apps

✅ Ensure consistent tracking, analysis, and reporting of key website KPIs

✅ Detect trends in online behavior across pre-sales, sales, servicing, and support

✅ Translate business requirements into tagging guidelines

✅ Develop dashboards in Adobe Analytics and conduct proactive analyses

Your Profile

🎓 Experience: 2-5 years in digital analytics

📊 Strong experience with Adobe Analytics dashboards & data layer recommendations

💡 Familiarity with Google Analytics, Looker Studio, and Contentsquare




Who You Are

✔️ Able to work independently and take initiative

✔️ Passionate about digital business and analytics

✔️ Motivated and eager to learn

Practical Details

📍 Location: Hybrid (2 days/week on-site)

🚀 Ready to take on this challenge? Apply now and join a dynamic environment where data drives decisions!

Title: Data Analyst - Data & AI
Description:
Ben je gepassioneerd door data & analyse en krijg jij energie van het bouwen van Power BI dashboards met oog voor design die relevante informatie helder voorstellen? Werk je bovendien graag mee aan de meest innovatieve data oplossingen van de toekomst? Dan is een rol als Power BI Data Analyst binnen ons Data & AI team misschien interessant voor jou!


In je rol als Power BI Data Analyst werk je nauw samen met ervaren collega’s aan Business Intelligence, Big Data en AI-projecten. Deze projecten worden voornamelijk in de Microsoft Cloud uitgevoerd.
Aan de hand van je analytisch inzicht help je mee aan de transformatie van ruwe data tot inzichtelijke informatie door gebruiksvriendelijke Power BI dashboards te ontwikkelen.
Je analyseert de noden van de klant en vormt de brug tussen business users en data engineers.
Je voorziet de klant van nieuwe inzichten door eenvoudig te begrijpen data visualisaties uit te werken.
Je bent een krak in het geven van demo's aan onze klanten.
Innovatie en kennisdeling staan bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam en leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data & AI funteam.


Wat breng jij mee?


Je behaalde een bachelor of master, bij voorkeur op het gebied van (Bedrijfskundige) Informatica of Business IT & Management of een hieraan gerelateerde studierichting.
Je hebt enkele jaren ervaring opgebouwd als Data Analyst en Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen meer.
Je hebt een aanstekelijk enthousiasme over data & business intelligence.
Kennis omtrent het Microsoft Azure Data Analytics Cloud platform is een pluspunt.
Je hebt (of wenst) een Microsoft Certified Professional certificaat.
Kennis van technologie in data engineering en datawarehouses is een plus. Ook kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python is een meerwaarde.
Je bouwt impactvolle dashboards als geen ander én je haalt energie uit storytelling.
Je brengt een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale houding met je mee.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden (zowel in het Nederlands als in het Engels), klantgerichtheid en nauwkeurigheid zijn tevens zeer belangrijk in deze rol.
Een bepaalde flexibiliteit naar verplaatsingen is vereist aangezien er af en toe van bij de klant wordt gewerkt. Als je aanwezigheid bij de klant niet vereist is dan kan je in het Cegeka-kantoor dichtst bij je woonplaats werken (Antwerpen, Diegem, Gent, Hasselt of Leuven) of vanuit je home office!


Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?


We vragen heel wat (talenten) van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug! Competenties en karakter zijn voor ons essentieel, naast ervaring en ambities. Cegeka investeert voortdurend in talent management opdat elke medewerker zijn potentieel kan realiseren.
Je start bij een Top Employer!
Een marktconform loon aangevuld met extralegale voordelen. Een elektrische wagen met laadpas of een mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques, een interessante groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering, een gsm-abonnement, een forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding, een krachtige laptop en de mogelijkheid om je salarispakket een eigen accent te geven dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan.
Flexibele werkuren én een mooie work/life balans.
Een top team: waarin nieuwe frisse ideeën en initiatieven steeds welkom zijn! Team-events, happy hours en een steeds legendarisch bedrijfsfeest horen daar ook bij.
Begeleiding op maat: doorheen jouw carrière word je begeleid door onze people managers. Zo heb je een aanspreekpunt, een persoonlijke coach én een sparringpartner.
Continu bijleren: door innovation centers, leesgroepen, knowledge sharing meetings, hackatons, deelname aan conferenties en externe opleidingen zetten we kennisdeling en bijleren centraal.
Mogelijkheid tot groei: afhankelijk van je eigen interesses en initiatieven, biedt Cegeka verschillende horizontale en verticale carrièrepaden.
Hybride werken: je werkt vanuit een Cegeka kantoor in jouw buurt (Hasselt, Leuven, Diegem, Antwerpen, Gent), gecombineerd met on site aanwezigheid bij de klant en thuiswerk.
We hechten waarde aan duurzaamheid door CO2-neutraliteit na te streven met de elektrificatie van ons wagenpark en een milieuvriendelijk datacenter. We ontwikkelen innovatieve oplossingen met een positieve impact op milieu, mens en maatschappij, en streven naar een inclusieve en diverse werkomgeving waarin iedereen gewaardeerd en gehoord wordt.


Aspire to more: onze belofte aan jou

Je krijgt bij Cegeka alle ruimte om jezelf als professional verder te ontwikkelen. Samen realiseren we wat je écht wil betekenen voor onze klanten en collega’s. We nodigen je graag uit om met ons mee te groeien. In een ongekende veelzijdigheid aan uitdagende, betekenisvolle IT-projecten. Zet je stempel op projecten voor aansprekende klanten waarbij we het verschil maken. Aspire to more.

Intensief, met veel plezier en betrokkenheid. We werken hier altijd met elkaar samen, in close cooperation met collega’s én met de klant. Binnen een cultuur, gedreven door onze waarden: eigenaarschap, persoonlijke ontwikkeling, respect en authenticiteit. Kom deel uitmaken van de volgende fase van een succesvol, snelgroeiend en innovatief internationaal IT-bedrijf.


Show more
HTML:
Ben je gepassioneerd door data & analyse en krijg jij energie van het bouwen van Power BI dashboards met oog voor design die relevante informatie helder voorstellen? Werk je bovendien graag mee aan de meest innovatieve data oplossingen van de toekomst? Dan is een rol als Power BI Data Analyst binnen ons Data & AI team misschien interessant voor jou!

  • In je rol als Power BI Data Analyst werk je nauw samen met ervaren collega’s aan Business Intelligence, Big Data en AI-projecten. Deze projecten worden voornamelijk in de Microsoft Cloud uitgevoerd.
  • Aan de hand van je analytisch inzicht help je mee aan de transformatie van ruwe data tot inzichtelijke informatie door gebruiksvriendelijke Power BI dashboards te ontwikkelen.
  • Je analyseert de noden van de klant en vormt de brug tussen business users en data engineers.
  • Je voorziet de klant van nieuwe inzichten door eenvoudig te begrijpen data visualisaties uit te werken.
  • Je bent een krak in het geven van demo's aan onze klanten.
  • Innovatie en kennisdeling staan bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
  • Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam en leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data & AI funteam.

Wat breng jij mee?

  • Je behaalde een bachelor of master, bij voorkeur op het gebied van (Bedrijfskundige) Informatica of Business IT & Management of een hieraan gerelateerde studierichting.
  • Je hebt enkele jaren ervaring opgebouwd als Data Analyst en Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen meer.
  • Je hebt een aanstekelijk enthousiasme over data & business intelligence.
  • Kennis omtrent het Microsoft Azure Data Analytics Cloud platform is een pluspunt.

Title: Solver - Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist
Description:
About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and AI.




At Exsolvæ, our "Solvers" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.




We are seeking a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist to join our expert team and help our clients unlock the power of data to drive strategic decision-making and innovation.




Your Role:

As a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist, you will design and implement data-driven solutions that enable organizations to make informed, strategic decisions. You will work alongside multidisciplinary teams, using advanced BI tools and techniques to create insightful dashboards, reports, and analytics workflows.




What We’re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications

Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, and strong SQL skills for querying databases.
Data Integration Skills: Experience with ETL/ELT processes and tools such as Azure Data Factory, SSIS, or Informatica.
Cloud Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud BI platforms like Azure Synapse Analytics, AWS QuickSight, or Google BigQuery.
Programming Skills: Familiarity with Python or R for advanced analytics and statistical modeling.
Soft Skills: Strong analytical thinking, communication, and collaboration skills to work with clients and multidisciplinary teams.




Preferred Skills

Knowledge of big data tools like Apache Spark or Hadoop.
Experience with predictive analytics and machine learning integration into BI workflows.
Familiarity with KPI frameworks and business acumen to align analytics with strategic goals.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or Tableau Certified Professional.




What You’ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to assess their analytical needs and recommend BI solutions that align with their strategic goals.
Data Integration and Reporting: Design and implement data visualization solutions using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, creating impactful dashboards and reports.
Data Ecosystem Implementation: Build and optimize scalable data pipelines to process and transform data efficiently for BI and analytics purposes.




Technical Implementation

Data Modeling: Develop and maintain robust, scalable data models to support analytical needs.
ETL/ELT Development: Create efficient data integration workflows using ETL/ELT tools and frameworks.
Advanced Analytics: Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.
Cloud BI Solutions: Deploy and manage BI workflows on platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud to ensure performance and scalability.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on advancements in BI and analytics technologies, tools, and methodologies.
Explore innovative ways to integrate advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive analytics and machine learning, into BI solutions.




Project Management

Lead BI and analytics projects from concept to completion, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end solutions that meet client objectives.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams with BI and analytics capabilities.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the reliability and scalability of deployed solutions.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse BI and analytics projects across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Access the latest BI and analytics tools and training opportunities to stay at the cutting edge.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values knowledge sharing and mutual growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.




If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

  • Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.


If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst - Insurance
Description:
SENIOR DATA ANALYST - INSURANCE SECTOR

Your Role & Work Environment

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in fostering a data-driven culture within a leading company in the insurance sector. Your mission will be to support business teams by providing valuable insights that enhance decision-making processes and optimize customer interactions.

You will be part of an agile, multidisciplinary team, collaborating with professionals across various domains to develop impactful analytical solutions. Your work will focus on creating automated dashboards, conducting deep dives into customer behaviors, and generating advanced reports to drive strategic initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Translating Business Needs into Analytical Solutions

Engage with stakeholders to understand and challenge business requirements.
Assess feasibility, define clear objectives, and set realistic timelines.
Ensure data availability and design a suitable analytical approach, effectively communicating your methodology to stakeholders.

Data Analysis & Execution

Conduct in-depth analysis on customer data to address business questions.
Perform customer behavior analysis and develop predictive models.
Create advanced ad-hoc reports using tools such as SQL, Cognos, and Adobe Analytics.

Delivering Insights & Recommendations

Use data visualization techniques to communicate findings effectively.
Adapt messaging and storytelling to suit different audiences.
Provide clear, data-driven recommendations while considering data privacy regulations.

What We Are Looking For

We seek a proactive, analytical, and results-oriented professional who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. You should have a strong ability to translate business needs into actionable data insights while maintaining a critical and strategic mindset.

Required Qualifications & Skills

Master's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analytics, with at least 2 years in the insurance sector.
Strong SQL skills (mandatory).
Experience with analytical tools such as SAS, Cognos, or Adobe Analytics (preferred).
Ability to influence stakeholders through data-driven insights.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong analytical mindset.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).

What We Offer

A dynamic, fast-paced environment where innovation and collaboration drive success.
Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development in data analytics.
A work culture that values ownership, creativity, and analytical excellence.
The chance to work on strategic projects with high business impact.

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and have experience in the insurance sector, we would love to hear from you!

  • Provide ongoing support to ensure the reliability and scalability of deployed solutions.


Why Join Us?

  • Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse BI and analytics projects across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing.
  • Continuous Learning: Access the latest BI and analytics tools and training opportunities to stay at the cutting edge.
  • Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values knowledge sharing and mutual growth.
  • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
  • Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.


If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
Introduction

Technopolis is offering a 5-6 months paid internship at our Brussels office.

About This Job

We seek to appoint an enthusiastic intern to gain first-hand insights in applying data science techniques for policy analysis. It is an exciting time to join the growing data science work at Technopolis Group, where we are deploying new tools across our practice to enhance our policy analysis capacity, from generative AI to reproduceable analytical pipelines. You will mainly focus on developing cross-cutting tools and techniques that can be applied across the company, as well as contribute to specific projects.

Your profile

Applicants Suitable For This Position Should Have


Recently finalised university education (master) or a student currently in the last year of a Master programme, preferably in data science, applied statistics, or related fields. Priority will be given to applicants that combine data science with economics or public policy, either in your studies or in past professional experience.
Experience of programming languages for data manipulation, especially Python, R and SQL.
Some knowledge of modern data science tools and concepts such as git, Github, Visual Studio, environment variables.
Experience and interest in data science techniques such as generative AI and other machine learning techniques.
Interest in widening your skillset beyond data science: we develop fully-rounded analysts who are also capable of applying data science techniques – not just programmers.
Interest in European Commission policies, in particular in science, technology and innovation;
Excellent communication skills in English;
Ability to work independently and as part of a team;
Willingness to learn about new topics, methods, and skills.


The Following Will Be Considered As a Plus


Proficiency in other languages.


Your Responsibilities

Typical tasks may include:


Developing data analysis pipelines;
Applying supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to mainly text data;
Data wrangling;
Data visualisation;
Reporting results of analysis;
Assist in other tasks such as literature reviews, case studies and other tasks where needed.


Our offer

Skills

The successful candidate will work as a paid intern in our Brussels office. The role provides the opportunity to gain experience in working at the forefront of European policymaking, to develop analytical skills, and to experience a multinational, friendly business environment. Our package includes:


Paid internship
Belgian phone subscription
Monthly allowance for the transportation card
Training and mentoring possibilities
Working in an international company with 12 offices and more than 290 colleagues


Interested? Apply directly

Applicants need to have either EU citizenship or a valid work permit.

For any questions on the recruitment, please contact recruitment_be@technopolis-group.com (reference DSU_INT2025).

Only the short-listed candidates will be contacted.

About Us

Technopolis Group started as a consultancy firm for the evaluation of science, technology and innovation. While evaluation is still at the core of our company, we have over the years built up the know-how to support decision making on a broad range of topics. Our experts provide strategy and foresight, manage networks and provide project management support for even the most complex projects. We are acquainted with a wide range of quantitative methods and deliver advanced data analytics that is ahead of the curve. We evaluate policies, evaluate their impact and communicate them effectively to experts and the broader public. We never settle for out-of-the-box solutions but work with our clients to find the approach that best fits their needs.

We work with decision-makers in different levels and fields, from international institutions, such as the European Commission and multilateral development banks, to regional and local authorities. Our clients include universities and R&D centres, network organisations such as business associations, clusters and incubators as well as governments.

Title: Data Analyst / Data Consultant
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture
Show more

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre mission

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

Vos responsabilités

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily: 


You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.


Vos atouts

Your Profile As a Data Analyst


You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management. 
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus. 
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure. 
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).


Notre offre


A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Location : Brussels.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.
Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.


Vous voulez participer au succès de Partenamut ?

Click on "apply" to access our online application form.
Show more

Title: Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst -  September 2025
Description:
About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.

At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!

As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Create and design data models.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.



Your profile

We Are Looking For Someone Who


Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Is eligible for security clearance.



Success In This Role Often Comes Down To


Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.



Why Capgemini?

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:


A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.



Ready to shape the future?

We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.

Apply today and Get The Future You Want!
Show more
