Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Engineer/Data Analyst who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!




We are looking for multiple freelance professionals for different projects. Your personal passion, interests and experience will be decisive in setting the right accents and determining your personal journey.




Your job responsibilities:




Have experience in one or more of the following: data modelling, data warehousing, databases, ETL/ELT. Experience in data warehouse automation is considered as a plus.
Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or Microsoft Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Blob Storage.
You can turn the organisation's data into impactful reporting and clear insights that provide interpretation and lead to business process improvements.
Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.
Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.




Your Requirements:




Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.
You are located in Belgium & able to work on-site/remote depending on the client’s needs.




You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.




Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional. Throughout the years we built long lasting relationships where we made a difference. We thrive for the absolute match, technically and personally, for both parties.




We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.




Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result driven and have you a “can do” attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!




Looking forward to welcome you to the world of Brainbridge!

Show more
HTML:
Are you an experienced Data Engineer/Data Analyst who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!


We are looking for multiple freelance professionals for different projects. Your personal passion, interests and experience will be decisive in setting the right accents and determining your personal journey.


Your job responsibilities:


  • Have experience in one or more of the following: data modelling, data warehousing, databases, ETL/ELT. Experience in data warehouse automation is considered as a plus.
  • Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or Microsoft Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Blob Storage.
  • You can turn the organisation's data into impactful reporting and clear insights that provide interpretation and lead to business process improvements.
  • Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.
  • Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.


Your Requirements:


  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
  • Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.
  • You are located in Belgium & able to work on-site/remote depending on the client’s needs.


You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.


Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional. Throughout the years we built long lasting relationships where we made a difference. We thrive for the absolute match, technically and personally, for both parties.


We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.


Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result driven and have you a “can do” attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!


Looking forward to welcome you to the world of Brainbridge!

Title: Reporting Specialist (V/M/X)
Description:
Veolia BeLux is een dochteronderneming van de internationale groep Veolia, die essentiële diensten verleent aan burgers en bedrijven op het gebied van water, afval en energie. We hebben een passie voor het milieu.



Wil je graag werken in een fijne sfeer en weten dat wat je doet een verschil kan maken?



Keer het tij samen met Veolia! Je zal niet alleen bijleren en groeien, maar ook elke dag met plezier naar je werk komen!





Vacatureomschrijving



Als Reporting Specialist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het creëren, monitoren, analyseren en visualiseren van masterdata en key performance indicators binnen onze organisatie, meer bepaald voor de Waste activiteiten. Je vertaalt complexe data naar heldere inzichten en actionable dashboards voor het management. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende afdelingen om de rapportage continu te verbeteren.



Jouw belangrijkste taken:



Garanderen van data-integriteit in onze ERP-systemen
Verzamelen, interpreteren en analyseren van data met statistische technieken
Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van dashboards en KPI-rapportages
Identificeren van verbetermogelijkheden in rapportageprocessen
Uitvoeren van data cleaning en kwaliteitscontroles
Adviseren van stakeholders over rapportagemethoden en datamanagement
Fungeren als SPOC voor interne rapportage en dashboarding


Functie-eisen



Jouw profiel:



Bachelor of masterdiploma, bij voorkeur in een STEM of Finance richting
Al minstens een aantal jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke rol
Expert in data-analyse, visualisatie en rapportagetools (bv. Power BI, Tableau, SAS, Google Suite)
Sterke kennis van databases en data warehousing
Methodisch, gestructureerd en planmatig in je aanpak
Zelfstandig, maar ook in staat om constructief samen te werken
Heel goede kennis Nederlands, Frans en Engels
Interesse in de milieusector, een vorige werkervaring in die sector is een plus
Goede communicator, je bent in staat om data te vertalen naar tendensen en kan zo het breder kader schetsen


Aanvullende informatie



Wat bieden wij?



Een uitdagende functie met veel verantwoordelijkheid en impact
Doorgroeimogelijkheden binnen een internationale organisatie
Flexibele werktijden en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken
Competitief salarispakket met extralegale voordelen
Opleidingsmogelijkheden om je skills verder te ontwikkelen

Voor wie ga je werken?



Veolia BeLux maakt deel uit van de internationale groep Veolia, die aan burgers en bedrijven essentiële diensten verleent op het gebied van water, afval en energie. We hebben een passie voor het milieu. We werken samen met talloze industrieën en lokale instanties om de planeet en de natuurlijke rijkdommen te beschermen. Dat doen we onder meer door afvalwater te behandelen, afval in te zamelen en te recycleren, groene energie op te wekken en gebouwen energiezuiniger te maken. In België en Luxemburg stellen we bijna 4.300 mensen tewerk, verspreid over 66 operationele sites en 12 agentschappen. We bieden een breed scala aan carrièremogelijkheden en dat alles in een fijne en gemoedelijke sfeer in al onze vestigingen.



Bij Veolia zijn we trots dat we erkend worden als een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. In onze onderneming spelen leeftijd, afkomst, genderidentiteit, religie, geloofsovertuiging of seksuele geaardheid enz. geen enkele rol. Het enige wat telt zijn de ervaring, vaardigheden en passie van onze collega’s! Dat is onze kracht en onze rijkdom. Daarom moedigen we iedereen aan om te solliciteren als ze voldoen aan de minimumvereisten voor de functie. Ons doel? Al onze medewerkers een respectvolle werkomgeving bieden. En dat al meteen bij het aanwervingsproces.







Geïnteresseerd in deze veelzijdige vacature?



Solliciteer nu en maak deel uit van ons toegewijde team bij Veolia BeLux!



As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Department

The Corporate Planning division, located in Brussels, consists of several departments: The corporate planning department in charge of Group Controlling & Daikin Europe controlling, the Business Analytics department, and the Internal controls & J-Sox department.

The division is responsible for drilling down the strategy into annual budgets and realizing the group targets. This is done in cooperation with all sales and manufacturing entities, as well as with other departments in Daikin Europe. As a backbone for group-wide reporting, the department takes care of the management of the sales-, margin-, and pricing data, as well as collecting and reporting market intelligence. Our mission is to safeguard and manage profitability, via periodic reporting to top-management, close follow-up and by proposing countermeasure actions.

Furthermore, the division is responsible for the development and implementation of corporate governance and internal controls in the group (e.g. J-SOx and system access).

The vacancy is in the Business Analytics Department.

Function

The department is playing a leading role in the roll-out of actionable dashboards in sales, service and supply related departments and affiliates. You will write functional and business requirements to create the data models and develop PBI reports for these roll outs.
You are in close cooperation with business to understand their needs and requirements. You are able to look at these needs and requirements in the perspective of business and in the perspective of functional requirements.
You will be member of different project teams, who are involved in SAP/Azure projects at Headquarter and affiliates.
Together with our IT department you search what tools, functionalities and data the business needs to analyse and steer the business. At Daikin we aim to continuously improve and be at the forefront of new developments.
You'll be the driver behind the move towards more data driven business in EMEA.
You will promote the development of innovative new data and reporting platforms in collaboration with business and IT across all departments and Daikin Affiliates.




Your profile

You have a master degree in Business Economics, Finance, Accounting, Math or Data Science
You already have extended experience in a similar role as data analyst or business analyst, preferably in a complex and big organisation.
You have a strong understanding of ETL processes and can guide the IT department in structuring tables, relationships, and dimension mappings correctly. Basic knowledge of data warehousing (SAP BW, Microsoft Azure, Databricks) is a plus.
You are proficient in DAX, following best practices and handling complex statements such as calculation groups and parameter tables. Experience with Tabular Editor for centralized DAX management is preferred.
You develop Power BI dashboards and reports, transforming user input into proactive data visualizations that facilitate decision-making. You have experience optimizing report performance using tools like DAX Studio, Report Analyzer, DAX Optimizer, and ALM Toolkit (a plus).
You have a basic understanding of source systems such as SAP PR2 (S/4HANA), CRM, and CEC.
You have experience in building sales-related reports, including sales analysis, pipeline tracking, gross margin variation, SG&A tracking, and P&L analysis.
You are proactive and think outside the box to drive innovative solutions.
You have the ability to understand & challenge the needs of customers and to formalize the derived requirements
Outstanding collaboration, listening, written and verbal communication skills
You are result-driven with a strong focus on improvements




What we offer




At Daikin, you can count on a varied job with an international market leader that stimulates its people to grow and to work together. We offer you an open ended contract. You will be given extensive training and will be well supported from the start. The position carries a competitive salary and a package of extra-legal benefits. This function offers an excellent stepping stone to take on more responsibilities in a planning-oriented function or a detachment abroad at one of our EMEA affiliates.




Daikin Europe N.V.

Daikin Europe N.V. is the EMEA headquarters of the Japanese company, Daikin Industries Ltd. We design, manufacture and distribute air conditioning and heating systems for commercial, residential and industrial applications. Our headquarters are located in Brussels and Ostend, but through our sales networks we also have a presence throughout Europe, Africa and the Middle East.

We are the market leader in the field of air conditioning and also offer Total Comfort Solutions in the fields of cooling, heating, ventilation and related techniques.

In addition, as a company we are constantly expanding, with extensive international contacts, a pleasant, stimulating working environment, extensive training and coaching, ... Daikin Europe N.V. has many trump cards. However, our highly motivated employees are our greatest asset. That is why we are always looking for new talent.

Title: Impact Analyzer
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Senior Consultant in Data science
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



As a Senior consultant in Data Science, you will be involved in transformation projects at our clients. You will execute project assignments in modelling and digital transformation (business/IT analysis and partial coding) environments with a good deal of business perspectives:



Machine learning, AI and statistics: developing predictive models of decision making (supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, econometrics, forecasting, quantitative diagnosis,...)
Operational research : assistance in the design and implementation of constraint optimization solutions and simulation models
Big Data : Algorithmic knowledge for large and unstructured data processing

You will get the opportunity to actively contribute to Sia’s internal activities:



Development and reinforcement of our offer, by understanding and interpreting data science innovation and challenges
Business development, by contributing to need definition and participating in our commercial initiatives

As fast as possible, you will take up team leadership roles and connect with colleagues of all levels.



Equipped with the entrepreneurial fibre, you are ready to cooperate in a fast growing company.







In return, you can expect:



An international company that gives importance to diversity, inclusion, employee well-being and corporate social responsibilities actions.
A great working atmosphere with friendly and professional colleagues where innovation and entrepreneurship are encouraged
A personal development plan with a regular follow-up as well training opportunities to develop yourself
A competitive salary with great advantages, like mobility budget, hospital insurance, performance -related bonus,...


Qualifications


University Master Civil Engineer (applied mathematics, IT or similar)
2 to 6 years’ experience as a consultant
Outstanding team player with great interpersonal and communication skills
Strong interest in data science and related sectors such as Energy and Finance
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
Trilingual: French, Dutch and English
Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Show more
HTML:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.



Job Description

As a Senior consultant in Data Science, you will be involved in transformation projects at our clients. You will execute project assignments in modelling and digital transformation (business/IT analysis and partial coding) environments with a good deal of business perspectives:

  • Machine learning, AI and statistics: developing predictive models of decision making (supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, econometrics, forecasting, quantitative diagnosis,...)
  • Operational research : assistance in the design and implementation of constraint optimization solutions and simulation models
  • Big Data : Algorithmic knowledge for large and unstructured data processing

You will get the opportunity to actively contribute to Sia’s internal activities:

  • Development and reinforcement of our offer, by understanding and interpreting data science innovation and challenges
  • Business development, by contributing to need definition and participating in our commercial initiatives

As fast as possible, you will take up team leadership roles and connect with colleagues of all levels.

Equipped with the entrepreneurial fibre, you are ready to cooperate in a fast growing company.



In return, you can expect:

  • An international company that gives importance to diversity, inclusion, employee well-being and corporate social responsibilities actions.
  • A great working atmosphere with friendly and professional colleagues where innovation and entrepreneurship are encouraged
  • A personal development plan with a regular follow-up as well training opportunities to develop yourself
  • A competitive salary with great advantages, like mobility budget, hospital insurance, performance -related bonus,...

Qualifications

  • University Master Civil Engineer (applied mathematics, IT or similar)
  • 2 to 6 years’ experience as a consultant
  • Outstanding team player with great interpersonal and communication skills
  • Strong interest in data science and related sectors such as Energy and Finance
  • Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
  • Dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
  • Trilingual: French, Dutch and English
  • Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad

Additional Information

We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
About Us

We’re the world’s leading provider of secure financial messaging services, headquartered in Belgium. We are the way the world moves value – across borders, through cities and overseas. No other organisation can address the scale, precision, pace and trust that this demands, and we’re proud to support the global economy.

We’re unique too. We were established to find a better way for the global financial community to move value – a reliable, safe and secure approach that the community can trust, completely. We’re always striving to be better and are constantly evolving in an ever-changing landscape, without undermining that trust. Five decades on, our vibrant community reflects the complexity and diversity of the financial ecosystem. We innovate diligently, test exhaustively, then implement fast. In a connected and exciting era, our mission has never been more relevant. Swift now has a presence in 200+ countries and legal territories to serve a community of more than 12,000 banks and financial institutions.

We’re the world’s leading provider of secure financial messaging services, headquartered in Belgium. We are the way the world moves value – across borders, through cities and overseas. No other organisation can address the scale, precision, pace and trust that this demands, and we’re proud to support the global economy.

We’re unique too. We were established to find a better way for the global financial community to move value – a reliable, safe and secure approach that the community can trust, completely. We’re always striving to be better and are constantly evolving in an ever-changing landscape, without undermining that trust. Five decades on, our vibrant community reflects the complexity and diversity of the financial ecosystem. We innovate diligently, test exhaustively, then implement fast. In a connected and exciting era, our mission has never been more relevant. Swift now has a presence in 200+ countries and legal territories to serve a community of more than 12,000 banks and financial institutions.

Are you looking for a role where your expertise can set the stage for world-class data solutions? Do you thrive in a team that is driven, collaborative, and innovative?

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant to join our Professional Services team in Europe. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering consultancy assignments around Swift’s Business Intelligence Product Portfolio. You will support clients through onboarding, training and providing ongoing data insights to meet customer needs. Additionally, you will assist in identifying and developing new business intelligence services to help our customers get the most value from their data.

As a Business Intelligence Consultant, you will work closely with clients and internal teams to deliver customized BI solutions that drive business growth and decision making.

Join a team of ambitious data professionals at Swift as a Business Intelligence Consultant. Help redefine excellence by delivering flawless data solutions to global clients. We value collaboration, inclusivity, and top-tier performance.

What To Expect

In this role you will:


Lead client onboarding sessions, ensuring smooth adoption of Swift’s Business Intelligence Products
Deploy BI products requiring onsite installation at clients' premises, including international travel
Provide hands-on training to help clients effectively use BI tools and dashboards
Address client queries and provide mentorship on standard processes to improve the value of their data.
Troubleshoot any issues with the BI tools and offer proactive solutions to improve performance
Work with clients to understand their data needs and deliver insights and reports using Swift’s BI tools
Support client projects by gathering requirements and implementing BI solutions that align with their business goals
Collaborate with internal teams to find opportunities for new BI data services based on client feedback and market trends.
Assist in the development of new BI offerings that address emerging client needs and industry changes



What will make you successful?

We are seeking professionals with:


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Engineering, or a related field
2-5 years of experience in Business Intelligence (BI), Data Analysis
Outstanding analytical skills combined with a strong attention to detail
Strong communication skills to liaise effectively with clients and internal teams
Proficiency in BI tools and data visualization software
Ability to troubleshoot and provide proactive solutions
Ambitious approach with a drive to compete and succeed



Preferred qualifications:


Experience working in a global or international context
Experience in Consultancies
Familiarity with advanced data analysis techniques and tools
Ability to successfully implement complex BI solutions
Certifications in relevant BI or data science fields
Proven experience in delivering training or providing client support
Experience in developing and improving BI services



What We Offer

We put you in control of career

We give you a competitive package

We help you perform at your best

We help you make a difference

We give you the freedom to be yourself

We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals – like you – with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. A diverse and inclusive environment in which everyone’s voice counts and where you can reach your full potential.

If you believe you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact us to request accommodation.

Don’t meet every single requirement? At Swift, we are dedicated to building a workplace where people can bring their full selves and ideas to the team, so if you are excited about this role, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet every single qualification.

If you believe you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact us to request accommodation.

Don’t meet every single requirement? At Swift, we are dedicated to building a workplace where people can bring their full selves and ideas to the team, so if you are excited about this role, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet every single qualification.

Title: Consultant BI (H/F)
Description:
Rejoindre Davidson, ce n’est pas seulement intégrer un groupe de 3000 consultants dans 6 pays et 2 continents, c’est intégrer LA société qui a été élue par ses salariés Great Place To Work France et Europe pendant 4 ans mais aussi une des plus grandes B Corp de France, nommée Best of the World dans la catégorie “collaborateurs” en 2022 ! (Les “B Corp” formant une communauté de sociétés qui ont décidé d’être non pas les meilleures du monde mais les meilleures POUR le monde).

Parce que notre développement repose sur des principes forts :


Un profond respect de l’ensemble de nos parties prenantes : consultant(e)s, clients et fournisseurs. Car si le travail “ne fait pas le bonheur”, il peut cependant “faire le malheur”. Nous nous engageons donc à écouter et agir avec honnêteté.
Une égalité des chances dans le traitement de nos candidatures et dans la gestion de carrière de nos salarié(e)s. Nous croyons en un milieu de travail où équité F/H, inclusion et diversité sont la norme.
Une empreinte environnementale minimale, et sociétale maximale. C’est pourquoi, au-delà des missions que vous réaliserez, vous pourrez également contribuer à des projets que Davidson soutient : missions de solidarité internationale (avec Planète Urgence), bénévolat auprès d’associations (chaque Davidsonien(ne) dispose de 3 jours par an pour intervenir à leurs côtés), accompagnement d’étudiant(e)s issus de milieux peu favorisés (avec Article 1), investissement dans des startups développant des solutions innovantes, actions collectives et individuelles pour la réduction de notre impact carbone…
Un Management adhocratique basé sur la mise en œuvre des principes de “l’entreprise horizontale” et du “management tribal”. Sur ce dernier point une précision d’importance : le bien-être au travail est un luxe qu’il faut pouvoir s’offrir en étant une entreprise “solide”. Ceci induit pour les Davidsonien(ne)s d’allier prises d’initiative, engagement et professionnalisme. Car “sans travail, le talent n’est qu’une sale manie”. Et cela nous incite à chercher à recruter des personnes… meilleures que nous…


Nous encourageons les candidatures de personnes en situation de handicap, et nous nous engageons à répondre au mieux à leurs besoins spécifiques.

Profil / Mission

Tu interviendras au sein du pôle Big Data & Data Science de Davidson. Cette équipe a pour but de construire des architectures permettant de collecter et faire parler les données ! Ceci dans des secteurs et clients très divers : de la startup de l’IoT au grand groupe audiovisuel…

Tes Activités Seront Les Suivantes


Mener les analyses fonctionnelles destinées à traduire les besoins du client
Aider les équipes projet dans la conception de modèles de données
Identifier les pistes de création de valeur, au-delà des attentes du client
Concevoir les solutions (Data Integration, ETL, Datawarehouses), les indicateurs et les tableaux de bord
Organiser et préparer les travaux de recette utilisateurs
Mettre en place les processus d’industrialisation


Compétences requises ou à acquérir


De formation BAC + 5, tu as déjà une première expérience réussie dans le domaine de la BI
Tu sais que SQL ne s’écrit pas escuelle
Tu maîtrises parfaitement un ETL (SSIS, Talend, Datastage, Informatica) et un outil de restitution (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik …) ou à défaut un outil de reporting (BO, Cognos, Microstrategy)
Et soyons fous : tu as des connaissances en archi Big Data


Aptitudes / Savoir-être


Excellent relationnel
Capacité d’analyse
Curiosité
Rigueur
Anglais
Show more

  • Un Management adhocratique basé sur la mise en œuvre des principes de “l’entreprise horizontale” et du “management tribal”.   • Concevoir les solutions (Data Integration, ETL, Datawarehouses), les indicateurs et les tableaux de bord
  • Organiser et préparer les travaux de recette utilisateurs
  • Mettre en place les processus d’industrialisation

Compétences requises ou à acquérir

  • De formation BAC + 5, tu as déjà une première expérience réussie dans le domaine de la BI
  • Tu sais que SQL ne s’écrit pas escuelle
  • Tu maîtrises parfaitement un ETL (SSIS, Talend, Datastage, Informatica) et un outil de restitution (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik …) ou à défaut un outil de reporting (BO, Cognos, Microstrategy)
  • Et soyons fous : tu as des connaissances en archi Big Data

Aptitudes / Savoir-être

  • Excellent relationnel
  • Capacité d’analyse
  • Curiosité
  • Rigueur
  • Anglais

Title: Onderzoeker en data-analist
Description:
Werken bij CM, is werken met goesting. Want bij CM heb je een positieve impact op het leven van miljoenen Belgen. Dat ervaren onze duizenden medewerkers elke dag. Samen dragen we bij aan een gezondere samenleving voor iedereen. Dat geeft voldoening en energie.

Ook voor jou is CM een fijne en zorgzame werkomgeving, waar je ideeën uitwisselt en jezelf ontwikkelt. Waar je kan rekenen op je collega’s en je verbonden bent met elkaar. Plezier hebben in wat je doet, daar doen we het voor!

Bij CM telt elke dag. Voor de mensen, de samenleving en voor jezelf.




De studiedienst volgt de evolutie van de gezondheidstoestand van de bevolking op en analyseert het socialezekerheidsstelsel. Binnen CM draagt ze bij aan de ontwikkeling van een langetermijnvisie op het gebied van gezondheid en (maatschappelijk) welzijn. De Studiedienst is verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren van de evoluties in de gezondheidszorg door middel van verkennende studies en ad-hoc analyses.




Dit zoeken we




Jouw opdrachten als onderzoeker en data-analist :

• Je volgt thema’s op gerelateerd aan de economische aspecten van de gezondheidszorg en kan de vragen van de organisatie hierover beantwoorden.

• Je bent in staat om gegevensextracties te doen en kwantitatief onderzoek uit te voeren op basis van deze gegevens.

• Je voert budgettaire en economische gezondheidsgerelateerde analyses uit.

• Je draagt bij aan de kennisopbouw van CM op het gebied van gezondheid.

• Je werkt mee aan de onderzoeksprojecten van CM, in functie van de noden.

• Je analyseert je onderzoeksresultaten kritisch en synthetiseert ze in een wetenschappelijk rapport. Je formuleert ook concrete aanbevelingen voor de directie.

• Je deelt de resultaten van de studies op overtuigende wijze mee aan de verschillende doelgroepen (beleidsmakers, zorgverleners, burgers, enz.).

• Je werkt je kennis en vaardigheden bij en werkt mee aan de ontwikkeling van de onderzoeksprocessen van CM.




Dit ben jij




• Je hebt minimum een masterdiploma. Ervaring op het gebied van economie, volksgezondheid, gezondheidsbeleid, sociologie of statistiek is een troef.

• Je beschikt over relevante werkervaring inzake kwantitatief onderzoek.

• Je beschikt over relevante werkervaring inzake economische of budgettaire analyses, bij voorkeur in het domein van gezondheid.

• Een kennis van de wetgeving op het vlak van gegevensbeheer is een troef.

• Je bent in staat om gegevens te analyseren: kennis van SAS of python is een troef.

• Je bent bereid om je kennis over de invaliditeits- en ziektekostenverzekering en over de verschillende aspecten van het gezondheidsbeleid te verdiepen.

• Je bent een dynamische collega die ideeën aanbrengt en zich inzet voor de projecten van de dienst. Je hecht veel belang aan de resultaten van teamwerk.

• Je bent ervan overtuigd dat solidariteit en universele toegang tot zorg belangrijke waarden zijn van het gezondheidsstelsel van ons land.

• Je bent in staat om zelfstandig te werken en initiatief te nemen.

• Je kan analytisch en kritisch denken.

• Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van het Nederlands of het Frans, en je hebt een goed begrip van de andere taal.

• Je hebt minimum een passieve kennis van het Engels.




Dit bieden we je




• Maatschappelijke impact: Bij CM werk je niet zomaar. Samen met je collega’s draag je rechtstreeks of onrechtstreeks je steentje bij aan de gezondheid van velen. Je werk heeft echt betekenis.

• Opleidingen en Groeimogelijkheden: Bij CM sta je zelf aan het stuur van je loopbaan. Je krijgt kansen om te groeien in je functie en in de organisatie. Er zijn veel opleidingen om je kennis en vaardigheden te vergroten.

• Aantrekkelijk loonpakket: Je krijgt een vast contract en een mooi pakket aan voordelen. We bieden een bruto maandloon afhankelijk van jouw relevante ervaring. Maar er is meer: maaltijdcheques (8 euro), 13e maand, een extra premie in juli, netto-onkostenvergoeding, fietsvergoeding, aanvullende kinderbijslag, groepsverzekering, hospitalisatieverzekering, verzekering gewaarborgd inkomen, fietslease, …

• Flexibel werken: Je werkt voltijds in een 38 urenweek met flexibele werkuren en je kan een vrij dagdeel opnemen. Je krijgt 20 verlofdagen, 4 extra feestdagen, 12 ADV-dagen en extra verlof naarmate je langer bij ons werkt. Je standplaats is Schaarbeek. Daarnaast is er ruimte voor thuiswerk.

Show more
HTML:
Werken bij CM, is werken met goesting. Want bij CM heb je een positieve impact op het leven van miljoenen Belgen. Dat ervaren onze duizenden medewerkers elke dag. Samen dragen we bij aan een gezondere samenleving voor iedereen. Dat geeft voldoening en energie.

• Je bent bereid om je kennis over de invaliditeits- en ziektekostenverzekering en over de verschillende aspecten van het gezondheidsbeleid te verdiepen.

• Je bent een dynamische collega die ideeën aanbrengt en zich inzet voor de projecten van de dienst. Je hecht veel belang aan de resultaten van teamwerk.

• Je bent ervan overtuigd dat solidariteit en universele toegang tot zorg belangrijke waarden zijn van het gezondheidsstelsel van ons land.

• Je bent in staat om zelfstandig te werken en initiatief te nemen.

• Je kan analytisch en kritisch denken.

• Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van het Nederlands of het Frans, en je hebt een goed begrip van de andere taal.

• Je hebt minimum een passieve kennis van het Engels.


Dit bieden we je


• Maatschappelijke impact: Bij CM werk je niet zomaar. Samen met je collega’s draag je rechtstreeks of onrechtstreeks je steentje bij aan de gezondheid van velen. Je werk heeft echt betekenis.

• Opleidingen en Groeimogelijkheden: Bij CM sta je zelf aan het stuur van je loopbaan. Je krijgt kansen om te groeien in je functie en in de organisatie. Er zijn veel opleidingen om je kennis en vaardigheden te vergroten.

• Aantrekkelijk loonpakket: Je krijgt een vast contract en een mooi pakket aan voordelen. We bieden een bruto maandloon afhankelijk van jouw relevante ervaring. Maar er is meer: maaltijdcheques (8 euro), 13e maand, een extra premie in juli, netto-onkostenvergoeding, fietsvergoeding, aanvullende kinderbijslag, groepsverzekering, hospitalisatieverzekering, verzekering gewaarborgd inkomen, fietslease, …

• Flexibel werken: Je werkt voltijds in een 38 urenweek met flexibele werkuren en je kan een vrij dagdeel opnemen. Je krijgt 20 verlofdagen, 4 extra feestdagen, 12 ADV-dagen en extra verlof naarmate je langer bij ons werkt. Je standplaats is Schaarbeek. Daarnaast is er ruimte voor thuiswerk.

Title: Solver - Generative AI Specialist
Description:
About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation, providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services tailored to empower its partners and address their unique challenges. We tackle complex challenges with a holistic approach, fostering collaboration across diverse expertise areas, including Data Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Governance.




Our "Solvers" are passionate professionals empowered by cutting-edge tools, a culture of knowledge sharing, and continuous learning opportunities. We are seeking a Generative AI Specialist to join our team of experts, helping our clients leverage the power of advanced AI technologies to transform their operations.




Your Role:

As a Generative AI Specialist, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and clients to design, develop, and deploy innovative AI solutions, with a particular focus on generative models and their applications.




What We’re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications (Mandatory)

Educational Background: Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or related fields.
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience including at least 2 in the aforementioned specialty
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Technical Expertise: Proven experience with generative AI frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, Hugging Face, or similar.
Programming Proficiency: Advanced skills in Python and familiarity with AI libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for deploying AI models.
Communication Skills: Strong ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Preferred Skills

Experience in fine-tuning and customizing large language models (LLMs).
Familiarity with agent-based systems for task automation.
Knowledge of MLOps tools and best practices for AI model deployment and monitoring.
Strong business acumen to align AI solutions with strategic goals.




What You’ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Collaboration: Engage with clients to identify business needs, explore AI opportunities, and deliver tailored solutions leveraging generative AI.
Use Case Development: Analyze client challenges to propose and implement generative AI applications such as text generation, image synthesis, content creation, or workflow automation.




Technical Implementation

Model Development: Design, build, and fine-tune generative AI models using frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, and Hugging Face.
Agent Design: Create agent-based architectures for real-time decision-making and task automation.
Integration: Connect generative AI systems with external tools, APIs, and enterprise systems to optimize workflow and performance.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on the latest advancements in generative AI and contribute to internal R&D initiatives.
Experiment with emerging models, techniques, and tools to ensure cutting-edge solutions for clients.




Project Management

Plan, execute, and oversee the delivery of AI projects, ensuring timely and high-quality outcomes.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure smooth project integration.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions for clients to empower their teams with generative AI capabilities.
Provide ongoing support for deployed solutions to ensure scalability and optimization.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse and innovative AI projects across industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Benefit from the latest GenAI tools as well as an annual budget for certifications, training, and conferences to stay ahead in your field.
Collaborative Environment: Join a team that values collective intelligence and a supportive culture.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model that offers remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Package: Attractive salary, performance bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Permanent position only




What is Cream all about?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company specialized in IT development and Business improvement. We are active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




Cream’s special recipe:

- 1/3 of Personal development

- 1/3 of Collective Intelligence

- 1/3 of Intrapreneurship




And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




What is a Data Engineer at Cream?

As a Data Engineer at Cream, you can be in charge of the implementation of BI Business Projects or potentially coaching junior data engineers. As well, be responsible for the development of data ingestion and analytics solutions (data warehouses, data marts, etc.)




Your tasks :

Architecting Data Systems: Designing robust and scalable data models to meet business needs.
ETL Development: Creating or improving efficient Extract, Transform, Load processes to integrate and process data.
Performance Optimization: Monitoring and fine-tuning data pipelines and databases foR optimal speed and efficiency.
Data Security Implementation: Establishing data security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure compliance.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Working closely with data scientists, analysts, and other teams to understand data requirements and provide technical solutions.




How do we imagine our future consultant?

You have at least 2 years experience in data engineering
You have a Master’s degree, preferably in IT (Computer or industrial engineering) or in Business Administration or equivalent by experience (more than 5 years).
You are used to working with different data tools such as SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, AWS, Azure data factory, Apache Spark, SQL, Python, Tableau
You have a good database knowledge (SQL and NoSQL)
You are fluent in French or Dutch and have full professional capacity in English
You know what it means to work in an Agile mode
You are passionate about data, pay attention to details and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business




Why should you taste the lime flavor?

· A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box

· You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues

· You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology

· You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company

· We have values we share, live with, experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE, CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Stagiaire Data Analyst
HTML:
As we are revamping our BI solutions, we need someone to help us catalog existing dashboards/reports and continuously improve them. The Data Analyst Intern will assist the Business Intelligence team in creating data visualizations and interactive reports for Chanel in the Swiss Markets. This role offers a chance to learn, grow, and contribute to meaningful projects in a dynamic work environment.


  • Conduct an assessment of existing BI solutions, rationalize or harmonize them if necessary.
  • Collaborate with business teams to understand visualization requirements and needs.
  • Assist in the design and the development of Power BI dashboards and reports.
  • Participate in the maintenance and improvement of existing BI solutions.
  • Contribute to the resolution of issues relative to data quality and data consistency across the different sources and global/regional BI solutions
  • Contribute to special projects and continuous improvement initiatives.


Job Profile


  • Student in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field;
  • Basic knowledge of BI tools, particularly Power BI;
  • Knowledge of SQL language is a plus;
  • Strong interest in the field of Business Intelligence and data analysis;
  • Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively;
  • Proactive and eager to learn and contribute to the team;
  • Proficiency in English and French.


From July 2025;

Based in Geneva

Duration: 6 months

Title: Data and Reporting Analyst
HTML:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

“Rethink Everything” is our philosophy – it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.



Data and Reporting Analyst


We report on the evolution of LOIM’s Financials (Assets under Management, Revenues and Costs) to various internal and external stakeholders. We manage LOIM’s revenue processes and implement LOIM’s transfer pricing policies. We provide Financial Planning and Analysis to LOIM’s business lines and to the Lombard Odier Group.


YOUR ROLE

  • Develop, maintain and run workflows that prepare data and ensure data quality for facts and dimensions feeding our dashboards and reports;
  • Collaborate with our internal data providers (IT, Operations, Business Dev) in projects, production and troubleshooting;
  • Produce, maintain and upgrade dashboards, reports and ad-hoc analysis intended for Senior Management, Investment teams, Business Development;
  • Participate to the preparation of Revenue forecasts;
  • Drive various projects, e.g. improvement of existing data management processes, design dashboards that address new business requirements, integrate new data sources;


YOUR PROFILE

  • 3-5 years of experience in a similar role;
  • Experience working with large datasets and building reports for various stakeholders
  • Strong technical skills, including experience with Alteryx and Tableau, Microsoft office (Excel/Access, VBA), Cognos ReportNet a plus;
  • Genuine interest for the financial industry and investment products;
  • Technically minded and detail oriented with strong conceptual and problem solving skills;
  • Organized, ability to progress on multiple concurrent tasks with autonomy;
  • Team player with good communication skills;
  • Very good written and spoken English and French;
  • Residence in Switzerland.



Our Maison’s DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.


As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison’s DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.


It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our team members are at the heart of everything we do. At AmerisourceBergen Global Manufacturer Services, we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures, and every person here is essential to us being able to deliver on that purpose. If you want to make a difference at the center of health, come join our innovative company and help us improve the lives of people and animals everywhere. Apply today!




Position Summary

Under general direction of the Director - Application Services, this role executes supervised all necessary configuration activities to ensure that global pharmaceutical manufacturers receive the services according to their signed MSA. The role also monitors the daily data transmission compliance with service level agreement (SLA) in place with manufacturers and Company vendors. Finally, the role works with other members of the team to implement, configure, and maintain the information systems (e.g. databases) used to keep track of operating records and to extract reports.




Duties and Responsibilities

Configure Cencora ERP system (SAP) to ensure manufacturers receive the agreed upon services.
Supervised coordinate the EDI setup with Cencora IT and EDI teams of manufacturers and/or their external 3rd Party Logistics.
Monitor EDI transmission to manufacturers and/or their external 3rd Party Logistics partners.
Configure the Company web portal to provide access to manufacturer users.
Maintain manufacturer profiles for EDI connectivity and active web portal modules.
Monitor the data transmission to the Company web portal database.
Monitor the Company web portal and the EDI Support mailboxes; supervised, coordinates activities with all the necessary stakeholders within the Data Service Team to support manufacturer inquiries.
Support the execution of periodical validation of manufacturer users entitled to access the Company web portal.
Support the ad-hoc analysis of data alignment between SAP and the Company web portal or the transmitted EDI transactions; maintain an exception log with explanation of discrepancies.
Perform related duties as assigned.




Experience, Educational and Permit Requirements

Broad training in fields such as business administration, engineering, computer science, or similar vocations, generally obtained through completion of a four-year bachelor’s degree program or equivalent combination of experience and education.
Experience in customer support and issue resolution.
Demonstrated experience executing as a technical and data analyst.
Experience with pharmaceutical product data is a plus, but not required.
One to two (1-2) years directly related and progressively responsible experience.
Only applicants that are currently authorized to work in Switzerland or can independently secure a work permit for Switzerland will be considered.




Minimum skills, knowledge and ability requirements

Excellent verbal and written communication skills across internal and external partners and manufacturer customers with English being the primary language of communication.
Data solutions development experience.
Strong mathematical and analytical skills.
Ability to implement processes resulting in satisfactory audit practices.
Experience in data analysis and visualization methods.
Strong computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite in order to operate effectively with Company systems and programs; proficiency in Excel and Access.
Knowledge of VBA scripting.
Outstanding organizational and problem-solving aptitude; attention to detail.
Tact, diplomacy, and courtesy; strong interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in SQL and analysis tools.




What we offer

We provide attractive compensation, benefits, and resources that enable a highly inclusive culture and support our team members’ ability to live with purpose every day. We provide several benefits beyond traditional offerings, including monthly healthcare and transportation allowances and an annual bonus plan. To encourage your personal growth, we also offer a variety of training programs, professional development resources, and opportunities to participate in mentorship programs, employee resource groups, volunteer activities, and much more.

Title: Data Analyst/ML Engineer Intern
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Your internship

Join one of the teams building brand new systems with GenAI tools at its core. Drive the strategy for data intelligence by finding insights and grounding product decisions in the real world data. Solve real world problems with agentic AI systems, run large scale evaluations using LLMs and pave the way for the future of Digital Employee Experience. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work at the forefront of AI innovation, equipping you with the skills to make a real-world impact.

What You Will Do


Innovate with Latest Technologies: Conduct research, data analysis and LLM experiments leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies, commercial and open source.
Collaborate with Experts: Work closely with AI/ML researchers and software engineers using data insights to help developing and optimizing the state-of-the-art AI applications.
Contribute to Development: Actively participate in evaluation, integration, and deployment of your solution in the nexthink platform.
Communicate Your Insights: Present your findings and recommendations to the team and key stakeholders.


Qualifications


MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, ML or a relevant field
You love working with data and finding patterns and insights.
You are creative and happy to offer new ideas and solutions.
You have a good understanding of LLM technologies, Python data science libraries, SQL.
You are not afraid of software engineering tools: git, docker, AWS.
You have a drive for analytical problems and you like solving challenges, have a good team spirit and are happy to collaborate with the team.
You should also have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Professional level of written and spoken English skills are a must.


Additional Information

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

📍 Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities


Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.




Skills and Abilities


Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.


Qualifications


Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Senior ERP Data Analyst

Location: Geneva, Switzerland (Hybrid)




Job Description

Experience Level:

7+ years of experience in ERP data analysis, with hands-on exposure to end-to-end business processes across finance (Record-to-Report), procurement (Procure-to-Pay), and sales (Order-to-Cash)​
Demonstrated history of analyzing and optimizing data in these functional areas is expected.




Preferred Industry Background:

Experience working in large enterprises or industries with complex worldwide financial operations (e.g. manufacturing, retail, or consumer goods) is preferred.
Candidates should be familiar with multi-department ERP environments and high transaction volumes, as this role spans P2P, O2C, and R2R processes.




Certifications:

ERP certification(s) preferred




Technical Skills:

Strong expertise in enterprise ERP systems (SAP ECC experience is strongly preferred)​.
Deep knowledge of key ERP modules in Finance, Procurement, and Sales and how data flows through these processes.
Proficiency in SAP data analytics and querying tools: SAP Query, SAP ABAP Query, SAP Data Browser.
Ability to generate reports and perform data validation across P2P, O2C, and R2R data.
Skilled in process mapping and analysis – capable of documenting end-to-end process flows (e.g. mapping how purchase orders to payments, or orders to cash receipts flow through the system) and identifying data dependencies/improvement opportunities.
Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools (such as SAP BW, Power BI) for building dashboards and visualizing ERP data insights.​




Soft Skills:

Strong interpersonal communication skills in English; other languages are an advantage.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills – able to collaborate with finance, procurement, IT, and sales stakeholders and translate data findings into business insights​
A problem-solving, analytical mindset is critical for investigating data issues and identifying root causes or trends​
The candidate should be detail-oriented yet able to see the big picture, and adept at troubleshooting process/data problems. Additionally, strong organizational skills and the ability to work under deadlines in cross-functional teams (often acting as a bridge between technical teams and business users) are important​













About Us

We are a Brazilian company with over 35 years of experience in delivering IT services worldwide, ranging from IT outsourcing to application development or IT staffing. We have a direct presence in 41 countries, through our 70 offices located throughout the world. We have managed to become the preferred partner of many small-to-midsize local and regional companies as well. Most of our clients come from industries such as financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical, services, technology, public sector and utilities.

Stefanini has career opportunities locally and around the world for professionals interested in a vibrant, passionate, team-oriented workplace. If you are a customer-centric person with a "get it done" attitude, come over for coffee and a talk on your future career with us! Learn more about us on www.stefanini.com and join us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram where we regularly post insights from our colleagues.

Title: Data Analyst, Worldwide Operations
Description:
Description

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and exceptional written and oral communication skills. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of different business models and the underlying analytics, and the ability to assimilate new methodologies and data sources. They will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, be vocally self-critical, and with an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. They recognize that the true measure of the work product is the business impact it has.

In this role, you will work closely with the operations teams to provide data and analytical support for Sort Center initiatives, root cause investigation of defects, and will provide support to insure compliance to operational-related SOX requirements. Moreover, analyze data to support Operational Excellence initiatives, dig deep into data to determine root cause of defects, build and maintain decision support tools, and present findings to business partners to drive improvements in Fulfillment Center-wide quality and productivity.

The complexity of research and skills for the position is well beyond basic data entry and research. It involves complex analysis and diving deep into key metrics based on requests, building and maintaining multiple databases, extensive knowledge of software applications to create tools, and understanding of multiple programming languages. The following provides some detail of the job duties and responsibilities.

Key job responsibilities


Development of data collection processes and data management systems
Maintenance of data integrity (0% error rate)
Designing of queries, compiling of data, and generation of reports in MS Access and Excel
Charting and graphing of data for reporting purposes
In depth research of defect trends
Data collection and entry as needed
Data mining and problem solving


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or equivalent
1+ years of data analysis and formula creation in Microsoft Excel experience
1+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role and conducting analysis and data mining using Excel
1+ years’ experience extracting and processing data using SQL.
Demonstrated experience pulling and analyzing data to aid in root cause identification and drive process improvement initiatives across the network


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with end-to-end project management


Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Servicios Comerciales Amazon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Job ID: A2818556

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Overview

We are currently looking for a “Data Analyst” to join a leading technology company based in the London area. As the Data Analyst, you will be responsible for leveraging SQL to manage and extract insights from complex datasets and using Power BI to create compelling visualizations that drive business decisions.

Key Duties And Responsibilities

Your duties as the Data Analyst will be varied; however, the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:


Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries to retrieve and manipulate data. Maintain, clean, and structure large datasets for analysis. Ensure data integrity, consistency, and security in databases.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Support decision-making by providing actionable recommendations based on data. Work closely with business teams to define key metrics and KPIs.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI. Translate complex data into clear, meaningful visual representations. Optimize dashboards for performance and usability.
Work with cross-functional teams (IT, marketing, finance, operations) to support data-driven initiatives. Communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Provide training and documentation on Power BI dashboards and data processes.


Role Requirements

To be successful in your application to this exciting role as the Data Analyst, we are looking to identify the following on your profile and past history:


Relevant degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics.
Proven industry experience in data analysis and data visualization.
A working knowledge and practical experience with SQL and Power BI.


Key Words

Data Analyst / SQL / Power BI / Data Visualization / Data Analysis / Data Management / Business Intelligence / Data Insights / Data Reporting / Stakeholder Engagement

Hyper Recruitment Solutions Ltd (HRS) is an Equal Opportunities employer. We welcome applications from anyone who meets the role requirements. HRS exclusively supports the Life Science sectors, combining recruitment expertise with scientific knowledge to help you advance your career.

Title: Logistics Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.
