Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech’s invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton’s services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here! Check our social media pages to learn more about us: Twitter, Reddit, Instagram.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented Marketing Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making in the Marketing department. You will be embedded within the marketing team and play a key role in understanding customer behaviour, guiding marketing initiatives, and analysing the performance of various campaigns, A/B tests, etc.. Your insights will directly influence strategies, helping the team optimise marketing efforts. You will be part of the Marketing team, but you will collaborate also with the Data team, which consists of data science and data engineering, to continuously enhance your data platform and reporting tools.

This role requires good knowledge of measurement techniques, combined with the ability to create actionable insights for Marketing & cross-functional teams. You will work closely with growth, performance marketing, data and product teams to drive better decision-making through data-driven strategies.

What You Will Do



Support marketing team members in making data-driven decisions by analysing and interpreting marketing data, especially A/B test results and incremental tests used to measure our campaign efforts.
Build and maintain dashboards in Metabase, providing marketing teams with clear and actionable insights to optimise campaigns and track performance.
Apply tools and techniques for marketing data analysis and visualisation to measure and improve marketing performance.
Represent and summarise marketing data and insights in clear, actionable reports.
Research new marketing use cases for existing data, and suggest new data sources to incorporate for better analysis.
Share insights, findings, and best practices for marketing analytics with analysts across other business units.
Help shape marketing strategies by providing data-backed recommendations to optimise campaigns and boost ROI.
Develop training programs and enablement sessions to improve data literacy within the marketing team.
Advocate for measurement solutions that align with Proton’s privacy-first mission, ensuring user trust and compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR. Develop training and enablement programs to increase data literacy



Job Requirements



Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (marketing, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with a focus on marketing metrics.
Experience in business intelligence, marketing KPIs & web analytics.
At least 5 years of relevant working experience in marketing data analysis.
Advanced knowledge of SQL for querying and analysing marketing data.
Proficient in data visualisation tools such as Metabase, Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with A/B testing and incremental testing methodologies, and experience with reporting and analysing test results.



Bonus points for:



Experience in high-growth, global technology companies
Familiarity with subscription-based and freemium business models.
Experience in a global, fast-paced, high-growth company environment.



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.


Show more
HTML:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech’s invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton’s services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here! Check our social media pages to learn more about us: Twitter, Reddit, Instagram.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented Marketing Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making in the Marketing department. You will be embedded within the marketing team and play a key role in understanding customer behaviour, guiding marketing initiatives, and analysing the performance of various campaigns, A/B tests, etc.. Your insights will directly influence strategies, helping the team optimise marketing efforts. You will be part of the Marketing team, but you will collaborate also with the Data team, which consists of data science and data engineering, to continuously enhance your data platform and reporting tools.

This role requires good knowledge of measurement techniques, combined with the ability to create actionable insights for Marketing & cross-functional teams. You will work closely with growth, performance marketing, data and product teams to drive better decision-making through data-driven strategies.

What You Will Do


  • Support marketing team members in making data-driven decisions by analysing and interpreting marketing data, especially A/B test results and incremental tests used to measure our campaign efforts.
  • Build and maintain dashboards in Metabase, providing marketing teams with clear and actionable insights to optimise campaigns and track performance.
  • Apply tools and techniques for marketing data analysis and visualisation to measure and improve marketing performance.
  • Represent and summarise marketing data and insights in clear, actionable reports.
  • Research new marketing use cases for existing data, and suggest new data sources to incorporate for better analysis.
  • Share insights, findings, and best practices for marketing analytics with analysts across other business units.
  • Help shape marketing strategies by providing data-backed recommendations to optimise campaigns and boost ROI.
  • Develop training programs and enablement sessions to improve data literacy within the marketing team.
  • Advocate for measurement solutions that align with Proton’s privacy-first mission, ensuring user trust and compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR. Develop training and enablement programs to increase data literacy


Job Requirements


  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (marketing, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, etc.).
  • Strong analytical skills with a focus on marketing metrics.
  • Experience in business intelligence, marketing KPIs & web analytics.
  • At least 5 years of relevant working experience in marketing data analysis.
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL for querying and analysing marketing data.
  • Proficient in data visualisation tools such as Metabase, Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar platforms.
  • Familiarity with A/B testing and incremental testing methodologies, and experience with reporting and analysing test results.


Bonus points for:


  • Experience in high-growth, global technology companies
  • Familiarity with subscription-based and freemium business models.
  • Experience in a global, fast-paced, high-growth company environment.


What We Offer


  • Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
  • Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
  • Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
  • Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
  • Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
  • Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
  • Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
  • Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
  • Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role

We are seeking a Data Analyst (Event Performance) to evaluate event ROI, marketing effectiveness, and attendee data, with a strong focus on blockchain events. This role requires a data-driven professional who can extract insights, optimize event strategies, and measure the impact of marketing efforts. The ideal candidate has extensive experience analyzing event performance and a deep understanding of blockchain industry trends.




Roles & Responsibilities:

Analyze event ROI, attendee behavior, and marketing performance metrics.
Develop data-driven insights to optimize future blockchain events.
Track and assess KPIs related to engagement, conversions, and sponsorship impact.
Collaborate with marketing and event teams to refine strategies based on analytics.
Present data findings through reports, dashboards, and visualizations.




Skills & Qualifications:

10+ years of experience in data analysis, event analytics, or related roles.
5+ years of experience analyzing blockchain event performance.
Proficiency in data analytics tools (Excel, SQL, Tableau, Google Analytics, etc.).
Strong understanding of event marketing metrics and audience segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving and data visualization skills.

Title: Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%
Description:
Du suchst eine spannende Herausforderung in einem dynamischen, europaweit führenden Unternehmen? Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenmodellen gesammelt und möchtest deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und dein technisches Verständnis gewinnbringend einsetzen? Effizienz und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sind für dich selbstverständlich und du möchtest deine Stärken in einem engagierten Team entfalten?

Dann bist du bei uns als




Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%




genau richtig! Als europaweit führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen im Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk sowie in der Industrie bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und die Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten.

Werde Teil eines traditionsreichen Familienunternehmens, das Innovation grossschreibt und Kundenorientierung lebt. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an wegweisenden Lösungen und schaffen nachhaltigen Mehrwert – für unsere Kunden, für dich und für die Zukunft.

Was dich erwartet

Regelmässiges Reporting und Ad hoc Analysen für Marketing & Vertrieb
Aufbereiten grosser Datenmengen
Selbstständige Weiterentwicklung der Reporting-Landschaft
Laufende Preis-, Konditions- und Provisionsspeicherungen in SAP inkl. Datenaufbereitung
Erstellen von Kunden- und Umsatzlisten sowie Verkaufshistorien
Pricing-Restrukturierung: Preiskalkulation & Konditionsmanagement
Abweichungsanalysen (Plan-Ist)
Auswertungen und Analyse von Sonderprojekten inkl. Aufbereitung der Daten




Was dich auszeichnet

Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder betriebswirtschaftliches Studium
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im (Marketing-/Vertriebs-) Controlling
Technisches und analytisches Verständnis
Umfangreiche IT-Kenntnisse (SAP, MS Office)
Offenheit und Kommunikationsfähigkeit zählen zu deinen Stärken
Du arbeitest gerne selbstständig und strukturiert, hast eine rasche Auffassungsgabe und verfügst über eine ausgeprägte analytische Denkweise
Eine gewissenhafte und exakte Arbeitsweise ist für dich selbstverständlich
Du kommunizierst auf Deutsch, Englisch und Französisch




Was wir bieten

Die Werte und Nachhaltigkeit eines Familienunternehmens. Gleichzeitig stellen wir uns heute für die Zukunft auf: Kundenzufriedenheit und Digitalisierung stehen dabei für uns stark im Vordergrund. Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Wandlungsprozesses und ebne mit deiner erfolgreichen Arbeit den Weg für deine und unsere Weiterentwicklung.




Wer wir sind

165 Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen schweizweit. Über 36.000 Artikel für das Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk. Professionelle Beratung und individueller Service mit über 50 Jahren Erfahrung. Kurzum: ein führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen. So viel zu den reinen Fakten. Aber hinter der Marke BERNER steckt etwas noch viel Wertvolleres: ein Familienunternehmen mit ebenso viel Herz wie Verstand.

Wir freuen uns auf deine detaillierte Bewerbung (Lebenslauf mit Foto, Zeugnisse und Arbeitszeugnisse) mit Lohnvorstellung, bevorzugt per E-Mail an: jobs.berner-ch@berner-ag.ch

Title: Quantitative Analyst (all)
Description:
Renewables Structuring & Pricing

50-100%

Ready to play a key role in developing and optimizing pricing models for renewable energy products? You will combine mathematical modeling, programming, and market analysis to deliver innovative solutions for complex business needs.
 
Quantitative Analyst (all)
 
Your responsibilities

Develop and improve pricing models for structured renewable energy products like PPAs
Implement and enhance quantitative models for risk analysis, forecasting, and portfolio optimization
Apply stochastic modeling, Monte Carlo simulations, and time-series forecasting to assess renewable energy portfolios
Automate and optimize pricing tools using Python and SQL
Conduct quantitative market analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and risks
Support structuring teams by providing financial modeling and quantitative insights for contract negotiations

 
Your skills

Master's degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Quantitative Finance, Economics, or a related field
Proficiency in Python for quantitative analysis, modeling, and automation
Strong knowledge of financial principles, statistical modeling, and risk management techniques
Experience with optimization techniques, machine learning, and financial modeling
Background in energy markets, renewable energy project development, or PPA structuring is a plus
Ability to translate complex business needs into technical solutions and provide strategic insights

 
Questions about the application process

Florian Witschi

Recruiting Partner

+41 58 477 55 59

Mark Commerford

Head of Structuring & Pricing

+41 58 477 58 32

We are not interested in enquiries from recruitment agencies.

Apply online at bkw.com/jobs

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

Job Function

Career Programs

Job Sub Function

Non-LDP Intern/Co-Op

Job Category

Career Program

All Job Posting Locations:

Schaffhausen, Switzerland

Job Description

Location: Schaffhausen

Contract: Fixed term (6 months)

Start date: May 2025

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

We are looking for a talented and driven Master’s Student or a recent Master’s graduate (within 12 months) to join our team for a Data Science project. In this role, you will develop and deploy a model to streamline Tech Transfers. You will collaborate closely with the Schaffhausen site and the Global Process Science Modeling & Data teams to deliver a solution to eliminate the need for time and resource consuming lab experiments.

Join us in crafting the future of pharmaceutical manufacturing!

Responsibilities


Clean and preprocess the available data
Develop and compare various Machine Learning models to select the best one
Work cross-functionally with internal teams to successfully deploy and test the selected model
Present findings and innovations at internal meetings


Qualifications


Enrolled in or recently graduated from a Master’s program in a STEM field (e.g. Chemical Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or other relevant field)
A strong background in data-driven modeling
Proficiency in scientific programming with Python
Outstanding ability to identify, analyze, and proactively and independently address potential challenges
Excellent communication and teamwork skills and ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams

Title: Data Science Internship / Working Student
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

For our Web- & eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.

As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as; data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

Example Assignments


Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
Recommendation/ranking algorithms for eCommerce platform
Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss


What We Offer


Dynamic and fun team
Multicultural environment
Working with senior tech leads
Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)


Qualifications

Basic understanding of:


at least one programming/scripting language
database technologies and a query language
data engineering and science basics


Soft Skills


Willingness to learn
Enjoyment of problem solving
English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage


Additional Information

For insights into what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to your direct online application.

Title: Data Engineering & Insights Analyst Intern
Description:
Algrano is a Swiss tech startup transforming the global coffee trade through transparency and digitalization. Our online marketplace connects coffee farmers directly with roasters in Europe and the USA, supported by logistics, insurance, and financing. Honored with the Best Innovation award by the European Coffee Industry Association in 2015 for our launch and again in 2022 for our achievements, we currently serve over 1,000 sellers and roasters in more than 50 countries.

We are building a scalable data warehouse to enhance analytics and reporting. As a Data Engineering & Insights Analyst Intern, you’ll help structure data, define business needs, and improve accessibility. You’ll also support BI tool selection, and report consolidation.

Tasks

As a Data Engineering & Insights Analyst Intern, you will work directly with the CTO, Christian, and collaborate with key stakeholders, including engineers Zmago and Vladi, as well as a cross-functional business team. You will play a crucial role in shaping Algrano’s data infrastructure, ensuring data is structured, accessible, and optimized for analytics.

‍

Your main responsibilities will include:

Defining business requirements: Engage with stakeholders to understand key reporting needs.
Data preparation and transformation: Use SQL views and Python scripts to extract and process data.
Structuring the data warehouse
BI tool selection and setup: Support the evaluation, configuration, and implementation of our analytics tool.
Report consolidation: Migrate and optimize existing reports into the selected analytics platform.

‍

You will own the analytics workflow post-data warehouse, ensuring reports provide value and align with business insights.

Requirements

We are looking for a candidate with:

Background in Data Science, Engineering, or Analytics (or relevant studies/experience).
Experience with Data Warehouse concepts and design principles
Attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy in data reporting.
Experience with SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Familiarity with Python for data processing and automation.
Understanding of data modeling concepts (fact/dimension tables, OLAP databases).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in an iterative, evolving data environment.
Interest in Business Intelligence tools and analytics infrastructure.
Benefits
6-month internship (approx. 2 days per week on average). The duration can be extended, and a higher weekly commitment is possible. Location: Zurich, with the option for home office. However, we prefer if the candidate can come to the office occasionally. Flexible working hours and days – we understand academic commitments and exams. You will be part of a growing and talented team that is striving towards our vision of creating ​a prosperous and connected global coffee community You will be working in an exciting expansion phase of the company as we come towards our 10th anniversary Your work will truly make a difference within the company, creating meaningful change; helping producers and roasters to create stronger supply chains and more resilient businesses that will help these independent entrepreneurs to thrive We are dedicated and have bold ambitions to create change. We also offer flexible working hours and 5 weeks of holidays and a real community office culture.
Show more

Our online marketplace connects coffee farmers directly with roasters in Europe and the USA, supported by logistics, insurance, and financing. Honored with the Best Innovation award by the European Coffee Industry Association in 2015 for our launch and again in 2022 for our achievements, we currently serve over 1,000 sellers and roasters in more than 50 countries.

Title: Sales Controller, Sales Data Analyst (m/f/d) 100%
Description:
Our client GC International AG is one of the leading companies in the development, production, and distribution of a very wide range of oral healthcare and dentistry products. Since its beginning, GC has always embraced innovation and ensured the production of high-quality, pioneering products and services. For its global sales management team, we are looking for an




Sales Controller, Sales Data Analyst (m/f/d) 100%




In this newly created role, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting sales data from various regions, including Europe, USA, Asia, and Japan. Your primary focus will be on enhancing the transparency and accuracy of the sales reporting. You will work closely with regional sales teams and other stakeholders to consolidate data and provide actionable insights.

As Sales Controller, you can analyze complex data sets and use data systems (ERP) to gain actionable insights that support strategic decision making around pricing and sales performance.




Main Responsibilities




Data Analysis: Analyze sales data from data systems (SAP, Power BI, Tableau, and Excel) to identify trends, pricing strategies, and margins.
Reporting: Prepare monthly and quarterly reports for the board, focusing on KPIs and sales analytics.
System Development: Further develop the ERP and reporting systems to create a unified and transparent reporting structure.
Collaboration: Work closely with peers in regional organizations and other stakeholders to gather and consolidate data.
Team Management: Supervise and guide a junior Sales Coordinator in data collection and consolidation.




Your Qualifications

Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field.
Relevant experience in finance, sales analysis, or controlling.
Experience working in an intercultural environment.
Experience in project management.




What we are looking for:




Analytical Mindset: Strong affinity for numbers and structured work approach.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and Excel. Familiarity with ERP systems, particularly SAP.
Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders; capable of enforcing transparency and cooperation from regional organizations.
Pragmatic and Detail-Oriented: Focused on continuous improvement and optimizing processes and tools.
Independent and Self-Motivated: Highly independent and driven by the challenge of optimizing systems and processes.




Do you want to become part of an international company with more than 100 years of commitment and legacy for dental and oral care innovations? Join the team on a transformative journey where innovation meets data-driven success. In this role, you thrive in an intercultural, international environment and can make a significant impact on sales analytics and price strategies.







GC International AG is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates.




Please send us your application documents by email to backoffice@debord.ch, for the attention of Ms. Andrea Nienaber, Managing Partner DE BORD INTERNATIONAL. Discretion is a matter of course.







DE BORD INTERNATIONAL • Zürichbergstrasse 38 • CH-8044 Zürich • Telefon +41 44 382 17 17 • backoffice@debord.ch • www.debord.ch • www.lladvisorygroup.com

Title: Energy Data Management - Business Analyst
Description:
🧩 Darwin Partners, un véritable partenaire de carrière 🧩




Chez Darwin Partners, nous ne nous contentons pas de recruter : nous accompagnons chaque consultant dans son évolution professionnelle en lui proposant des missions qui correspondent à ses aspirations.

Avec une culture dynamique et axée sur l’impact, nous connectons les meilleurs talents IT à des projets ambitieux, tout en cultivant des relations humaines et authentiques.

👥 Nos clients ? Des entreprises innovantes dans différents secteurs d’activité (banque, assurance, finance, industrie, e-commerce, marchés publics, trading, médical ...) et des projets à forte valeur ajoutée sur différents métiers (étude & développement, fonctionnel, agilité, infrastructure, réseaux, data, cloud ...)

🤝 Notre engagement ? Un suivi régulier, une écoute active et une véritable proximité avec nos talents.

✨ Notre promesse ? Des projets enrichissants et une rémunération à la hauteur de votre talent.







Nous recherchons un Senior Business Analyst ayant une solide expérience dans le secteur de l’énergie, idéalement avec une expertise en gestion de données et/ou finance. L'objectif est de rejoindre l'équipe spécialisée energy data management qui joue un rôle clé dans la gestion des outils d'onboarding/CRM, du portail client et des systèmes de gestion des données énergétiques en Europe, aux États-Unis et sur d'autres marchés en expansion.




🔒Vos missions 🔒

Être en contact direct avec les équipes business pour comprendre leurs besoins et proposer des solutions adaptées.
Organiser le travail des développeurs et gérer la roadmap en coordination avec le Team Lead EDM IT.
Maintenir et suivre les backlogs.
Rédiger et exécuter les tests.
Assurer un reporting




🧠 Le profil que nous recherchons 🧠




Excellente capacité à expliquer des problématiques complexes et à faire passer des messages clairs.
Capacité à travailler en autonomie tout en étant orienté client et esprit d’équipe.
Excellentes compétences en communication.
Anglais courant obligatoire
Expérience confirmée dans le secteur de l’énergie et/ou de la finance.










💡 Ce qui fait notre différence au sein de Darwin Partners 💡

Une entreprise à taille humaine et smart, avec une approche personnalisée et bienveillante. Aujourd’hui, nous sommes près de 110 collaborateurs à nous engager au quotidien pour satisfaire nos clients !

Des projets stratégiques et stimulants, où vous pourrez vraiment avoir un impact.

Un accompagnement sur-mesure, avec un suivi régulier et des perspectives d’évolution.




📌 Notre processus de recrutement 📌

Nous savons que votre temps est précieux, alors chez Darwin Partners, nous faisons simple et efficace !

1️⃣ Premier échange RH – Un moment pour parler de vous, de vos ambitions et de nos opportunités.

2️⃣ Entretien technique et métier – Discussion avec un manager pour valider votre expertise et votre vision de l’agilité.

2️⃣ (Bis) Test technique ou échange avec un consultant expert – Selon le poste, une évaluation technique ou un échange approfondi avec un consultant de notre réseau pour affiner l’adéquation avec la mission et vous donner envie de nous rejoindre.

3️⃣ Entretien client – Rencontre avec l’entreprise partenaire pour un dernier échange avant le GO final.




📩 Prêt(e) à nous rejoindre ?

N’hésitez pas à postuler directement via cette annonce en cliquant sur l’onglet “Candidature Simplifiée”.

Title: Internship Data Sciene (m/f/d) 100% - 12 Months
Description:
At GF, we see our company as a forward-thinking leader in our field. Since 1802, we have been embracing innovations and sustainable solutions of the highest quality that add value to people’s lives around the globe.

Your tasks


Serve as a data strategist to identify and integrate new datasets that can be leveraged for pricing and other strategic initiatives, and work closely with the sales companies, Finance and Product Management to develop the relevant models
Collaborate with the sales companies, Finance and Product Management to develop an under-standing of needs
Identify relevant data sources and sets to mine for business needs, and collect large structured and unstructured datasets and variables
Devise and utilize algorithms and models to mine big-data stores; perform data and error analysis to improve models; clean and validate data for uniformity and accuracy
Research and devise innovative statistical models for data analysis to help solve problems across various domains and industries
Analyze data for trends and patterns, and interpret data with clear objectives in mind
Enable smarter business processes by using analytics for meaningful insights


Your profile


Degree in Social and Economic Data Science, Econometrics, or a related field
Proficiency with data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis
Some experience in pattern recognition and predictive modelling
Experience with Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau, SQL, and programming languages (ex: Java/Python, SAS)
Only EU/EFTA candidates or candidates with a valid Swiss working permit


Benefits

Clear vision and purpose

"We are a sustainability and innovation leader providing superior customer value" is our vision and this is what guides us. Our purpose "becoming better every day - since 1802" is what inspires us in our daily work.

Sustainability and innovation focus

We have high sustainability and innovation goals. Let's work towards a sustainable future together.

Excellent learning tools

At GF we provide development opportunities for everyone. We offer global learning tools as well as trainings and specialized courses.

Great career opportunities

GF as a global acting company provides many opportunities regarding career growth. We also offer a dedicated talent management process (MyNextBigStep@GF) to boost your career.

Your contact

Kristina Peric

Expert HR Services

+41 52 547 10 54

Ebnatstrasse 111

8201 Schaffhausen

Switzerland

Your work route

Switzerland, Schaffhausen

Who We Are

GF Piping Systems is the world's leading supplier of piping systems. We enable the safe and sustainable transport of fluids. Our business is driven by industry-leading sustainability levels, innovation through digital solutions and investment in a culture based on performance, learning and caring.

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Why Join Us

The Ermenegildo Zegna Group is one of Italy’s most famous family driven enterprises and a world leader in luxury menswear. Founded in 1910, Zegna is deeply grounded in history and craftsmanship, yet always at the forefront of contemporary innovation and style.

We are pioneers who embrace change, take ownership of our actions and work to create the world we want.

With over 500 points of sale and 7,000 employees worldwide, we’re as proud of our people as our products and look for others that share our passion and commitment to excellence and authenticity.

Your Opportunity

Location: Stabio (20% smart working)

As an IT Business Analyst, you will be a member of the Planning and Consolidated application maintenance and development services support team, and you will focus your responsibilities on projects and application maintenance aimed at users located in all areas of the world where the Zegna Group operates.

How Will You Contribute

  • Technical support on Planning and Consolidation applications and resolution of related problems;
  • Implementation of evolutions on systems and/or coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Drafting of the technical specifications necessary for the evolution and maintenance of the systems;
  • Coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Support to users in the testing and training phases for the start-up and use of new features and new applications;
  • Technical support for users and resolution of related problems;
  • Management of relationships with internal customers.

Who You Are

You are a professional with strong data analysis and team working skills, with experience understanding business processes and mature project management skills.

You Have

  • Degree in Economics or Engineering or Computer science (or similar);
  • At least 3 years of experience in similar roles in the IT function of structured companies and/or consultancy companies;
  • In-depth knowledge of the SAP BPC system (knowledge of the main EPM tools will be considered a plus);
  • Fluency in spoken and written Italian and English;
  • Willing to travel.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Online Crime Detection Data Analyst
Description:
Adecco

For an international company in the global Agribusiness market in Basel we are looking for an Online Crime Detection Data Analyst (f/m/d) - temporary assignment, 100%, min 8 months

Responsibilities


Creation of an online brand protection ?knowledge hub? (intranet page)
Compile relevant statistics and analyses infringement trends.
Coordinates takedown activity with third party vendors
Assist the client's Corporate Security team delivering its mission aiming at protecting internal people, and assets against crime.
Deepen understanding of our essential Security programs in the area of asset protection, related to intellectual property infringements, regulatory issues, and other fraudulent activities found by various scrapping tools in relation to a variety of digital channels including: online ecommerce platforms, social media channels, mobile applications, and domain names.
Also to coordinates takedown activity with third party vendors, legal counsel, or through direct action.
Responsible for researching and compiling takedown argumentation based on local laws, regulations and platform rules that can be utilized to remove fraudulent activity.


Profile


Business administration, law or criminal science background required
Project Management, process improvement
MS Office tools (Words, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)
Experience working with databases
Experience in creating editorial content
Fluent in English (verbal and written)
Problem-solving, quality focus, fast learner, able to work under pressure-tight schedule
Team player
Ability to understand the business environment, ?must win? priorities, and experience impactful risk-based-intelligence-led security programs to support business
Self-reliant ways of working and ability to take initiative


Benefits


flexible working hours
modern work spaces
fair renumeration
further benefits at the client's site

HTML:
Adecco

For an international company in the global Agribusiness market in Basel we are looking for an Online Crime Detection Data Analyst (f/m/d) - temporary assignment, 100%, min 8 months

Responsibilities

  • Creation of an online brand protection ?knowledge hub? (intranet page)
  • Compile relevant statistics and analyses infringement trends.
  • Coordinates takedown activity with third party vendors
  • Assist the client's Corporate Security team delivering its mission aiming at protecting internal people, and assets against crime.
  • Deepen understanding of our essential Security programs in the area of asset protection, related to intellectual property infringements, regulatory issues, and other fraudulent activities found by various scrapping tools in relation to a variety of digital channels including: online ecommerce platforms, social media channels, mobile applications, and domain names.
  • Also to coordinates takedown activity with third party vendors, legal counsel, or through direct action.
  • Responsible for researching and compiling takedown argumentation based on local laws, regulations and platform rules that can be utilized to remove fraudulent activity.

Profile

  • Business administration, law or criminal science background required
  • Project Management, process improvement
  • MS Office tools (Words, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)
  • Experience working with databases
  • Experience in creating editorial content
  • Fluent in English (verbal and written)
  • Problem-solving, quality focus, fast learner, able to work under pressure-tight schedule
  • Team player
  • Ability to understand the business environment, ?must win? priorities, and experience impactful risk-based-intelligence-led security programs to support business
  • Self-reliant ways of working and ability to take initiative

Benefits

  • flexible working hours
  • modern work spaces
  • fair renumeration
  • further benefits at the client's site

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Big Data/ Pyspark Engineer – 620-720 CHF Per Day – 6 Month Initial Contract – Investment Banking – Zurich (Hybrid)




Job Description:

10+ years of IT experience with in-depth big data technology
Conceptualize and design big data system involving Hadoop, PySpark, Hive.
Extensively worked on Python and pyspark Programming
Experience in building complex data pipelines using Spark and especially PySpark
Experience in performance tuning Spark application.
Experience in scheduling and running spark applications.
Experience in Airflow, Databricks & Azure is added plus
Design functional and technical architectures
Develop applications on the big data platform using open source programming languages
Hands-on experience with fundamental Hadoop tools and technologies
Work closely with Administrator, Architect and Developers
Knowledge on Cluster management and storage mechanism in Big Data Cloud




Essential Skills:

Strong analytical skills
Strong framework design skills
Strong code standardization skills

Title: Process Analytics Technician (m/w/d)
Description:
Process Analytics Technician

Aktuell suchen wir einen Process Analytics Technician. In dieser Position sind Sie verantwortlich für die Installation und Wartung von Prozessanalysegeräten und -systemen und arbeiten eng mit verschiedenen Teams zusammen.

Hauptaufgaben und Verantwortung:

Sicherstellung der optimalen Verfügbarkeit von Prozessanalysegeräten sowie deren sichere und vorschriftsmäßige Installation und Inbetriebnahme.
Instandhaltung von Prozessanalysengeräten als wesentlicher Bestandteil der Prozesssicherheit und Emissionsüberwachung.
Kalibrierung vorhandener Analysegeräte und Installation neuester Analysegeräte.
Planung und Durchführung von Projekten unter Berücksichtigung von Terminen und Kosten.
Verantwortung für die Qualität und Sicherheit der Prozessanalytik-Ausrüstung.

Qualifikationen und Erfahrung:

Abgeschlossene Ausbildung in einem relevanten technischen oder naturwissenschaftlichen Bereich.
Erfahrung in der chemischen Industrie ist wünschenswert.
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.
Vorteilhaft sind Erfahrungen in der Prozessanalytik sowie in der Wartung von Spektrometern und GCs.
Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Entscheidungsfreude.
Selbstständige Arbeitsweise und analytisches Denken sind für die Wartungstätigkeiten unerlässlich.

Rahmenbedingungen:

Laufzeit: 6-12 Monate (genaueres wird noch bekannt gegeben)
Standort: Visp


Sthree Switzerland is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst

Commodities Trading

Switzerland

Our client is a leading energy trading firm specializing in electricity, gas, and oil markets. They leverage quantitative models to optimize trading and risk management.

They are seeking a Senior Quantitative Analyst with a PhD (preferred) and extensive commodities trading experience. This role focuses on developing VaR models, analyzing KPIs, and optimizing risk strategies. Strong Python programming skills and deep market understanding are essential.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and refine risk models, including VaR calculations.
Analyze energy market structures to enhance strategies.
Work with trading and risk teams to improve model performance.
Implement quantitative models and algorithms in Python.
Assess KPIs and valuation methodologies.




Key Requirements

Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or related field. PhD preferred.
Several years of experience in a commodities trading firm.
Expertise in VaR modelling and risk assessment.
Strong Python programming skills.
Deep understanding of energy markets and pricing structures.
Ability to collaborate with trading and risk teams.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analytics Engineer to help us implement new data sets and migrate existing data sets to our on-premises data lake, which will eventually migrate to the cloud.




We are looking for a Senior Data Analytics Engineer who can take ownership of tasks, deliver stable, incremental changes frequently, and ensure thorough testing to maintain high-quality standards




This role is only suitable for candidates based in Switzerland, or looking to relocate.




Tasks:




• Develop required code for end-to-end data pipelines with optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources. Incorporate business rules and functional capabilities, security, data retention requirements, etc.

• Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed design.

• Participate and contribute to overall data architecture and design.

• Work with stakeholders including business area sponsors, product owners, data architects, data engineers, project managers, and business analysts to assist them with their data-related technical issues and support their data needs.

• Ensure effective design and development of system architectures through frequent product deliveries, employing effective governance methods for transparency and communication.

• Remain up to date with industry standards and technological advancements that will improve the quality of your output.

• Interact with the business to identify, capture, and analyse business requirement




Requirements:




• Minimum of 7 years of work experience in modern data technologies as a Data Analytics Engineer or similar role.

• Experience in building data ingestion pipelines for data warehouse and/or data lake architecture. As well as strong experience in data modelling, design patterns, and building highly scalable applications.

• Hands-on development using open-source data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, HBase, Kafka, Impala, ELK, etc., preferably with Cloudera.

• Experience working with relational databases such as Oracle, SQL Server, etc.

• Strong experience with Python.

• Proficiency in English

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.


Basic Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
  • Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
  • Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
  • Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
  • Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About the Company

Start the New Year with an exciting opportunity to join a global leader in Capital Markets. This is a unique chance to be part of a dynamic and innovative organization, recognized for its expertise in high-touch, hybrid, and fully electronic trading venues. Serving a prestigious client base—including the largest investment banks, commercial banks, hedge funds, asset managers, and energy market participants.




About the Role

To support this exciting growth, a Data Architect is now sought with expertise in SQL and a passion for problem-solving. The role will be pivotal in shaping the company’s data architecture and driving solutions that align with its strategic goals.




Responsibilities

Design, deploy, and maintain data architecture solutions, including data models and management practices, aligned with business needs.
Develop and implement governance and security standards, data quality rules, and naming conventions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Lead the development and implementation of data solutions, providing technical guidance and expertise.
Evaluate and recommend data management tools and technologies to support organizational goals.
Create and maintain detailed documentation for data architecture, workflows, and technical specifications.




Qualifications

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related fields. Minimum of 3 years of experience in data architecture or related roles.




Required Skills

Strong expertise in SQL and experience implementing pipelines with DBT or similar tools.
Proficiency in data modelling, data, business logic
Experience defining data frameworks for master data, such as clients, products, and employees.
Knowledge of Linux and Python is advantageous.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills.
Fluency in spoken and written English.




Preferred Skills







Pay range and compensation package

For more information, please send your CV to hans.kroese@trm-international.com or call him on 07539 966260.




Equal Opportunity Statement

We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is valued and respected. We welcome applications from all individuals regardless of backgrounds or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst

Type: Full-Time

Start Date - ASAP

Location – Geneva, Switzerland




JOB DESCRIPTION:




My client, a leader in their field is looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to assist in supporting the Trading Desks day-to-day. Helping the desks understand Risk / PnL, discussing and developing Trading Tools (Excel, Python) and enhancing the existing analytics library (C++).




DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:




The role represents an excellent opportunity for a Quant to work alongside Interest Rate and FX Traders, understand how these markets behave and deliver trading tools and analysis. You will be required to stay up to date on the latest technologies and market developments and researching these and implementing where appropriate.

The primary asset classes in focus will be Rates and FX - with some exposure to Credit and Equity.




Duties will involve:

Day-to-day support of Trading Desks
Maintain and build Front Office Trading/Analysis tools
Potential to develop core analytics library
Dialogue with Traders, Risk Managers and other departments as necessary
Deputise for the Head of Quant Analysis as required




EXPERIENCE:




5-10 years hands-on experience as a FO Quant/Strat
Knowledge and a passion for Interest Rate and/or FX markets and analytics
Good degree in a quantitative discipline




TECHNICAL SKILLS:

Essential

Python
Excel/VBA




Desirable

C++
ML / AI
SQL

Show more

Title: Data Modeler / Business Analyst - Banking & Big Data (m/f/d) 80-100% (Ref.Nr.: 44237)
Description:
For an exciting project with our client in Zurich (remote work possible only within Switzerland), we are looking for a Data Modeler / Business Analyst - Banking & Big Data (m/f/d).




Key Facts
Start: 01.04.2025
Duration: 9 months /
Capacity: 100 %
Employment type: Body Leasing
Job site: Zürich
Job country: Schweiz




Your tasks




• Responsible for capturing and modelling data requirements, data definitions, business rules, data quality requirements, and logical data models




• Create logical and physical data models using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy




• Closely collaborate with the Data & Analytics Program Management and stakeholders to co-design enterprise Data Strategy and Common Data Model




• Development, coordination, and implementation of principles, best practices, guidelines, and standards for Common data models and their consistency




• Work with the development team to implement data strategies, build data flows, and support development of conceptual data models




Must have competences




• 5 years of professional experience with physical and relational data modelling




• Understand and translating business needs into data models supporting long-term solutions




• Experience in Big Data environments with strong understanding of data modelling tools (cleansing, Meta Data)




• Well-versed in performing reverse engineering of existing physical data models




• Experience in evaluating already existing data models and physical databases for variables and discrepancies




• Expert knowledge of metadata management and related tools




• Expertise in reference architecture, particularly in relation to integrated, data-driven ecosystems and solutions




• Solid know-how around financial data classifications / sensitivity




• Excellent business and IT stakeholder management skills




• Fluent in English, good knowledge of German is a plus




Nice to have competences




• Higher education preferred




• Know-how in agile project management and methods (e.g. Scrum, SAFe)




• Knowledge of banking data products / financial sector




Additional information




- We are seeking consultants for long-term engagements (body leasing: temporary employment via Wavestone).- The project is based in Zurich (3 days on-site, 2 days remote within Switzerland only - per week).




Let’s power the future together
From Business Case to Implementation: As a leading consulting firm for strategic transformations, we are a trusted partner for our clients—and for our employees. Responsible, high-performing, and always with a focus on people. #WeAreWavestone
With our 360° portfolio of consulting services, we combine top-tier industry expertise with a wide range of cross-sector skills, work interdisciplinary, and think outside the box. This allows us to offer our partner companies and freelancers comprehensive perspectives within our own projects, while also supporting them as a long-standing framework agreement partner in filling project vacancies—promptly and directly.




We look forward to hearing from you!




Your direct contact at Wavestone
Vivek Kandiah
Phone: +41 76 223 85 15
E-Mail: vivek.kandiah@wavestone.eu

This allows us to offer our partner companies and freelancers comprehensive perspectives within our own projects, while also supporting them as a long-standing framework agreement partner in filling project vacancies—promptly and directly.


We look forward to hearing from you!


Your direct contact at Wavestone
Vivek Kandiah
Phone: +41 76 223 85 15
E-Mail: vivek.kandiah@wavestone.eu

Title: Data Engineer (100%)
Description:
To strengthen our AI / Data team, we are looking for a Data Engineer that will play a key role in supporting us data modeling, quality, validation, analysis, governance, warehouse and ETL pipelines. The position of Data Engineer is a full-time and permanent position based in our office in the Basel, Switzerland. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Data modelling: design and implement data models that support business requirements and optimise for performance and scalability on large datasets.
Data quality and validation: provide support and solutions to develop data quality checks within the pipelines to ensure data is always within its expectations.
Data integration: integrate data from all sources within the company and make it equally available for local and remote organisations.
Data analysis: develop and maintain insightful reports and dashboards to provide business metrics, trends and performances.
Data governance: support ensuring data compliance and harmonisation by developing strong and meaningful collaboration with data governance team policies and regulations.
Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines: create and maintain fast and efficient data pipelines from different relational and non-relational sources - MySQL, Apache Solr, MongoDB, APIs into a centralised data lake and data warehouse, using the Apache Airflow orchestrator.
Data Warehouse tuning and optimisation: contribute to the optimisation and performance of the orchestrator and data warehouse to ensure durable environment health and scalability.
Cross-functional collaboration: collaborate within an international environment to provide your expertise to data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.


Requirements


Degree in computer science or data engineering certification.
Knowledge of Python programming language.
Experience with Pandas or Polars (Dataframes), SQLAlchemy (database toolkit), Streamlit is a plus.
Hands-on experience with SQL.
Experience with relational databases. Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL-specific features is a plus.
Good understanding of NoSQL databases: Apache Solr, MongoDB.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and organisational skills.
Technical expertise in data mining and modelling techniques.
Basic understanding of Machine Learning models.
Proven ability to work independently and within a team.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
Copy of ID and Diplomas
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:



https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub


Show more

Title: Data Engineer – Lugano, Switzerland
Description:
Data Engineer - Lugano, Switzerland




Tech stack: Data Engineer; MS SQL, SSIS, C#, Data Governance, Data Security (Data Masking, Encryption), Data Catalogs, Power BI, Tableau, Compliance Management, Financial Data Platforms, KPI Calculation, Data Architecture, Data Structures, Data Loading Optimization, ETL, Database Management, System Reliability, System Scalability, Performance Optimization, Business Intelligence, Integration with Enterprise Systems, SQL Server, .NET, Software Development, Automation, Data Integration, Advanced Analytics, Cloud Platforms (Azure, AWS); Data Engineer.




We're thrilled to present an exciting opportunity for Data Engineers with expertise in MS-SQL and C# to join the cutting edge of fintech innovation! Work alongside the brightest minds in private wealth management and financial software development, driving revolutionary advancements in asset management. Our client's latest product release has sparked a transformative wave in the industry, delivering personalized, scalable wealth management solutions like never before. If you're ready to shape the future of finance, join us on this thrilling journey into the next era of fintech excellence!




Our client is looking for passionate Data Engineer candidates with experience in some or all of the following (full training will be provided to fill any gaps in your skill set): (Tech stack: Data Engineer; MS SQL, SSIS, C#, Data Governance, Data Security (Data Masking, Encryption), Data Catalogs, Power BI, Tableau, Compliance Management, Financial Data Platforms, KPI Calculation, Data Architecture, Data Structures, Data Loading Optimization, ETL, Database Management, System Reliability, System Scalability, Performance Optimization, Business Intelligence, Integration with Enterprise Systems, SQL Server, .NET, Software Development, Automation, Data Integration, Advanced Analytics, Cloud Platforms (Azure, AWS); Data Engineer.




This is your opportunity to be part of a new, technically challenging project and to be involved in the creation of a new application from scratch. Fintech is booming and our client are fast becoming a leader of this market!




All Data Engineer positions come with the following benefits:




3 hours ‘free time’ each week to investigate new technologies.
An annual training allowance of CHF 4,500.
27 days holiday (excluding Public Holidays) plus your birthday off.
Flexible working hours.




Location: Lugano, Switzerland/ Hybrid Working




Salary: CHF 80,000 - CHF 95,000 + Bonus + Pension + Benefits




To apply for this position please send your CV to Charlie Skipper at Noir.

Applicants must be based in Switzerland or Italy and have the right to work in Switzerland even though remote working is available.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.
